674682933.name: The largest collection of masks in the world
674682933.author: a TripAdvisor user
674682933.reviewBody: This museum features the incredibly large ( ca. 3000) collection of Mexican and worldwide masks that belonged to the artist Rafael Coronel (Pedro Coronel\u2019s brother). Even for the person not \u201cinto\u201d masks, the museum is well worth a visit.

664559968.name: Amazing
664559968.author: a TripAdvisor user
664559968.reviewBody: It\'s hard to imagine any other concept for a mask after you see the 3,000 displayed in the museum. Or what the additional 8,000 masks in storage are like. This is a mind-blowing display of masks from around the world. Human pelvic bones, armadillio shells, corn husks and animal horns are just a few of the masks materials.

659024232.name: Amazing collection of local and regional art.
659024232.author: a TripAdvisor user
659024232.reviewBody:
Definitely our favorite museum in Zacatecas and, frankly, one of our favorite in the world.  We have been many times.  

The mask collection is unparalleled.  The other local are is amazing.  The location is remarkable and has its own fascinating history.

The museum does tend to keep odd hours, so it is good to confirm ahead of time.  If your Spanish is rusty, you might want to hire a guide to help with the text on the displays.  My Spanish is solidly middle of the road and I was fine reading without help (well, maybe a little help from Google translator!).

642255168.name: Hire a guide (not open wed)
642255168.author: a TripAdvisor user
642255168.reviewBody:
We past this museum while on one of the many open top tour buses. It’s a striking former monastery so we were keen to go. So we climbed the hill (it’s about 10mins walk from the cathedral) and found it was closed! It’s closed every wed even over holiday periods. 

So we returned the following day and after putting all bags, including hand bags into a locker) we were asked if we wanted a guide for 300 pesos. As he spoke English I said yes. Thank goodness I did. 

The museum is basically the items collected by Mexican artist Rafael Coronel and his family. Mainly he collected wooden masks used in traditional ceremonies. There are over 3000 of them and without a guide I suspect we would have walked through each room, given a brief glance and upon leaving thought , “ well that was creepy”. 

But with a guide we learned about the masks, their purpose, how they vary by region, the influence of the church etc, plus the history of the magnificent building. 

So after about an hour of saying “well I would never have guessed that” we arrived back at the entrance and explored the grounds, that also house a number of sculptures (see photos).

Im summary, well worth going, if you invest in a guide.

Also note, that the traders outside the entrance sell similar items to the local Shops but far cheaper.

641363023.name: Excellent museum
641363023.author: a TripAdvisor user
641363023.reviewBody: I was astonished by the quality of museums in Zacatecas and this one is no exception. Beautiful exhibition on traditional masks and other pre-hispanic items.  You have to leave your bag at the ticket booth.

635629480.name: Excellent collection!
635629480.author: a TripAdvisor user
635629480.reviewBody: Great selection of pieces exhibited at this Zacatecas City museum. Conveniently located is a "must" for art lovers visiting this magnificent colonial city in Mexico. Impressive murals are elegantly displayed in a modern, minimalist atmosphere distinctive of the contemporary Mexican architecture.

618061593.name: A real find!
618061593.author: a TripAdvisor user
618061593.reviewBody: Like his brother, Francisco Colonel collected art. The collection, especially the masks, is amazing, as is the building, partially a ruin, in which it\'s located. I look forward to returning to Zacatecas!

599996062.name: Unique, fun, and beautiful
599996062.author: a TripAdvisor user
599996062.reviewBody: Zacatecas continues to impress me with the quality of its museums and this is no exception. 3500 masks from every culture in Mexico. Fascinating, mysterious and artistic. There are some beautiful mud figurines as well and DO NOT miss the rooms with marionettes. Impressive. And all housed in a former convent.

598321219.name: Wonderful museum and venue.
598321219.author: a TripAdvisor user
598321219.reviewBody: I loved the venue, the ruins, and the beautiful  artwork. Rafael Coronel is a wonderful artist. It is an amazing place; you can easily spend an hour or two here.

569943690.name: Labyrinth & Masquerade
569943690.author: a TripAdvisor user
569943690.reviewBody: I visited the town of Zacatecas in early 2017 with my family & friends and, the museum of Rafael Coronel is well recommended - For a small fee 20-30 pesos, you would walk the many rooms and corridors the museum counts where you will discover the diversity of masks within the Mexican traditions and across states. It was a delightful visit, a must go.

675343941.name: To much history
675343941.author: a TripAdvisor user
675343941.reviewBody: Is amazing place, when you go there please bring a hat and sunscreen is to much hot place right now I understand \u201cLa quemada\u201d = the Burn. \n\nThe temples and all the walls, rooms, everything is good... if you arrive there by yourself they can give you a tour with just a small tip, good persons and to much history there.

659711978.name: A place not to miss in Zacatecas
659711978.author: a TripAdvisor user
659711978.reviewBody: Amazing structure that leaved more questions than answers. Who were people that built it, why they left it? Was it conquered. Breath taking views. A pyramid not to miss!

646179161.name: They build the city on the hill!
646179161.author: a TripAdvisor user
646179161.reviewBody: People build this city along the hill. You can go all the way to the top of this city, the view from there is very nice!

645387368.name: Amazing
645387368.author: a TripAdvisor user
645387368.reviewBody: The history, immensity, uniqueness, and views make this a must visit site. Off the beaten path but on a good road. Truly amazing!

637743801.name: Nice Visit Ruins
637743801.author: a TripAdvisor user
637743801.reviewBody: As part of our Mexican history you must visit la quemada , it has a great view and very nice ruins with Great Lake view

636185292.name: Lovely ruins
636185292.author: a TripAdvisor user
636185292.reviewBody: Impressive site. Well worth the trip from Zacatecas. We took a local bus which dropped us off at the highway turn-off, then walked the remaining 1 1/2 miles to the site. Museum is currently closed.

618060691.name: Tour
618060691.author: a TripAdvisor user
618060691.reviewBody: I visited La Quemada with a small, city-sponsored tour group - two young guides, a Mexico City mother, and her young son. There\'s an interesting museum at the base of the citadel. Climbing it was a challenge, but the view made it well worth the effort. I could even see, in the fields below, where the ancient roads were. Little is known about this place except that it was burned, probably by the workers of its society. La Quemada means the charred place.

598502578.name: Nice place
598502578.author: a TripAdvisor user
598502578.reviewBody: Nice place, view and is a big walk if you want to go up all the way. Make sure you bring good shoes and water. Too bad the musea is closed for remodeling.

555967486.name: unique
555967486.author: a TripAdvisor user
555967486.reviewBody: unique archaelogical site. It represents he boundary between mesoamerica and aridoamerica, between the builders of pyramids and the nomds of the north.

551510243.name: Quiet site, good views
551510243.author: a TripAdvisor user
551510243.reviewBody:
The site is located approximately 45min outside of Zacatecas. You can take a tour that lasta eight hours and includes a visit to the pueblo mágico Jerez (500pesos, leaves at 10am from Zacatecas) or you can rent a car / taxi. Technically you can also take a public bus, which leaves you at the main road and then have to hike 3-4 km to the entrance, given that it is a good climb up and down the ruins and it can get very very hot, I would think about it twicr.

We rented a taxi, since we had been to Jerez by public transport the day before. The taxi, arranged through the hotel (this way they write down which taxi you take). The cab cost 1100 pesos, included pick up at the hotel, 2-3 hours waiting time and trip back to the city.

La Quemada is a quiet site with only some small groups, there climb straight to the top will take you at most 30min (I did it 7 months pregnant). From the top you get some beautiful views of thr surrounding fields, lakes and mountains and can see all the way to Zacatecas. You can ask one of the gentlemen waiting at the bottom to asl as your guide, I believe they work based on donations. There are some signs explaining the sights, but if you are interested in more, a guide might be a good idea.

Bring lots of water, there isn't any at the sight, no vendors nothing and it tends to get hot, even in winter. Bring sunscreen and hats.

Entrance costs 60pesos per person, nationals and residence permit holders get in for free on Sundays.

523864204.name: Family trip
523864204.author: a TripAdvisor user
523864204.reviewBody: A drive from the city but well worth the trip. You can climb to the top if your up to it. The view of the surrounding land and mountains are quite relaxing. You can sit under the shade and enjoy the view.

509462667.name: Coolest Ruins Ever!!
509462667.author: a TripAdvisor user
509462667.reviewBody: Bring your hiking boots as there are many stairs to climb. We went with a group so we got our own travel guide. He was so well versed in the history of the ruins. It was absolutely an amazing experience!!

502893452.name: Trip to the mysterious past
502893452.author: a TripAdvisor user
502893452.reviewBody: Large ruins in the middle of nowhere. Best is to travel by car. Expect a long walk uphill. As a reward you will see impressive panoramas. The place feels more authentic then "popular" places like Chich\u00e9n Itz\u00e1 or Teotihuac\u00e1n. Maybe because it is less preserved and not so crowded. But definitely worth a visit if you are in Zacatecas and have a car.

500066443.name: AMAZING :-)
500066443.author: a TripAdvisor user
500066443.reviewBody:
Had a free weekend in Zacatecas so decided to head out to La Quemada As I was told that it's worth a visit and I like History.
So fired up my '77 Ford and hit the Highway 54 to Guadalajara Only 40 minutes later there was a sign 10kms take a left - And sure enough There it was clearly signed off the Highway 54
Stopped at the entrance Signed in and paid my $100 MX.
Parked up and went for a walk.
So important things to Pack... Depending on length of stay and temperature 1 litre of water per hour. Sun cream Hat! and some snacks! 
I was lucky as was a cloud day but to be honest I still felt the heat at the bottom... Up at the top there is a lovely breeze.
So I started to climb - Man I am fit but this was tough - So regular breaks are advised! I had a look around at everything.
I even walked to the other peak around 25 minutes, then along the top of the wall back to the large Pyramid Amazing!
There were also 3 guides there on the Saturday that I went and they would walk around with you and explain more about the building.
Great 3 -4 hours for me and would recommend if you are interested in the History / Culture of Mexican People

478719578.name: Visitiing the past
478719578.author: a TripAdvisor user
478719578.reviewBody:
You must visit this place if you come to Zacatecas, you will enjoy the history of these buildings, and if it is secure and the weather is good, la Quemada is a beautiful place for camping, with a night full of stars.

WARNINGS:
> Use sunscreen
> Bring a hat
> Watch the kids (snakes, dehydration)
> Bring water
> Be careful with the snakes (unlikely but possible to be attacked)

476178027.name: The Burnt - La Quemada - The rich history from the natives
476178027.author: a TripAdvisor user
476178027.reviewBody: La Quemada/The Burnt is a site for hiking and seeing the architectural ruins of the natives that used to live. It was destroyed by a fire(most likely lightning) and was built A.D 600 to A.D 750.If you look closely there will be two large brown lines at a place, hose are ancient roadways connecting to 20 different smaller sites. It also has a pyramid that is called the "Votiva pyramid". It has steep steps and most probably is the largest structure in the site itself. This also the largest living habitat in Mesoamerica. The pyramid was not destroyed by fire(far from living sites) but by wind and rain. All this was made out of clay, making it flammable and easily destroyable. The cost for admission ticket from 13-65 years is 55 pesos. All below 13 and above 65 are free.

468822496.name: Not quite Chichen Itza, but still great.
468822496.author: a TripAdvisor user
468822496.reviewBody: Very interesting location and history.  It can be very hot, take some water.  For the most part you are allowed to just roam the ruins as you wish.

467907603.name: Good walk, nice view
467907603.author: a TripAdvisor user
467907603.reviewBody:
1 bus per hour in each way. Take the bus to Villanueva.
From Zacatecas bicentenario terminal around 8/8.30am. Arriving at the crossing around 9.40am.
Return bus at 9.50am, 10.50am, 11.50am...
Cost 30 or 40 pesos one way.
Entance fees of the site: 55pesos
It's not easy walk because the ground is uneven with rocks. Need a good physical condition because the steps are steep. Or takethe back road. 
The entrance is at 2.5km from the road. You can hitchhike if you want.
Site open from 9am to 5pm
The museum wasn't openned. 
There are information in spanish and english on the site. 
Possible to hire a guide but only spanish. 
You can spend 1h30 for visiting. The view is beautiful.  Some little trees for shade but not much so be careful with the sun

457227848.name: Nice hike, great views
457227848.author: a TripAdvisor user
457227848.reviewBody:
This site is really more about the hike and views than the ruins. This is a very small site of ruins with a small pyramid (Votiva), ceremonial site surrounded by stone columns, and the remnants of a few rooms. Each site is marked with a sign in both English and Spanish, but if you want a little more detail, there are guides at the entrance who will take you up to the top for a a dollar or two and a tip. Entrance is only 50 pesos. 
Very few people make the trip to this site, so you're likely to have the entire hike to yourself, as we did. The views are fantastic, spanning 180° to almost 300° at a time, and by the time you hike to the top, you will have seen almost all sides. The view includes the mountains, flat farmland that stretches forever, and clear, blue sky. There's no shade there and the sun was quite warm, even in November, so bring a hat and sunscreen. 
The hike only takes about an hour to go up, maybe twenty minutes down. It's almost all steps of natural uneven large rocks, or cut stone steps, some of which are gigantic (about knee high). It's a bit of cardio, I won't lie. I recommend going in the morning when it's a little cooler. 

There are nice restroom facilities at the foot of the trail (though there wasn't any toilet paper or soap), but nothing but nature once you start the trail. There aren't any restaurants or food stands inside the front gate, but I think I saw a street stand back out at the highway. 

These ruins are located off the main highway 54 about 40 minutes south of Zacatecas and 20 minutes north of Villanueva. There are buses that run to Villanueva and will let you off roadside at the turn off to the ruins; however, there was some confusion on the bus when I was asking for "La Quemada". Other passengers kept asking if I had family there. Apparently, to the locals - including the bus driver - "La Quemada" refers to a large area of ranchland. If you plan to walk to the entrance, be sure to ask the bus driver to let you off at "Las Ruinas". I believe the exit sign is the other name for the site - Chicomoztoc.

We decided to continue on the bus to the next town, Villanueva, after passengers explained that it's a few miles from the turn off to the entrance gate at the ruins (with nothing to see). Taxis do not pass there, so rather than walk that, we went to Villanueva by bus and took a taxi to the ruins entrance. It was a 7-minute taxi ride from the turn off to the gate (20 min total from Villanueva and about 180 pesos). 
 
*Villanueva is not a place to spend the day, nor grab a bite. It's extremely small and quaint and devoid of restaurants. We wanted to grab a bite around 10am and walked in circles until we finally found a tiny restaurant to grab some tortas. Better to eat before leaving Zacatecas. 

Many people hire a taxi to wait at the bottom for two hours, but we didn't because I wasn't sure how long we'd be there, so we hitched a ride back out to the highway in our guide's truck. Once there, we caught a passing combi van after about 20 minutes. 

In sum, if you have a half day to spare and you're up for a hike away from the tourists, hop over to Las Ruinas/Piramide Voltiva/La Quemada/Chicomoztoc, where it takes longer to figure out its actual name than to hike it. 

Hope that helps! Enjoy Zacatecas!

435743427.name: A must stop!
435743427.author: a TripAdvisor user
435743427.reviewBody: When in Zacatecas... make sure you have this stop on your trip. It\'s very intresting and rich in history.  You can climb and explore these ancient pyramids. Definately one of the high lights of our trip.

411613698.name: La Quemada - fortified ceremonial site
411613698.author: a TripAdvisor user
411613698.reviewBody: If you like archaeological sites then La Quemada is well worth the hour drive from Zacetecas, and if you like hiking, then you have a double bonus, as from the top the views are spectacular.  Explanations on the different areas of the site are in both Spanish and English and very informative.  The hike to the top is quite challenging and not for the faint hearted as some of the steps are quite steep.  Wonderful photographic opportunities.

405917333.name: Ruins and vistas
405917333.author: a TripAdvisor user
405917333.reviewBody: We loved our visit to these ruins. The price was 50 pesos per person (bring id for student or teacher reduced fee).  There is no cafe or shop -  so bring water - but there are good, clean restrooms.  We were able to take our time to explore this archeological site and it is truly an amazing experience to just be alone with the buildings constructed hundreds of years ago.

365765253.name: Not clearly signposted
365765253.author: a TripAdvisor user
365765253.reviewBody: We visited these ruins by car while on a trip to Zacatecas . They truly merit the word \'awesome\'. We took the exit marked La Quemada and wasted time looking for the ruins in the village. In fact you take the exit before La Quemada. Sorry, can\'t remember the actual place names mentioned there. As seniors my husband and I didn\'t climb to the top of the hill but my son and daughter- in- law managed it fairly easily.

355663832.name: Beautiful pre-historic site
355663832.author: a TripAdvisor user
355663832.reviewBody: The place exceeded my expectations. I took a tour from the hotel and went there. The piramids are beautiful! The view of the Valley from the heights is breathtaking. It\'s a place of history & mistery. Worths 200% the visit.

336067254.name: Hidden Zacatecas 1
336067254.author: a TripAdvisor user
336067254.reviewBody: I visited this place as recommended by lonely planet. It was a wonderful place to visit. Not only the natives (most) did not know of its existence, but it is a great archeological site of the Zacatecos indigenous people. It provides a most wonderful natural landscape of the valley at its feet. The small pyramid at its base remains almost intact. The climb is a nice hike and the site at the top provide a great picnic area. A must see!

331452301.name: This is a must see place!
331452301.author: a TripAdvisor user
331452301.reviewBody: I know very well Aztec,  Mayan and Olmeca culture and many of their ruins, I can say this one is amazing, and different ruin, I was amazed how well the buildings were built, walls on cliffs, one very high pyramid and all this around the mountain using small and flat rocks with mood, also they built column to hold a  huge ceiling that got on fire many years ago and they explain why, this spot is so huge that is hard to believe that was  built 500 AC. the views are fantastic too! and vegetation is cool!

330412335.name: Worth The Trouble!
330412335.author: a TripAdvisor user
330412335.reviewBody:
Took the bus to Vilanueva where two taxi drivers said, "The pyramid isn't that great".

They were wrong!

Spoke with a nice, local couple on the street and they said the pyramid is fantastic!

Found a cab driver who took us to La Quemada and he waited nearly two hours while we climbed the pyramid.  The gates close at 5pm so we had to rush a bit but could've spent at least another hour at the site.  La Quemada is a great adventure.

Bring a hat, bottle of water and good hiking shoes.

Suggestion:  Bus into Vilanueva...taxi to La Quemada..then taxi back to the Vilanueva bus station.

Also, Vilanueva is a friendly town with many English-speakers.  Enjoyed it very much!

318691666.name: One of a kind view
318691666.author: a TripAdvisor user
318691666.reviewBody: The view from here its sort of a lord of the rings with game of thrones...so if you know what kind of view Im talking about youll love it, it requires some physical condition though beacuse you need to walk a lot up hill.

316837879.name: Unusual SIte but
316837879.author: a TripAdvisor user
316837879.reviewBody: This was a very nice drive to get to the site\nSome restored areas but lots of climbing\nNot sure if it is worth it as there is very little information about the site available

281903883.name: Very good!
281903883.author: a TripAdvisor user
281903883.reviewBody: Different arquitecture than the one found in Mexico, the pyramids are made by smaller stones and it has its own personality. Its not a must to see in the country, but its worth a stop if you are around.

275743513.name: Closer to the capital
275743513.author: a TripAdvisor user
275743513.reviewBody: This Ruins are only 10% open and already look awesome I can\'t wait for them to keep exploring more I\'m totally coming back on my next visit to Mexico.\nAll you Need to have on mind it\'s the climbing part ( take water with you) other than that juts have fun and explore.

262711394.name: Up by the Bufa!!
262711394.author: a TripAdvisor user
262711394.reviewBody: Up by the Bufa!! It is nice to read and climb around this ruin up by the Bufa and is a good way to avoid the crowds of tourist handicrafts!

259027939.name: Ruins only a short distance south of Zacatecas!
259027939.author: a TripAdvisor user
259027939.reviewBody: This site was very different then others we have seen in Mexico!  Do make the trip as the site is large and the spot is breathtaking!  Lots of climbing.....not an easy site to manuver around but worth every minute of the climb!

229840558.name: So worth it!
229840558.author: a TripAdvisor user
229840558.reviewBody: I visited La Quemada on a tour. The young guides were enthusiastic and knowledgeable (I do not know whether they spoke English or not), and very patient with slow progress to the top! The effort was worth it as the view was spectacular. Seemingly, not all that much is known about the inhabitants of this place except that the ruling elite suffered a fiery death. (La Quemada essentially means the charred place.)

201051046.name: Worth the ride. Amazing ruins!
201051046.author: a TripAdvisor user
201051046.reviewBody: The ruins are very interesting to understand the Mesoamerican cultures. The museum on site is very well set, although small. I highly recomend visiting with a tour guide to better underrstand all the context.

166863708.name: A unique place, full of magic
166863708.author: a TripAdvisor user
166863708.reviewBody: La Quemada is unique in its kind. The landscape that surrounds this site makes it magical. As you go up the hill, the remains appear little by little, and so do the surroundings. The site is small, it is not a Teotihuacan or a Palenque. But it\'s misterious, because little is known about the builders, the creators. It\'s in a unusual place, far from the other Mesoamerican civilizations. Visiting La Quemada is like visiting the key to the dark past and to the mistery enclosing an ancient civilization that lived there centuries ago.

150151455.name: inspiring
150151455.author: a TripAdvisor user
150151455.reviewBody: Oh, Dear, how I walked! This is a very important site if you like the feeling of walking through history. The actual name and civilization that made this city is still undetermined. The pyramids, and the altar and the wall... lots of steps and sun, btw, wear sunblock and comfortable shoes.

144977889.name: interesting site with fantastic views
144977889.author: a TripAdvisor user
144977889.reviewBody: nice day trip from zacatecas... amazing views but wear comfortable shoes and expect to do some climbing. very few tourists make it out there so you would have the place all to yourself. interesting museum with info on the chalchihuites culture... site may have been stopover of the aztecs before founding tenochtitlan or a teotihuacan outpost no one is sure. there is a presa on the other side of the mountain and dont be surprised to run into free ranging cattle along the way...

143373910.name: Magical setting
143373910.author: a TripAdvisor user
143373910.reviewBody: Whilst certainly not the most incredible pre-hispanic ruins in Mexico, by a wide margin this site makes up for it with a stunning setting and an excellent little museum and screening room. Certainly an interesting introduction to the era though and worth the trip out.

139524610.name: Day trip
139524610.author: a TripAdvisor user
139524610.reviewBody: Definitely need to make a day of it...was fun, not very kid friendly, but interesting, historic and had great views!  Would be better to do it with a tour guide.

131356640.name: Very cool.
131356640.author: a TripAdvisor user
131356640.reviewBody: If you want to see some history & get some exercise WITHOUT the tourists- this is your place.  They don\'t really know too much about the original settlers here- but it IS cool!

121720259.name: A Must Visit
121720259.author: a TripAdvisor user
121720259.reviewBody: Barely excavated but stunning in its present form.  Be prepared to hike/climb.  Very worth your time.  Give it at least half a day.  More if you can.

7247338.name: Ammazing!
7247338.author: a TripAdvisor user
7247338.reviewBody: La Quemada is a very unique archeological site in Mexico. The style of the constructions is very particular; it seems more mesopotamic than aztec or mayan! The pyramids are located in a hill, where you can watch the surroundings and feel a fresh and a strong wind. If you are visiting Zacatecas, the trip to La Quemada is worth.\n

3787917.name: I loved the ruins!!!!!!!!
3787917.author: a TripAdvisor user
3787917.reviewBody: I went to La Quemada last week. It was the highpoint of my trip to central Mexico! I would recommend this site to anyone who enjoys history, archaeology or a good hike!\n

1531256.name: I went with my grandmother as a child.
1531256.author: a TripAdvisor user
1531256.reviewBody: My mother is much more familiar with this country. I am planning to go in a couple of months. My grandmother is buried there by her parents side.\n\nThis is definitely the place to go if you are true to your self and relish peace, otherwise don\'t bother.

666490241.name: Spectacular Chapel
666490241.author: a TripAdvisor user
666490241.reviewBody: Truly spectacular altar. Great arcade and super views. Historically important statues and lots of masonry.

665215178.name: A pleasant short excurs\u0131on
665215178.author: a TripAdvisor user
665215178.reviewBody:
La Bufa is a hill dominating the city of Zacatecas, with several attractions at its top; It can be easily reached by cable car (it is called “teleferico”): it is a pleasant and short excursion. 

At the summit of the hill there is a small plateau dominated by a rocky peak of unusual shape (more precisely it is this peak which is called "la Bufa"). On the plateau there is a church of the 17th century (with no special artistic merits), and there are four big bronze monuments commemorating the battle which took place on this hill during the revolution of 1914 (among them the statue of the famous Pancho Villa). Zacatecas is at your feet, and the view to the city and its surroundings is magnificent. 

The lower station of the cable car is very near to the city centre. The cabins fly over the city with absolutely striking views; they run continuously, and the ride takes about 10 minutes; each cabin carries up to 8 people. The uphill ride costs 100 Pesos (February 2019, about 5.5 US $), and the round-trip costs 160 Pesos (about 9 US $). It is possible to reach the plateau also by car or by walking up on foot, but the road is long and completely exposed to the sun; the walk downhill is much more comfortable.

All in all it is a pleasant excursion that can be fruitfully combined with the visit of the silver mine “Eden”, whose entrance is only 100 metres away from the lower station of the cable car.

641362835.name: beautiful view of the whole city
641362835.author: a TripAdvisor user
641362835.reviewBody: Definitely walk up there or take the teleferico. The view is amazing and there is a small museum on top, that is worth visiting as well. There are some vendors around selling crafts and food. If you go early you have the place to yourself.

637743391.name: Nice place
637743391.author: a TripAdvisor user
637743391.reviewBody: Another place to visit where Franc\u00edsco Villa one of well memorable part of the Mexican independence soldier of people has his own statue.

615446180.name: Great views!
615446180.author: a TripAdvisor user
615446180.reviewBody: The views are amazing. You can see the entire city from the top. It takes a little to get up here but definitely worth it! There are also cute gift shops in the area.

612356829.name: a must go...
612356829.author: a TripAdvisor user
612356829.reviewBody: A must visit for Zacatecas, great aerial photography location, small museums and shops, shops are way cheaper than any others downtown, so buy your souvenirs and extras here.

598704404.name: The view is awesome!!!
598704404.author: a TripAdvisor user
598704404.reviewBody: We took a cab there, which was kind of a mistake because we couldn\'t get a cab up there or uber until an hour later! \nThe ride up there was very nice, the view is amazing up there.  The chapple up there is so sweet and holy.  The statues were nice, the best place to buy suvaneers and rosaries!

598321419.name: Great vistas, good climb
598321419.author: a TripAdvisor user
598321419.reviewBody: \'Climbed\' up to the Bufa, following first the street adjacent to Calle Angle and then a nice path with plenty of place to rest, since it is a rather steep 700 meter trail.\nThe view is great and the chapel nice to visit.

589845935.name: The views are great....
589845935.author: a TripAdvisor user
589845935.reviewBody: The views are great from La Bufa and we enjoyed walking around outside, climbing up the hills, etc.  They have beautiful statues outside representing on of the famous battles in Zacatecas.  If you are not a Spanish speaker, the museum itself probably is not worth going to - though the bathrooms were spotless and had paper!  It is definitely worth the drive/hike up there.  Some of the indians are selling some of the most beautiful beadwork I\'ve ever seen just outside of La Bufa.

588289264.name: Fabulous
588289264.author: a TripAdvisor user
588289264.reviewBody:
No way was I going to do this but I decided I would regret if I did not.
It was just the best.
Around 10 bucks round trip.
After u get over u can walk around. Lots to see and lots of benders.
Zacatecas is an amazing place!
I loved this ride.
I believe it is all new cables, works and cars made by the swiss.it is great.

571134918.name: The ride/drive to the top is very easy...
571134918.author: a TripAdvisor user
571134918.reviewBody: A few years ago we rode the tram to the summit - that\'s no longer working and it\'s been down since 2016. The cable is down too, from what I can see. Don\'t expect to see this up and running anytime soon.... We rode a motorcycle to the summit which I felt was well marked but not in Garmin\'s data base. At the summit there\'s a zip line, vendors, a small cathedral, and a very nice walk to a point just below the radio towers.

568506822.name: Very Historical & Informative
568506822.author: a TripAdvisor user
568506822.reviewBody: A lot of information on the area including very important historical info. Outside the museum it\'s just as historical. There\'s an area facing the entire city from the top and that provides for a meaningful experience. The only downside is that some areas are plagued with graffiti  it I suppose that\'s a problem anywhere and difficult to stay on top of.

567212342.name: Day and night
567212342.author: a TripAdvisor user
567212342.reviewBody: The Bufa has great view during the day and night. Unfortunately the telef\u00e9rico was closed both times we came. It gets chilly at night. Try climbing to the top... to the cross.

564729944.name: Great! But...
564729944.author: a TripAdvisor user
564729944.reviewBody: We disappointed to learn that we couldn\'t get to the top by tram since they were building a new system and it wasn\'t ready yet.  We went by cab which didn\'t cost that much.  The views are spectacular, we were there on a sunny day and could see for miles.  We also visited the museum which was very modern and interactive but there is no English.

556194136.name: Perfect location for a great view
556194136.author: a TripAdvisor user
556194136.reviewBody:
I prefer La Bufa in the day light hours as is lovely to see Zacatecas and the road out to Aguascalientes! Walk around there are some gift stores and some guys selling lovely hot fresh tortas! smelled divine.
Walk along towards the crypts see the dignitary that are buried there... 
Take a walk past the crypts and you can walk around the rock and climb up to the mast if you dare! I did :-)
There is a romance when the sun goes down and the lights start to come on, shimmering over the city.
Free parking and hopefully the cable car will be open soon too! 
A good 2 hours is enough...

545153234.name: If you like scenery of the desert and seeing mexican national heroes , it\'s ok.
545153234.author: a TripAdvisor user
545153234.reviewBody: Just another place to check out craftery and mexican revolution heroes on their horses. People are nice but going to Zacatecas downtown would be equally satisfying.

537996037.name: History
537996037.author: a TripAdvisor user
537996037.reviewBody: So much history. How General Fransisco Villa took over Zacatecas in one day. Beautiful scenery of the city from the top

528597322.name: Interesting Historic Area
528597322.author: a TripAdvisor user
528597322.reviewBody: Worth the visit with guide that can dress details of what happen at the historic times of the Mexican  revolution, very interesting times of the country. We took a open bus tour from down town included guided tour to cerro Buffa and Eden mine, totally worth it.

525861704.name: Great.. sort of!
525861704.author: a TripAdvisor user
525861704.reviewBody: It\'s only a read only place where you learn about Mexican revolution/history. There\'s various vendors outside, but that\'s it. I wasn\'t thrilled about it.

523861902.name: Family trip
523861902.author: a TripAdvisor user
523861902.reviewBody: The view from here is amazing. There are little shops, a church and you can even do zip lining. Recommend wearing comfy shoes. And bring your money because you will find items from silver to clothes.

508577141.name: Beautiful view!!
508577141.author: a TripAdvisor user
508577141.reviewBody: We went up on a local tour, who gave us time to do the Zipline! Was very economical ( compared to others). The views were great and the site historical. Don\'t miss it.

506839780.name: Beautiful views!
506839780.author: a TripAdvisor user
506839780.reviewBody: You can climb the Bufa, go zip-lining, or 4-wheeling. There are also touristy shops, a chapel, and touristy pics you can take, like on horses and donkeys and what not...

506601970.name: Historical
506601970.author: a TripAdvisor user
506601970.reviewBody: This place is great if you want to get a good glimpse of the city. Need to go in late in the afternoon so you can see the city lights once its dark.

503596669.name: The best!
503596669.author: a TripAdvisor user
503596669.reviewBody:
What can I say about this attraction?! It was the highlight of my visit to Zacatecas! I loved it very much. You can go up my steps but why would you when there is a perfectly paved road to the top? Lol The taxi dropped us off at the top and was very glad entrance is free! The place is magical! The views of Zacatecas are incredible. There is a zip line for the daredevils. There is also plenty of shopping and food while up there.

TIP: If you're visiting here, wait to buy your souvenirs here. Wayyyy cheaper than in downtown. A backpack I paid 160 pesos for was 120 here!

Anyway, there is small chapel with a large courtyard that I could see myself getting married in. It was so enchanting with the history and art. There's also a museum which is 20 pesos and children free. Even though we're technically at the top, there's still plenty of rock to climb up on for even better views. Do this at your own risk as it can be very dangerous if you're not accustomed to climbing rocks!

484657864.name: Majestic
484657864.author: a TripAdvisor user
484657864.reviewBody: it does not matter if you see it from far away, from downtown or you are on the hill, this is just gorgeous. Lovely. Try to go up to the Creston by your own risk, it is dangerous, but it worth it.

484103755.name: Beautiful setting
484103755.author: a TripAdvisor user
484103755.reviewBody: This battle site where Pancho Villa fought is beautiful and clean. We were grateful for our group member who brushed up on history before coming. The views are amazing.

476169534.name: Beautiful View Of the City !
476169534.author: a TripAdvisor user
476169534.reviewBody: We didn\'t know what to expect of this attraction. Upon reaching, we saw that the travel was worth it. There was a beautiful view of Zacatecas. We could see the Cathedral, the aqueduct and the beautiful view of the houses. We could see the different colors of the horses. We also saw the monuments of the Spanish people and has a lot of history related as this was a vantage point for different wars and battles, thus magnifying its importance. It also had adventure related to it as it had a 840 meter zip line. The bonus was that the car parking is free when we visited. All the while, a great value for the travel

471771166.name: Amazing and Beautiful
471771166.author: a TripAdvisor user
471771166.reviewBody: The Bufa was amazing to go and see. You really get a great view of the city and just a peaceful area in general. There is plenty to see and explore and some of the history you can learn about there is amazing.

467908710.name: Amazing view of the town
467908710.author: a TripAdvisor user
467908710.reviewBody: You can climb easily but it\'s steep. You can visit the other pic and you can climb on the top of the rock. The view is amazing. Don\'t miss it. You can go by car as well if you\'re afraid of the steps. There is a little train as well.

461305815.name: Visit Zacatecas
461305815.author: a TripAdvisor user
461305815.reviewBody: Hi guys I want to share with us the excellent place it is Cerro de la Bufa in Zacatecas, is a mountain but is really interesting, there is a overlook also have an sactuary, and the most interesting thing I have seen is the funicular this across the downtown and have a beautiful skyline, also walk in the downtown is asome because all the stores looks like colonial era it\u00b4s so beautiful, I liked too much this place if you have a chance to go you must go.

459814624.name: Climbed the top
459814624.author: a TripAdvisor user
459814624.reviewBody: Went zip lining, ate there, shopping, and skylink! Everything was safe and fun. Go into the big church courtyard place and find the man selling crispy honey treats and they are amazing!

454427129.name: Interesting and relaxing views of Zacatecas
454427129.author: a TripAdvisor user
454427129.reviewBody: Great Mexican Revolution museum, it explains the accomplishments of Pancho Villa and helps you understand why he is so loved by Mexican people. \nThe Mirador is very relaxing and the views of the city are great.  You can spot the main landmarks, like the Cathedral, the Alameda, San Francisco church and even the San Agustin church with its white stucco front put in by the American Presbyterian church when they bought it in the 1800s, and because it was too Catholic, decided to destroy the original, architecturally rich, rococo style front, built in the traditional Zacateca pink/salmon color stone.  The Plaza de Armas and the main street can also be seen.

451484130.name: muy buena opci\u00f3n
451484130.author: a TripAdvisor user
451484130.reviewBody: espectacular view and a very large zip line that i recommend to people who\'s not afraid of the highnesses!

450862610.name: Probably the only thing that I liked from Zacatecas
450862610.author: a TripAdvisor user
450862610.reviewBody: You can rather take a steep walk to the top or take a tour in a truck, my friends and I bought some beers at a local store and hiked our way to the top through town, the view is really cool totally worth it

447340297.name: Historic place to visit
447340297.author: a TripAdvisor user
447340297.reviewBody: We visited Cerro de la Bufa as a first stop in a tour recommended by the hampton\'s concierge. They picked up at our hotel, and during the visit the guide explain the name\'s origin and the sculptures from revolution characters that are there. Also visit the Capilla located there. \nAmazing city views to take pictures. \nAdditionally there is a zipline to cross the mountain and get back to Bufa with cheap price.

445895857.name: Nice view of the city
445895857.author: a TripAdvisor user
445895857.reviewBody:
La Bufa is a vista point that overlooks the entire city of Zacatecas. It also has a  concrete mini-plaza area with four very large bronze statues of Mexican Revolutionary War Heroes. There are basic restrooms (5 pesos) and garbage cans. There are souvenir stands and a snack bar with soda, chips, elote, and I think tacos and quesadillas. There's a small church with a museum on site, as well, but I can't comment on it since it was already closed when we visited. I believe they both close early, around 3 or 4pm. 
Behind the statues is a small trail (5 minute walk up stairs and a concrete path)  that leads to the mausoleum and another viewpoint. There aren't any garbage cans there, so be sure to finish your food below or carry your trash back with you.

La Bufa is a nice place to go to take a look around and see the entire city below. But it's not a bustling "mini town", as some reviewers imply. I can't see spending more than an hour there. It's no "Basílica de Santa Maria de Guadalupe"  (Mexico City), but it's worth a look around and some photos. 

**Transportation Info**
The teleférico to La Bufa is no longer an option as the tram operation has been suspended indefinitely while residents and environmental groups battle the  government over the proposed project to expand the tram system. 

     However, you can still go to La Bufa overlook by:
1. Taxi or Uber (about 75 - 100 pesos, depending on where you start), and the ride takes roughly 15 minutes. 

2. There's also a train tram (like an amusement park tram) that shuttles visitors up and down the hill. I don't know where the pick-up point is in town, or how much it costs, though. I just saw it waiting at La Bufa for customers. 

3. You can climb the stairs and alleys through the town. I recommend taking a taxi to the hill, then walking DOWN the stairs. It takes about 20-30 minutes to walk back down (mostly steps and downhill narrow streets) to end up at the main Catedral de Zacatecas on Hidalgo.  *I wouldn't walk through the neighborhoods at night; however, as the alleys are dark and a bit dicey, but by day or sunset, it's a nice walk.

 *The stairs back down to the city are accessed from a staircase found between the main plaza and the mausoleum. It's easy to find. Then just walk down about 4 or 5 flights of stairs until you reach the city edge and the main road. Cross the highway and continue down the staircase lined with houses. Then you wind through the streets and alleys in a sort of switchback fashion in search of stairs. It's very easy to get back to town, but not direct. The most direct manner (by foot) would be to follow the main highway once you reach it (instead of crossing it), but it's not at all scenic. 

Hope that helps! Enjoy Zacatecas!

444434335.name: Worth the hike!
444434335.author: a TripAdvisor user
444434335.reviewBody: Many ways to access Cerro de la Bufa.  We used the Teleferico and hiked the rest. You will not be disappointed.

434652104.name: Fun at La Bufa
434652104.author: a TripAdvisor user
434652104.reviewBody: Very picturesque, you can see Zacatecas from the viewpoint. There are also zip lines, amazing experience, all children in our group (the youngest was 4) did it on par with adults. Awesome and pretty cheap.

433192296.name: Depends when, really
433192296.author: a TripAdvisor user
433192296.reviewBody: The Zacatecans make a big deal of the bufa. It is a nice place for viewing the town from above. But since we are talking about an old, colonial city, there is nothing to gain by a distant view in my humble opinion. The only worthwhile times are when there are fireworks. And then one had better secure a place hours in advance. I was there when they were playing a huge show of fireworks, but elected to stay away. Instead, I celebrated an authentic Independence Day party with the best of the city and got home at three am. Ahh, great time with great people.\nBut if you are interested, there is a road that will take you there, no problem.

432143650.name: Do the zip line!
432143650.author: a TripAdvisor user
432143650.reviewBody: THE VIEW!!!! It\'s all about the view! Once you are up there, make sure to take the zip line! It is great and affordable! There is a nice "Mercado" to buy stuff.

428105237.name: Breathtaking view
428105237.author: a TripAdvisor user
428105237.reviewBody: We took a non-conventional route up the mountain which required more work than was necessary, but once at the top, it was so worth it. Of course you will see the beautiful, vast skyline of Zacatecas and its neighbouring city, but the adventurous are also awarded with an opportunity to zip line! Shops, food, a beautiful church and stunning scenery await.

426208808.name: Nice view of the city.
426208808.author: a TripAdvisor user
426208808.reviewBody: Really nice view of the city, how ever, could use some maintenance.  The church is pretty too. Seems to be a place very popular with tourists.

420704161.name: It\'s not a must, is a duty
420704161.author: a TripAdvisor user
420704161.reviewBody:
I'm all about sightseeing, and in Zacatecas this is THE place. 

The view in Cerro de la Bufa allows you to see the sunset in all the beautiful city of Zacatecas. 

There is no charge to go and see this great view, it's a great place for pictures and for souvenirs. In case you want a little bit of culture there is a museum of history on top of the mountain. 

In the food area you have to taste a grilled corn they sell for one dollar. It's  the absolute best corn I have ever eaten. 

You can't say you went to Zacatecas if you don't go to Cerro de la Bufa.

412122637.name: A must in Zacatecas
412122637.author: a TripAdvisor user
412122637.reviewBody: Lovely mountain with many interesting vistas, memorials and a popular spot for locals to hang out. We enjoyed beginning our tour of Zacatecas from this spot. One advice, the parking place gets quite packed, so if you\'ve got a chance to park a bit further away from the Cerro itself (when arriving by car) do. Rather walk couple of hundred metres more than spend half an hour in a jam trying to get out of the parking places.

409720738.name: Lovely view of the city.
409720738.author: a TripAdvisor user
409720738.reviewBody: An enormous amount of history there, including Pancho Villa\'s takeover of the city. Statues and monuments abound.  It can be reached from town by taxi, of by the funicular.  I would recommend the latter. I made the mistake of booking a tour.  All can easily be done on your own.

404265065.name: What a View
404265065.author: a TripAdvisor user
404265065.reviewBody: This spot on a hill offers a view of Zacatecas and surrounding areas along with shopping and statues, one of Poncho Villa.

402956299.name: Great View of the City
402956299.author: a TripAdvisor user
402956299.reviewBody:
A landmark in Zacatecas, the “Cerro de la Bufa” is a place you cannot miss visually from almost any spot in the downtown. You can walk up; take a taxi or the “Teleferico”. Either way you will be amazed at the great views you will get from up there. 
There are many vendors in the street going up, be careful and bargain because the prices are higher than with other vendors in the downtown area. At the top you will find several spots to overlook the main attractions in the city. There is a church at the top, “Nuestra Señora del Patrocinio”.
Nice place to visit and walk around.

399369755.name: Great view nice to walk around
399369755.author: a TripAdvisor user
399369755.reviewBody: We travelled across on the cable car. It was a sunny day and we had great views across the city. You can walk up to the top where there is a little chapel and just have a bit of a wander around outside.

395894613.name: Family reunion choice spot
395894613.author: a TripAdvisor user
395894613.reviewBody:
After arriving in Zacatecas for a family reunion I had two family friends along who had never visited the Bufa before so we decided to take them and our daughter and her husband up the hill to see the Bufa. 

It is a fantastic place and very well liked by all so it was crowded. We visited the museo which is very impressive since my original visit 40 years ago. 

The views of the town are simply beautiful.

385338815.name: A Place to View History
385338815.author: a TripAdvisor user
385338815.reviewBody: Take the tram to the Cerro de la Bufa and you will not regret your visit. There is an uphill walk from the station, but the walk is not too strenuous and the views are incredible. At the top you can look down onto the city of Zacatecas and understand why it is easy to get lost when you walk around the city. At the top of the cerro there is a wonderful old church and an even better museum dedicated to the Mexican Revolution of 1910.  There are photos of battles, their aftermath and there are numerous artifacts that make this museum worth the trip. There are a few places to eat, but I did not try any of them. \nAt the very top there are several large bronze (I think they are bronze) statues of revolutionary figures. I truly enjoyed this museum and the views from the Cerro.

378735062.name: Nice Views
378735062.author: a TripAdvisor user
378735062.reviewBody: We went to the mine first and took the tram over and walked down.  The views are spectacular and the walk is very pleasant.

360631353.name: Nice photo op
360631353.author: a TripAdvisor user
360631353.reviewBody: The Bufa mountain offers beautiful views of Zacatecas, perfect for selfies, and also for taking the cable cars. Do take a taxi as the walk up or down is long and very steep.

358022739.name: Fascinating Views
358022739.author: a TripAdvisor user
358022739.reviewBody: We took the sky tram across to the Bufa.  What a great way to see the city.  The views from on top of the Bufa was amazing as was all the monuments.  We actually climbed to the very top where there is a monument to the original founders of Zacatecas and had a even better view.  A must do if you are in Zacatecas!

357310318.name: WOW !
357310318.author: a TripAdvisor user
357310318.reviewBody: The views from up here are simply amazing.  Also there are statues of some famous Mexicans such as Pancho Villa.  Nearby is the Toma Museum of Zacatecas.  I took a taxi to get up here and   when i got dropped off the taxi driver recommended i walk back to the hotel because he said it might be fun for me since i was a first time visitor.  I did walk back all the way from Cerro de la Bufa to downtown Zacatecas , it was fun !

344296478.name: great view
344296478.author: a TripAdvisor user
344296478.reviewBody: Nice place, friendly guides. Souvenirs, food and market trinkets available. Cool to hang out. Ziplines avail too.

337711029.name: Good to see a panoramic view of the city
337711029.author: a TripAdvisor user
337711029.reviewBody: I took the teleferico up and walked down the hill, the museum is interesting at the top - all in Spanish. Great views of the city and plenty of places to grab a drink, something to eat and do some market shopping.

336068241.name: A nice view of Zacatecas city
336068241.author: a TripAdvisor user
336068241.reviewBody: Can\'t go wrong with this wonderful view of Zacatecas city. It is accessible by public transportation, and it offers basic services to make your visit enjoyable. I visited with friends and we had a picnic while enjoying the vistas. I highly recommend it.

334447489.name: Great History Lesson
334447489.author: a TripAdvisor user
334447489.reviewBody: This mountain (meaning \'comical\') has a great history lesson of Mexico.  It is a very defensible site and so many battles started from here.  Access by taxi, private auto, gondola or bus.  The zip line would be a great way to exit.  Unfortunately, the day we were here, it was getting new cables. \nGreat views of the city and the plains and mountains in the distance.

333593048.name: Amazing view
333593048.author: a TripAdvisor user
333593048.reviewBody: The cerro de la buffa has a lot of things to it has great history that will tell you how the town was found whit some beautiful statues and the view is on of a kind

332711313.name: Spot to get a View of Zacatecas from Above
332711313.author: a TripAdvisor user
332711313.reviewBody: Cerro de La Bufa overlooks the city of Zacatecas, and you can have lovely views of the city from here. There is a small church, a mausoleum of the great people from Zacatecas, as well as statues of some local heroes.

332335239.name: Not much going on
332335239.author: a TripAdvisor user
332335239.reviewBody: Drove up, Got Lost haha no biggie dine age us bad,  Guess everybody takes the tram. Mod week most of the puestos were closed.  Nice statues good history but GF was having an attitude so it was sorta boring walking around floe.  The place seemed abandon.  As mush as I wanted to go The Mirador and Bar were too much of a walk from the parking lot, again should have taken the tram.

331450218.name: good location to see Zacatecas
331450218.author: a TripAdvisor user
331450218.reviewBody: The mountain has amazing views of Zacatecas, good to take amateur pictures, you can see and shoot the whole city view. The church in it has authentic and old components  made of gold and brought from Spain in around 15 century If I am not wrong. You have the option to walk or pay just 10 pesos to get a small train to get the previous part of the top of the mountain, It is not expensive so I would recommend it. During the walk up to the top there are some people selling Huichol culture handcraft which is awesome an very beautiful! don\'t forget to buy a souvenir of Huichol handcrafts!

330688480.name: Awesome view
330688480.author: a TripAdvisor user
330688480.reviewBody: We went there, did the zip-line took the teleferico and did a little shopping.  It was a great experience even in th the frog and rain.

323258958.name: Wonderful view from here.
323258958.author: a TripAdvisor user
323258958.reviewBody: You can get to the Cerro de la Bufa by foot (a long hike) car or the teleferico (cable car). There is a great view of the city, and the statues of Pancho Villa and other Mexican heroes are amazing.

318689492.name: Great view
318689492.author: a TripAdvisor user
318689492.reviewBody: Excellent view! This is a must while visiting zacatecas, if you want to go the mine, there is an option at the end of the mine tour to take the elevator and railway up here, it saves time but if it is raining the air railway wont work. It is most of the time very cold here so we didnt lasted for long...if you like adventure there is a zip line here!

317469033.name: Interesting but nothing special
317469033.author: a TripAdvisor user
317469033.reviewBody: If you\'re planning to buy souvenirs I definitely recommend buying the stuff from the people here instead of downtown. I bought a mug for 1.5dlls that costed 10dlls downtown. Also candies and crafts are slightly cheaper here.

314458945.name: A view well worth the walk.
314458945.author: a TripAdvisor user
314458945.reviewBody: See the city from high above, get surrounded in the history that dates back to the days of the Spanish revolution.

310581048.name: Epic Mexican Revolution Battle Here
310581048.author: a TripAdvisor user
310581048.reviewBody:
One of the most epic and famous battles of the Mexican Revolution (civil war) happened here, with Pancho Villa leading the insurgents.

It is name bufa after a pig's bladder, which this hill (with a lot of imagination) looks like.

Don't forget your picture with the statues of Pancho Villa, Panfilo Natera and Felipe Angeles. All of them fighters in this war.

306145137.name: A good walk with amazing views
306145137.author: a TripAdvisor user
306145137.reviewBody: a place where you you will defenetly walk but everywhere you look you have amazing city views. There is also a lot of souvenir shops.

305328589.name: Fabulous views
305328589.author: a TripAdvisor user
305328589.reviewBody: Worth visiting if just for the fantastic views over the town. There are attractions to visit here but probably not worth a special visit. Best to get the cable car up then take a leisurely stroll back down into town.

298589127.name: Pancho Villa
298589127.author: a TripAdvisor user
298589127.reviewBody: Very nice historical place to visit. You will fill the spirit of  Mexican Revolution with the statue of Pancho Villa in his horse.

298127084.name: Take the time to go there..
298127084.author: a TripAdvisor user
298127084.reviewBody: Nice place to walk ...and enjoy the exceptional view of Zacatecas and know more about the history of the place   visiting the Museum of the Toma the Zcatecas and get immerse in the history of the place and Mexico as well

295449941.name: Great views!
295449941.author: a TripAdvisor user
295449941.reviewBody: Theres not much to do.. specially after 5-6pm since the museum closes, but you can get a beatiful view of the entire city!

292914389.name: Perfect viewpoint over Zacatecas
292914389.author: a TripAdvisor user
292914389.reviewBody:
There is tree ways of getting up here. Either you drive up, hike up or take the teleferico up.
I choosed to take the teleferico up and walk down.

From up here you have a perfect viewpoint over the city but there is so much more then just that.

They have their own little city up here with restaurants, tourist shops and museums. There is also a plaza with statues and even a cemetery.

Be prepared to spend at least a few hours here before going down again.

288360974.name: Historical landmark of Zacatecas
288360974.author: a TripAdvisor user
288360974.reviewBody: If you visit Zacatecas, you have to go to the top of el Cerro de la Bufa, and you will find a little bit of everything once you are there. First of all, you will appreciate an amazing view of the city. Secondly, you will see the statues of Pancho Villa, Felipe Angeles, and Panfilo Natera, who fought during the Battle of Zacatecas and the Mexican Revolution. You will also find a monument and a museum honoring the Battle of Zacatecas, a mausoleum, a chapel (the first chapel dedicated to the Virgin Mary built in 1548), an observatory, local shops, and even a zip-line if you are looking for an adrenaline rush. You can\'t miss out on all these things!!

286965982.name: A little bit of everything
286965982.author: a TripAdvisor user
286965982.reviewBody: We have been here before, but this time we visited el cerro de la bufa for a wedding. It is spectacular. There is a lot to see. The view is amazing. Almost as amazing as the teleferico. There are little shops that sell hand made ceramics, jewelry, and clothes. There are also plenty of places to eat that have true traditional food. Don\'t forget you camera!! Also, there is a beautiful church there that is worth seeing.

285159216.name: Bird\'s eye view fromt the top!
285159216.author: a TripAdvisor user
285159216.reviewBody:
Amazing view from the top. I think this is the must thing to do in Zacatecas. There is a cable car that goes up the hill if you are not in steep hiking. There is a steep stair climb up from the center of the city. The climb is great. Definitely walk down if possible, coz there are good views on the way.

If you hike up (or take the cable car), you will be rewarded with the nice view. I went there to watch the sunset but thick and dense dark clouds moved it. That actually added great dynamics in the view but no sunset. Sun disappeared behind the clouds. Fortunately it did not rain. Probably it was raining in the far distance.

I did this hike on the second day. Watching the view from the top, I started remembering places I visited, streets I walked, how far I went from the center. It was a great flashback of time spent in the city down below the hill.

There is a pretty nice Church on the top. There was wedding in process. I got some great shots of beautiful people gathering in the church for the wedding. I guess it's a common scene on the weekend. Am I right?

Anyways, best place to be if you like high hills and pretty view.

275049175.name: Great view!
275049175.author: a TripAdvisor user
275049175.reviewBody: Peaceful, nice view, shops & zipline, worth a visit. You can get a photo dressed up in black-and-white bandito clothes, fun!

271555699.name: Such a cool place, good for rock climbing.
271555699.author: a TripAdvisor user
271555699.reviewBody: I had a lot of free fun going here, and climbing on the big rock. There is a great view from the top and some cool statues at the base. I would personally recommend to go climb the thing, it\'s really easygoing! :)

270487313.name: Amazing mountain
270487313.author: a TripAdvisor user
270487313.reviewBody: If you go to Zacatecas you must go to La Bufa, great spot at 2650 meters above the sea level.\n\nAlso the revolution square and the surchs, etc are worth the visit

268116670.name: What a view
268116670.author: a TripAdvisor user
268116670.reviewBody: Take the cable car up to this historic site. Reflect on the bravery of Poncho Villa and his army of revolutionaries as they repelled 12,000 federal troops. The views of the city are amazing.

266814780.name: Lovely view!
266814780.author: a TripAdvisor user
266814780.reviewBody: A must go! The view is amazing, specially at night!!! Lots of souvenir shops, overall I recommend this to everyone visiting Zacatecas.

266539263.name: Great View from La Bufa
266539263.author: a TripAdvisor user
266539263.reviewBody: From here, you can understand how Zacatecas city was settled by the Spaniard Conquistadores in  old Mexico. A mining city, one of the biggest enterprises in New Spain Territories and still a very "colonial" city.

264343649.name: A must see. Great views of the city from here.
264343649.author: a TripAdvisor user
264343649.reviewBody: A very nice visit. We got here via the teleferico and descended by foot. About 20 minutes by foot, mostly staircase. A bit steep in some parts. \nGreat for taking pictures of the city.

264262078.name: the best view of the city
264262078.author: a TripAdvisor user
264262078.reviewBody: it is a must when you visit because there is where you get the nices view of the pin stone city. Don\'t miss it.

260972926.name: Telferico ride
260972926.author: a TripAdvisor user
260972926.reviewBody: Sort of boreing, Climb the rest if the way up the bufa - there you will find a place to eat and artisen crafts - buy the very colorful hoodies - 100 pesos and they are sooooo comfortable, specially over leggings. Do- not shrink

260810222.name: Historic landmark.  If you go to Zacatecas, you gotta visit.
260810222.author: a TripAdvisor user
260810222.reviewBody: Parking can be an issue if you go on a holiday.  There are zip line adventure activities available at the top.  It can get very very cold and windy at the top of the hill.  Be sure to have someone with you that can either translate or pay for the tour.  There are plenty of shops and food sales at the location.

257056846.name: Very nice location with a lot to do
257056846.author: a TripAdvisor user
257056846.reviewBody:
At the top of the hill, cerro de la bufa, you will have a very nice view over the city and the valley. 
You can take a bus-train to the top or you walk along the Indian traders which are selling handmade stuff.
At the top you have the spectacular statue, rocks where children can climb on, the museum and stores. 
Sometimes even some Indians are performing live music.
Worthwhile !

254870038.name: A piece of history
254870038.author: a TripAdvisor user
254870038.reviewBody: Recently renovated museum is a nice attraction and the amazing view is a must when going to Zacatecas.

253016977.name: Awesome views with a terrific Museum
253016977.author: a TripAdvisor user
253016977.reviewBody: The teliferico (cablecar) is only 50 pesos each way with an incredible view of the city. At the top the view of the city and surrounding countryside is breathtaking. Be sure to walk the stone pathway to the Moment of Heros. As well take in the museum of the Revolution (20 pesos); it is small but well worth it.

251746823.name: Awesome views
251746823.author: a TripAdvisor user
251746823.reviewBody: You can get there by Teleferico (cable car) and then walk a few steps (steep walk uphill) or by car and then walk a bit of distance (not a steep walk) because the parking is always full.\nAwesome view of the town and surrounding mountains. One of the very few places in town where you can get sugar cane to chew on.\nDon\'t miss out slide on the zip-line that goes right from the parking lot to the hill on the other side. It is just $200 pesos both ways.

248333418.name: Majestic monuments
248333418.author: a TripAdvisor user
248333418.reviewBody: It hard to picture the cerro taken over by revolutionaries but bu we can see why. there is church at the top along with small restaurants and shops.

246887397.name: Breathtaking view
246887397.author: a TripAdvisor user
246887397.reviewBody: I went there during Holy Week, la Bufa is the Zacatecas top hill. The weather is cool which means that you can walk all the way up there and you will not feel too hot. The view is amazing, you can see the entire city from there and there is a "Teleferico" or cable car that you can take and someone will explain to you the main attractions and a brief explanation about the city history. There are some Mexican heros statues.

245688480.name: Definitely worth the effort!
245688480.author: a TripAdvisor user
245688480.reviewBody: I took the cablecar to la Bufa and spent about 90 minutes at the top admiring the view, visiting the small church, going around the well- thought out and high quakity Revolutionary Museum (although all explanations are Spanish) and looking at the multiple monuments dedicated to leaders of the revolution.\nIt was pretty windy at the top, so take a very warm jumper to prevent you from freezing even in December!

243880377.name: Breathtaking!
243880377.author: a TripAdvisor user
243880377.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful places I\'ve visited! Cerro de la Bufa sits on a mountain high about the city of Zacatecas and Guadalupe overlooking both cities.. The scenery is breathtaking.. the history behind this cerro is interesting.. lots of history sits on this battlefield ground.. el teleferico (sky zipline)  is a must ride across the city\'s skyline.. what a thrill!

235379632.name: Beautiful scenario
235379632.author: a TripAdvisor user
235379632.reviewBody: the Bufa is a battlefield ground for one of the most iconic battles from Pancho Villa at the mexican revolution, there you can take a picture in old reovlutionary customes, go down in ziplines and take the teleferico to cross the Zacatecan skyline...

234217608.name: Lots going on
234217608.author: a TripAdvisor user
234217608.reviewBody: There\'s a lot going on up here on Wineskin Mountain. There\'s a smallish museum celebrating the 1914 battle I\'m which Pancho Villa\'s forces defeated the government\'s army, opening the way to Mexico City. There are some impressive equestrian statues of the victors. There is a chapel said to have curative powers, and there\'s a museum containing tombs of various Zacatecan heros. There were also lots of schoolchildren excitedly eating up their history. And, ta da, there\'s a zip line.

234136467.name: Espectacular city Views
234136467.author: a TripAdvisor user
234136467.reviewBody: The views of the city of Zacatecas and Guadalupe are breath taking. Beautiful, the walking paths and \nthe huge statues are quite nice, they just recently added some other ones. Its a must go if your in Zacatecas.

232776385.name: Amaizing View & Zip Lining
232776385.author: a TripAdvisor user
232776385.reviewBody: Huge place for HISTORY!  Increible monuments ti the heroes of the mexican revolution. \nOn top of historic views and monuments, you can enjoy eco tourism by zip line this beautiful mountain.

229868511.name: nice view with history and a Chapal
229868511.author: a TripAdvisor user
229868511.reviewBody: Worth the trip, very nice view with a beautiful chapel. Revolutionary Statues, Pancho Villa sacked Zacatecas during the war. You can take a cab and ride down in the cable car. We took the tour recommended at the hotel, however we wasted an hour waiting for people to ride the zip line that was not listed in the tour.

219868931.name: Buffo
219868931.author: a TripAdvisor user
219868931.reviewBody: excellent views of the city from the hilltop. visit the museum of the revolution. take a photo dressed as a revolutionist.\nride the Teleferico ( cable car).

214663051.name: History, Culture & Views
214663051.author: a TripAdvisor user
214663051.reviewBody: Zacatecas, Zac is a beautiful, historic, and very colonial city where various important battles of the Mexican Revolution took place. From El Cerro de la Bufa, you can see so many of these places, as well as a spectacular view of the entire city. Make sure you take a guided tour, and learn about the statues, church and museum up on top of La Bufa!

212958468.name: view and museum
212958468.author: a TripAdvisor user
212958468.reviewBody: The view is excellent but then the museum was closed and not much else to do. 20 minutes is enough up there unless your kids like running around with no reason

208077773.name: Very Special
208077773.author: a TripAdvisor user
208077773.reviewBody: One of the most memorable experiences of my life. Such a beautiful and special place. I would love to go back one day.

206377238.name: This IS Zacatecas.
206377238.author: a TripAdvisor user
206377238.reviewBody: History has unfolded in these hills. Zacatecas is rooted here. The spirit of the whole entire land was born anew here. Cerro la Buffa is a site of profound importance, forever the resting place of heroes. The views are good, too. I suggest a cable car ride up, followed by a walk down.

203482370.name: The view...
203482370.author: a TripAdvisor user
203482370.reviewBody: What you get in la Bufa is an amazing view of Zacatecas and Guadalupe. The rest is just there to complete the experience. La Bufa provides unparalleled sightseeing.

189936957.name: What a view!
189936957.author: a TripAdvisor user
189936957.reviewBody: You can\'t go to Zacatecas and not get up there, beautiful views, I\'ve been up there during the day and at night and I think it\'s better at night but the pictures aren\'t as pretty, I guess you just have to go twice, it\'s worth it!

178757102.name: How Could You Not Go Here When Visiting Zac?
178757102.author: a TripAdvisor user
178757102.reviewBody: Visited in September 2013 with my wife and kids.  We are Canadian and really stand out in Central Mexico, but felt very safe and all of us enjoyed the views, short hike to the top, and the sunset was spectacular!  It\'s not far from the city - we went on a Friday evening and all the shops were closed (bonus!) and it was not busy at all - perhaps a dozen people at the entire site!

160966459.name: Didn\'t see the sunset but got good service from local police
160966459.author: a TripAdvisor user
160966459.reviewBody: I stayed on the top of Bufa waiting for the sunset, and finally I realized that I was the only tourist left on the top of the mountain. I went to a policeman, who is a senior gentleman, asked him to do me a favor call a taxi. He doesn\'t speak English while I don\'t speak Spanish. But obviously he understood what I want. After 15 mins\' trying, no taxi came. Then he kindly offered to drive me back by himself. It was 40 mins drive, and I really enjoyed and appreciated. He drove me from the top of the mountain to my hotel directly.\n\nI was told a lot of bad things about Mexican Police before I went to Mexico, but this experience in Zacatecas really changed my mind. There are good cops still, don\'t lose faith.

159083547.name: Cajones
159083547.author: a TripAdvisor user
159083547.reviewBody: On a very windy day (the tram closes at a certain high velocity MPH blow), my friends and I visited the Bufa.  I was most taken by the anatomically correct genitalia of the horses.  Wow!

153405259.name: Just another few hundred steps ....
153405259.author: a TripAdvisor user
153405259.reviewBody: Just another few hundred steps will take you from the Museum and Teleferico to the top of the La Buffo.  There is an amazing view from there and you certainly see how big Zacatacas really is.  There is a new Mausoleum dedicated to famous people from Zacatacas. I wished that there had been a little more information about the people honoured here, but as this is so new the information may yet be coming.

150807025.name: Great
150807025.author: a TripAdvisor user
150807025.reviewBody: Take the teleferico over and then enjoy the museum, restaurants and the church. The views are spectacular, the history fascinating and the restaurant food cheap and good Mexican fast food. The souvenir shops are nothing special and overpriced.

150151208.name: Zacatecas\' icon
150151208.author: a TripAdvisor user
150151208.reviewBody: This hill is very important in zacateca\'s history and one of the main attractions. There are independent tour guides that charge like 100 pesos for a really good historical walk through the chapel and the commemorative statues, it\'s worth it.

149163588.name: hire a guide
149163588.author: a TripAdvisor user
149163588.reviewBody: generally a good idea, someone who knows the history of site will allow walking away from experience enriched with knowing why this was so powerful a symbol to history

147999782.name: Good view ...
147999782.author: a TripAdvisor user
147999782.reviewBody: Nice view but there are really only tourist shops and trinkets to buy at the top and not much else ... but the view is pretty nice!!

146456268.name: Since you\'re here
146456268.author: a TripAdvisor user
146456268.reviewBody: This is one of the many things to do while in Zacatecas. Hopefully you will be there on a clear day to take in the views of the city below. You can either take the teleferico or make a major hike up the mountain. We took the teleferico there and then a taxi down which did cost us less than the roundtrip teleferico.

143373717.name: Spectacular
143373717.author: a TripAdvisor user
143373717.reviewBody: A beautiful place to behold a beautiful city, and rich in tat shops, an excellent museum, a stunning baroque church and the best photo op in the city courtesy of a man with bullet belts and civil war era hats for hire

143162667.name: Comes with the Telef\u00e9rico
143162667.author: a TripAdvisor user
143162667.reviewBody: You can get there alone, but the smartest way to do it is to go to the mountain right in front of it and get to it through the Telef\u00e9rico. That way you\'ll get an amazing view of Zacatecas and then enjoy Cerro La Bufa.

139524577.name: Historic site
139524577.author: a TripAdvisor user
139524577.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful and historic places to visit in Zacatecas.  A definite must if you\'re in the area.

135391960.name: Takes your breath away!
135391960.author: a TripAdvisor user
135391960.reviewBody: Loved it, will go back if I ever get the chance. The most beautiful place I ever visited! It\'s a magical place!!!

131356071.name: What a view!
131356071.author: a TripAdvisor user
131356071.reviewBody: This is a great place to buy indigenous jewelry & get a great overview of the city.  We especially enjoyed watching the sunset from the meterological tower.

131131776.name: We loved it and we\'ll be back!
131131776.author: a TripAdvisor user
131131776.reviewBody: Zacatecas is a beautiful city and state. Best to tour the city durning the day. There are many beutiful places to places to go, many places here lack parking so be prepared to park far from locations.\nMost vendors open at 10am and close 8pm. Note: avoid traffics hours

128655418.name: You should go up here to get a great view of the city
128655418.author: a TripAdvisor user
128655418.reviewBody: I would love to go back to this view ponit of the city. You can see the entire city from up here and I took the best pictures from this location.

127518440.name: A view from the sky
127518440.author: a TripAdvisor user
127518440.reviewBody: I liked that I had a whole view of the city.  We could see the tombs of some Revolution time generals.

127051997.name: Beautiful attraction!
127051997.author: a TripAdvisor user
127051997.reviewBody: Went in December 2011 kids loved the pancho villa museum and all the guns. Was a beautiful sight and would love to go again!

122155255.name: Great View
122155255.author: a TripAdvisor user
122155255.reviewBody: We took the teleferico to the Bufa. Once up there we decided to walk a little, though it was later in the day the museum up there was closed. We took great pictures and took a cab back down to the cathedral. From where we were dropped off by the teleferico there is a narrow street, where locals set up shop and sell their crafts, which you actually take up to the Bufa. Nice place to just take in the view  of the city.

121340576.name: Great place for pictures
121340576.author: a TripAdvisor user
