121340576.reviewBody: Would visit the small church and museum again. There are several vendors in the area and you have an amazing view of the city.

120643414.name: \u00a1Viva Villa!
120643414.author: a TripAdvisor user
120643414.reviewBody: My wife and I visited on November 7, 2011.  I am a student of the Mexican Revolution so I had always heard of the battle at this place won by Pancho Villa\'s troops.  Although there is a small museum, there isn\'t much else.  But it is a must-see for anyone interested in the Mexican Revolution.

6577149.name: Breathe taking!!!!!
6577149.author: a TripAdvisor user
6577149.reviewBody: I had the privelage to visit the Bufa on my very first trip into Mexico.  We have very good friends that live in Sauceda that took us to see this beautiful Church and the view from the Bufa is breath taking.  I bought a silver Rosary while we were there and the oddest thing happened when I first bought it and opened the box the was no smell however, a few days later when I opened it to show it to some other friends both the box and the rosary smelled like  roses.  And it still continues to smell of roses today.  I am looking forward to my next trip to Zacatecas so that we can visit more or your beautiful attractions that you have as this trip was for medical reasons and we did not really have much time for sight seeing however I am so glad we got to see the Bufa.\n

671013565.name: Wow
671013565.author: a TripAdvisor user
671013565.reviewBody: This was our first time in Zacatecas and we took a few hours to tour the city during a brief overnight stay ... the cathedral was all lite up at night and we\u2019ll be back when we have more time to tour it again!

661057452.name: A marvellously carved fa\u00e7ade
661057452.author: a TripAdvisor user
661057452.reviewBody: The fa\u00e7ade is one of the marvels of Mexico: it is in Plateresque style, totally carved and decorated with statues; also the tops of the two bell towers are richly carved. For its beauty and artistic complexity this fa\u00e7ade is as much extraordinary as those of "Santa Prisca" in Taxco and "San Francisco Xavier" in Tepozotl\u00e1n, two other absolute masterpieces of Mexican architecture that no demanding traveller can miss. Also the doors on the two sides of the church are in Plateresque style and are very beautiful. The interior of the church instead, although being nice, is nothing exceptional: it looks more renaissance style than baroque, and has much less decoration than it\'s usually found in Mexico. The construction of the cathedral begun in 1752 and was terminated in 1841, when the fa\u00e7ade and the bell towers were completed.\n\nAround the cathedral there is a marvellous colonial quarter with an extremely picturesque and scenic Z\u00f3calo (or "Plaza de Armas"), plus a number of ancient palaces, among which outstands the Government Palace, built in the 17th century as a private mansion. The visit of the cathedral can be fruitfully coupled with the visit of this Palace, which contains a historical museum of the city and lots of murals in the stairway that goes up to the first floor: admission is free.

653512148.name: magical Holyday visit
653512148.author: a TripAdvisor user
653512148.reviewBody: Zacatecas is a city with many attractions any time of the year. However, visiting during the Christmas, end of year and "Reyes" holyday season was a fantastic surprise. The center of the city, main square with a Xmas village and a giant Ferris Wheel are complemented with colorful and creative decorations in each of the alleys that connect main st with other streets. The town fully dress for the season, along with many guided tours of history and legends.\nthe city center, with many wonderfull buildings and museums is a great walking tour (bring good waking shoes) and when needed, a cab goes for an average of 2 USD or less.\nGreat restaurants that offer marvelous local cuisine. For sure one to try is the "Asado de Boda". A spicy and delicious dish. will review our hotel and restaurants and other sites individually

634678509.name: A Magical City
634678509.author: a TripAdvisor user
634678509.reviewBody: A great place during the night and you can clearly see the beautiful lights, this place is a great architecture example of the colonial times, is full of myths and legends, a place full of life with its street performers and sellers, a city whort of visiting.

629859284.name: A must go
629859284.author: a TripAdvisor user
629859284.reviewBody: Beautiful entrance, you can really feel in heaven , the background is the Cerro de la Buffa and it looks gorgeous all the time.

623350387.name: Beautiful
623350387.author: a TripAdvisor user
623350387.reviewBody: This is one of the most beatiful cathedrals in Mexico, and it is located in a really beautifull spot in the city, so this is one of the mandatory stops when you visit Zacatecas.

618059538.name: Meh
618059538.author: a TripAdvisor user
618059538.reviewBody: I estimate that over the course of my travels, I\'ve visited at least a hundred cathedrals. Some really stand out. Others don\'t. This one I would place in the latter category.

615444978.name: Beautiful!
615444978.author: a TripAdvisor user
615444978.reviewBody: The cathedral is very pretty! It is located in the center of town, it lights up the town at night. It is a must see. There was Mexican dancing all along the streets near the cathedral when we were there, absolutely amazing.

598321167.name: Tremendously impressive building
598321167.author: a TripAdvisor user
598321167.reviewBody: Especially the outside of the building is fascinating, I couldn\'t get enough from looking up to all that beautiful stonework. The modern altar is unusual and impressive.

595603666.name: Amazing!!!!
595603666.author: a TripAdvisor user
595603666.reviewBody: I love visiting Cathedrals all over the world, something about the history if when it once built and how much it was worked on takes my breath away!\nThis gem is located in the middle of the city, marvelous arcatecture carving with pink stones from the putside, and breath taking inside. The locals say it was re done at the altar with a Gold plated background, it is free entrance. This Cathedral was blessed by Pope John Paul II! \n*A tip: you must see this standing 18 century arcatecture at night, it is stunning!!!!

579330535.name: Great Cathedral, the facade one of the most impressive in Mexico
579330535.author: a TripAdvisor user
579330535.reviewBody: Like in all colonial cities, the Cathedral is built in the heart of the colonial town. It is open only for the morning mass and then after 5pm so plan carefully your visit. They have occasional concerts in the church (they had one  today) but the place in front of the Cathedral comes to life at night, after 9pm when bands play and people dance. The Cathedral looks particularly impressive when illuminated at night.

569209329.name: Espectacular
569209329.author: a TripAdvisor user
569209329.reviewBody: Impressive church very antique on the outside and modern inside. It is just breathtaking!!  Right in the heart of Zacatecas. It\u2019s architecture is outstanding! Some people say they started building it in 1752 or even before. To me one of the most beautiful cathedrals.

567213758.name: Central spot
567213758.author: a TripAdvisor user
567213758.reviewBody: We only saw it from the outside but it is impressive! It\u2019s located in the middle of everything so you can\u2019t miss it!

566054796.name: Incredible cathedral in Zacactecas
566054796.author: a TripAdvisor user
566054796.reviewBody: I don\'t understand why there are so many cathedrals in Zacatecas, literally right next to each other. They are all spectacular. This one especially. We sat outside a cafe next to the cathedral and people watched before going inside. Be sure to walk around the outside also see all the carvings.

551263283.name: BEAUTIFUL CHURCH
551263283.author: a TripAdvisor user
551263283.reviewBody: a lovely church with so much history, a mus t see in zacatacas, easy location and very safe area, dont miss this church

544665093.name: In the center of town + beautiful architecture
544665093.author: a TripAdvisor user
544665093.reviewBody: Such stunning architecture and in the center of town. This cathedral is a centerpiece and can be seen from many vistas. Aside from visiting this church, one of our favorite things to do was just wander through the streets and alleyways looking at all the buildings made with this pink stone apparently called Cantera Rose. Zacatecas has put a huge amount of effort into lighting the historic center of town. So at night time the buildings come to life and you really see all the details and it\'s just fantastic. We were so surprised how wonderful the town is, we definitely recommend visiting Zacatecas.

537995790.name: Vacation
537995790.author: a TripAdvisor user
537995790.reviewBody: Beautiful baroque. The altar is absolutely gorgeous. A picture at the entrance describes the names of the saints at the altar

528597858.name: Beautiful Place!
528597858.author: a TripAdvisor user
528597858.reviewBody: Just like walking in Spain, extraordinary experience and architecture in Zacatecas, amazing location.\n\n

524996936.name: Beautiful ornate cathedral
524996936.author: a TripAdvisor user
524996936.reviewBody: While the exterior is quite exquisit carvings, the interior of the church is rather plain compared to other cathedrals that I have visited.

523863159.name: Family visit
523863159.author: a TripAdvisor user
523863159.reviewBody: What a beautiful cathedral. It\'s amazing to see specially at night when its lit up. There are vendors outside selling food. So sit and relax after you\'ve been to mass

515542603.name: Beautiful exterior, plainer interior.
515542603.author: a TripAdvisor user
515542603.reviewBody: Astonishingly intricate stone carved facade. Beautiful pink stone. Interior surprisingly plain. Definitely worth a quick visit.

509462454.name: Breathtaking!!
509462454.author: a TripAdvisor user
509462454.reviewBody: It was a surreal experience and across from our hotel so even better! The architecture was unbelievable and upon entering, there was a different air about the environment. Absolutely beautiful and I can\'t wait to go back!!

503592035.name: Beautiful.
503592035.author: a TripAdvisor user
503592035.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral!! The pink stone is stunning and I could not get tired of looking at it. The inside is just as charming. It\'s definitely on the list of things to not miss while in Zacatecas. Also, right next door (to it\'s left) is a little roofed place with tons of shops where you can get food, souvenirs, candy, clothes, etc.

496385900.name: Beautiful cathedral
496385900.author: a TripAdvisor user
496385900.reviewBody: The cathedral in Zacatecas it\'s a fine piece of art full of history. You can get the full story about it at Museo Zacatecano. Zacatecas is an amazing place to visit.

484657458.name: Magestic
484657458.author: a TripAdvisor user
484657458.reviewBody: This is a nice Church, please pay attention to all details, stay in front of it for a while, you will enjoy it. Lovely.

484103427.name: Don\'t miss
484103427.author: a TripAdvisor user
484103427.reviewBody: This beautiful pink stone cathedral is outstanding. It is a great example of colonial architecture. We really appreciated the beauty.

472197677.name: Impressive Architecture
472197677.author: a TripAdvisor user
472197677.reviewBody: I absolutely loved the architecture in the city the detail is so beautiful and i can\'t believe how old these structures are being the pristine condition they are still preserved in today.

467294221.name: simply beautiful!
467294221.author: a TripAdvisor user
467294221.reviewBody: zacatecas is a great place to visit, there are tons of things to see in the streets, the Cathedral is not to be missed!

454428085.name: Amazing
454428085.author: a TripAdvisor user
454428085.reviewBody: What a beautiful Cathedral!  The facade is a beautiful example of colonial architecture and the rich rococo style introduced to America in the 1700s. The altar inside is modern, but done so tastefully that matches the 300 year-old structure. \nA true example of elegance and good taste. A must see.

444432912.name: Holy
444432912.author: a TripAdvisor user
444432912.reviewBody: Where history and faith intersect.  A must see and allow yourself to feel the centuries of faith and spirituality in this cathedral.

442388751.name: Good for religious people
442388751.author: a TripAdvisor user
442388751.reviewBody: You have to visit it of you are in Zacatecas city. It is beautiful in the outside and peaceful in the inside. You will love it.

442175588.name: Nice church
442175588.author: a TripAdvisor user
442175588.reviewBody: Nice church in Zacatecas.  This thing was pretty huge compared to some in Mexico.  On sunday there were a few people selling tamales and other food around the outside.

432142339.name: At night!!
432142339.author: a TripAdvisor user
432142339.reviewBody: It is a beautiful example of BARROCO architecture, but you definitely have to see it during night time!!!! Pictures might be a little uncomfortable because there is very little space in between the building and and the other side of the road, but it is radiant at night!

427355634.name: Unbelieveable!
427355634.author: a TripAdvisor user
427355634.reviewBody: Incredible craftsmanship from over 500 years ago.  Built @ 1562 the finely detail carvings are amazing.  Amazing for 500 yrs old.  The cathedral is lighted at night making it even more spectacular.

426104646.name: Perfect place to see the old Spain in Mexico
426104646.author: a TripAdvisor user
426104646.reviewBody: Definitely is the place to see how the people of Spain established the territory in base to the religion, a very impressive architecture, a lot of details to see, excellent place to take the touristic bus

426103890.name: Beautiful architecture
426103890.author: a TripAdvisor user
426103890.reviewBody: This cathedral is absolutely gorgeous on the outside. I recommend visiting once during the day and once at night to see the lighting.   The inside was a little disappointing, but totally worthwhile anyhow.

425811995.name: Amazing facade
425811995.author: a TripAdvisor user
425811995.reviewBody: The Cathedral forms the heart of the city. It\'s facade is highly carved and has been subject to many articles. But just looking at it is very interesting. Inside, beside the images requisite, I was impressed by the ceiling, yellow work delicate and refined.

407286261.name: Just gorgoeus
407286261.author: a TripAdvisor user
407286261.reviewBody: The way this churches are built, the detail the material which is a special stone called cantera reddish /orange/ pink/brownish color is very pretty. \n\nFor people who love old world charm this city is a must visit...

402596212.name: Beautiful Cathedral
402596212.author: a TripAdvisor user
402596212.reviewBody: This Cathedral is at the heart of the downtown area. The church is beautiful in its grandeur and simplicity. It is not one of the heavily decorated with gold accents everywhere, but nonetheless it will leave you amazed.\nA must place to visit when walking the downtown.\n

399370058.name: Beautiful gothic cathedral
399370058.author: a TripAdvisor user
399370058.reviewBody: The outside is wonderful. Beautiful stone relieve work covers the exterior and if you cross the street there is a map of the characters in the front of the building. The inside is less spectacular but is worth a short look.

388718847.name: A breathtakingly beautiful cathedral.
388718847.author: a TripAdvisor user
388718847.reviewBody: This cathedral is located on the street where we stayed and we walked past it, visited it, and in general admired its beauty each day of our stay in Zacatecas.

385630546.name: A must see
385630546.author: a TripAdvisor user
385630546.reviewBody: When I was there they had some sort of blessing for graduating students so I could see the church in use. Like a lot of things around here it is the age that impresses. Make sure you also visit the nearby Templo de Santa Domingo which I thought was more interesting inside with all the gold leaf

385031822.name: Not Your Ordinary Cathedral
385031822.author: a TripAdvisor user
385031822.reviewBody: The Zacatecas Cathedral is as old as any in Mexico, but at the same time it is most unique. The altar piece is a wonderful modern creation that you might think out of keeping with this 500 year old cathedral, but actually the altar piece is a beautiful, modern work of art.

382917528.name: Cathedral
382917528.author: a TripAdvisor user
382917528.reviewBody: Very interesting is built with the pink  cantera as many of the buildings in Zacatecas. You can visit  the plaza the Armas and Ortega Market on the side of the Cathedral.

376746500.name: A MUST visit, Baroque Masterpiece
376746500.author: a TripAdvisor user
376746500.reviewBody: As already wrote by other reviewers, the facade is very beautiful and is an extraordinary example of mexican baroque art. Inside you will find a contrasting, dark but also beautiful (at least for some of us) altar. So, you must visit this genuine jewel so that personally state if you like it all or just the outside, that has this two marvelous views:with sunlight the bright and delicate artistic work of the stone or by night with it very well designed lighting. An extra detail, contrasting with beautiful baroque churchs at many places in Europe, you can visit the inside of this gem for FREE.

374999255.name: Astounding Baroque Basilica
374999255.author: a TripAdvisor user
374999255.reviewBody: A stunning, beautiful example of 18th century high baroque makes the facade an irresistible center piece to the city proper.  The rich detail,of the main entrance requires a moment of patience to fully enjoy.  Most of the nave and interior is also quite pleasing  and not nearly as ornate, except for completely modernistic backdrop to the main alter, recently completed in 2010.  It is stunning, I fully admit, just that to my senses rather jarring and discontinuous.

374695150.name: A beauty!
374695150.author: a TripAdvisor user
374695150.reviewBody: This must be one of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world. All the detail in the main gate is awesome. There has been a lot of work to clean and restore the pieces. Anyway there are some characters without hands...

365656634.name: Stunning
365656634.author: a TripAdvisor user
365656634.reviewBody: You must make a stop at this beautiful cathedral.  The detail is amazing and pictures to do not do it justice.  it is even more lovely at night when it is all lit up.  Amazing!!

357305855.name: Beautiful !
357305855.author: a TripAdvisor user
357305855.reviewBody: I dont know what year the Cathedral was built.  Its very beautiful from the outside.  I went inside one day to pray.  I went again to pray and before I was about to leave a service started so I stayed and listened to the priest give the entire service.  This is one of the top landmarks in the city of Zacatecas.

344529641.name: beautiful, worth a stop for sure
344529641.author: a TripAdvisor user
344529641.reviewBody: lovely, gorgeous building perfect summary of what culture in Mexico is about. The inside is stunning and at night it is lit up beautifully.

332712474.name: Beautiful Facade
332712474.author: a TripAdvisor user
332712474.reviewBody: The Cathedral has one of the most ornate facades, with statues of the saints. The interior is decidedly more modern, with the gold backdrop with the saints and Mary.

332025554.name: The gorgeous north!
332025554.author: a TripAdvisor user
332025554.reviewBody: The Cathedral is a beautiful piece of history form the XVI  / XVII centuries in Mexico.\nHave a look and enjoy the paintings and the art of the design \n

328252210.name: Just awesome!
328252210.author: a TripAdvisor user
328252210.reviewBody: Definitely this is one of the main atractions of Zacatecas,  I really loved this Cathedral, the details inside and outside are amazing , the people are very friendly but I liked it more at night with the lights this church looks more beautiful

327024296.name: Didn\'t know what to expect
327024296.author: a TripAdvisor user
327024296.reviewBody: This cathedral is definitely a site to see while visiting Zacatecas - the facade is breathtaking and the decor inside is extremely beautiful!  What a historic- eye-pleasure!

323253565.name: Surely one of the beauties of Mexico.
323253565.author: a TripAdvisor user
323253565.reviewBody: The detail is amazing on its exterior facade. When illuminated in the evening, with La Bufa in the background, it will take your breath away.

318687087.name: Beautiful at night
318687087.author: a TripAdvisor user
318687087.reviewBody: Go to the acropolis cafe right next to the church at night, get one of the outside tables, order dessert & coffee and enjoy the view of the cathedral at night. Take a jacket because most of the time it\'s cold.

314456249.name: Wow, such history
314456249.author: a TripAdvisor user
314456249.reviewBody: Amazing history, I could not believe the workmanship on the outside of the building, a must see if you appreciate ornate stonework.

292911903.name: Beautiful landmark
292911903.author: a TripAdvisor user
292911903.reviewBody:
This church is located in the center of the city. The architecture of this cathedral is impressive from both the inside and the outside.

There is tons of places where you can go and take beautiful pictures over the cathedral and the city at the same pictures, my favorite place was from the terrace at my hostel.

While in Zacatecas, this can't be missed.

288368852.name: Impressive facade!!
288368852.author: a TripAdvisor user
288368852.reviewBody: The Cathedral is located in the historic city center and since the moment you are in front of it, you will be amazed by its impressive facade. It is very detailed, and it is an outstanding example of Baroque art in Mexico. The only problem is that it is difficult to take a picture of the whole facade and capture all its details because the Cathedral has a narrow street in front of it. Try also to be there early if you want to take some good pics because it is a very busy street.

275742176.name: Take your time
275742176.author: a TripAdvisor user
275742176.reviewBody: This cathedral is an emblematic place, you may have to take your time looking at, all of the details make this place an import part of the Baroque time on Mexico, you totally need to go there to feel the magic and don\'t forget to past by at night time the city lights make this place look like gold.

264260894.name: Landmark
264260894.author: a TripAdvisor user
264260894.reviewBody: You just cant miss the Cathedral, especially the outside architecture, al the stone cravings. It is the landmark of the city, the inside is more plain, big spaces and has a new altar. you cant miss it because it is right at the center of the town

262709485.name: Impressive Cathedral in the heart of Zacatecas!
262709485.author: a TripAdvisor user
262709485.reviewBody: Impressive Cathedral in the heart of Zacatecas! It is nice to walk by and admire the facade and the tours around the city will tell you even more. There was a big wedding going on when we were there and it was nice to watch.

260972725.name: The power of the Catholic Church !
260972725.author: a TripAdvisor user
260972725.reviewBody: Impressive arquitecture, take the guided tour so you can see most of it.  Take a good camera.  There is a small plaza to the right of the hotel that has different types of "shows" in the evenings - very entertaining.\n

260810094.name: Historic Church worth seeing
260810094.author: a TripAdvisor user
260810094.reviewBody: Definetly worth visiting and taking pictures.  Just be careful not to disturb the mass if its in process when you enter.

254869689.name: Great Place
254869689.author: a TripAdvisor user
254869689.reviewBody: It is amazing how between the small streets this building pops out and unveils its greatness.\nA interesting place to admire culture and history at once.

253016486.name: Very unique, worth a walk by for photos
253016486.author: a TripAdvisor user
253016486.reviewBody: On the main street, you will definitely walk by it. It\'s exterior is stunning with detailed stone carving and the backdrop of the mountain. The interior is beautiful but rather basic as far as cathedrals go (this is typical of Mexico). This is only a 15 mins stop but well worth it!

248332965.name: Awesome Architecture
248332965.author: a TripAdvisor user
248332965.reviewBody: We loved the architecture and color of the cantera. The inside was full of detailed carvings everywhere you turned the floor is still old school and the altar is super embellished.

240881183.name: Is it just another Church?
240881183.author: a TripAdvisor user
240881183.reviewBody: kind of, but the exterior is so intricate it is worth a stop.  The pink sandstone detail is incredible and it\'s in a well-traveled part of town.  The interior is much harsher on the eyes, but unique in its own way.  There is daily mass both in the morning and evening if you are so inclined.

237893810.name: wonderful trip in zacatecas
237893810.author: a TripAdvisor user
237893810.reviewBody: the shopping, the architecture and the local people.  i felt very secure and very welcome.  we tried the teleferico, wonderful views.

235379071.name: Beatiful
235379071.author: a TripAdvisor user
235379071.reviewBody: The most barroque church in Latinamerica, an iconic landmark in Zacatecas, buy milk candy from the store in front or a local ice cream, and just have fun admiring all the saints at the front face of the church.

234944938.name: Go for the facade
234944938.author: a TripAdvisor user
234944938.reviewBody: This cathedral\'s interest stops beyond the facade. The pink sandstone front is amazing. Some of the most intricate and busy Christian carving you\'ll ever see. Unique. Beyond this, the interior is curiously bare with an unusual altar. Worth a visit but essentially best to pass by in the afternoon when the sun hits the facade amd towers.

232774559.name: Amaizing Landmark!
232774559.author: a TripAdvisor user
232774559.reviewBody: An amaizing building, the architecture in the outside is just delightful specially at night.\nOn top of the cathedral this historic center is beautiful.

222731241.name: great landmark cathedral
222731241.author: a TripAdvisor user
222731241.reviewBody: very striking on the outside nice and bright inside and serves as a nice landmark to relocate yourself if you\'re walking around the city center.

203671029.name: UNESCO world heritage site
203671029.author: a TripAdvisor user
203671029.reviewBody: Beautiful. A must if you\'re going to visit Zacatecas. The shops in front of the cathedral have a nice selection of silver jewelry which is what Zacatecas is famous for.

203480859.name: Gorgeous architecture
203480859.author: a TripAdvisor user
203480859.reviewBody: The centerpiece of the city, its masterpiece, its most iconic element: rooted at the center of Zacatecas, the Cathedral is an inspiring piece of art. During my visit, the building was undergoing renovations, so I wasn\'t able to fully appreciate its majesty. Unfortunately, there\'s an evident lack of information regarding the history of the building, unless one is willing to pay for a guide (which I wasn\'t).

189936884.name: Wish it was better kept
189936884.author: a TripAdvisor user
189936884.reviewBody: One of the main attractions but somehow it\'s not as well looked after as it should... A lot of small stores around it and can\'t miss the mercado.

178757403.name: Amazing
178757403.author: a TripAdvisor user
178757403.reviewBody: Pay particular attention to the facade\u2026it is really spectacular.  Across the street from the Cathederal is a write up (even in English!).  The courtyard beside is also beautiful.

166862445.name: Perfection
166862445.author: a TripAdvisor user
166862445.reviewBody: I\'ve been to many colonial cathedrals in Mexico, and I\'m pretty sure I can say, without hesitate, that this one is my favorite, at least on the outside. The Baroque facade is astonishing, and the special color of the building -pinkish, due to the pink stone- makes this cathedral very special and different to the others.

165971090.name: Fantastic!
165971090.author: a TripAdvisor user
165971090.reviewBody: The Zacatecas Cathedral is known for its colonial style found only in Mexico (churrigueresco). However, they have recently done a new altar that blows your mind and steals your breath. In a centuries old colonial masterpiece you have a contemporary piece of art. On a massive gold leaf wall 17 meters tall and 11 wide, worked with prisms and wonderful volumes, you have a real life sized religious figures done by well known Mexican artist Javier Marin. What a treat! What images and making the old work with the new, something to go and see for sure!

153404841.name: Getting a Face Lift
153404841.author: a TripAdvisor user
153404841.reviewBody: We visited in Feb 2013 (the slow season) and one tower was shrouded in scaffolding, so we took pictures of the other tower. There are other beautiful churches in Zacatacas that make glorious pictures too. Something to remember ...... the Cathedral (and other churches) are active and so appropriate clothing is expected.  If you are in shorts just step inside to take a peek, but go no further. If you are lucky there will be something happening in the plaza.  We happened upon a Drum and Bugle competition for high school students.

150189348.name: Astonishing stone carving
150189348.author: a TripAdvisor user
150189348.reviewBody: It is an absolutely unique church well worth a visit. Try and go on sunday when the church is open and you can see the inside as well.

150150959.name: mesmerizing
150150959.author: a TripAdvisor user
150150959.reviewBody: The facade es just astonishing and the interior is very simple yet beautiful. One tower is currently under renovations or reconstructions, because the original fell during revolution.

149163371.name: community center
149163371.author: a TripAdvisor user
149163371.reviewBody: regular masses going on, nice to see or be part of, one gets to see the community in action and it is an active church.  Bishop said masses on our visit

146433339.name: Another beautiful Cathedral
146433339.author: a TripAdvisor user
146433339.reviewBody: There are so many cathedrals in Mexico, and this is just another beautiful place to see. You can\'t miss it as you walk around the historic city center. They are restoring part of the facade when I was there, so at this time you will see scaffolding.

143162499.name: Mind-blowing Baroque Cathedral
143162499.author: a TripAdvisor user
143162499.reviewBody: It\'s facade is incredibly gorgeous. Of course if you are in Zacatecas you are gonna go there.\nIf you are thinking of not going or you\'re not much into cathedrals.. please go!

136020283.name: The Beauty of Arquitecture
136020283.author: a TripAdvisor user
136020283.reviewBody: This building is just beutiful, despite the religion, if you appreciate arquitecture is like paradise at night

131351109.name: Beautiful architecture
131351109.author: a TripAdvisor user
131351109.reviewBody: I didn\'t go inside as I\'m not Catholic, but it is an amazingly beautiful building.

122589515.name: Just WOW!
122589515.author: a TripAdvisor user
122589515.reviewBody: It\'s trully a jewel of Mexican arquitecture even if your not catholic this church is worth a trip to look at art at its purest!

674682630.name: Outstanding
674682630.author: a TripAdvisor user
674682630.reviewBody: A wonderful museum featuring sculptures by Pedro Coronel in addition to his own collection of a range of artists including such well known names such as Dali and, especially Joan Miro. A highlight of a trip to Zacatecas. A must see.

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

629011538.name: Zacatecas top 5 visits places
629011538.author: a TripAdvisor user
629011538.reviewBody: A museum of modern art in the heart of historic distric Zacatecas . A lot of art, paintings and sculptures of good quality and authors . A beautiful restored building in what used to be a prision. You would be surprise to find this modern art expresion in the midle of one of the most colonial cities in Mexico .

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

618061173.name: Another artist with great taste!
618061173.author: a TripAdvisor user
618061173.reviewBody: This museum contains the art collected by one of the Corunel brothers. He had a great eye for art, and the collection shows it.\n\nI was astounded that such a small place contained so many world quality museums, and cannot wait to revisit it.

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

599373831.name: One of the best I\'ve experienced
599373831.author: a TripAdvisor user
599373831.reviewBody: Based on the reasonable cost, no art museum can touch this one for value. There is 3rd century BC art from the Middle East and India, there are Picasso, Goyas (many drawings), Miro, Ernst. Asian art, Mexican art. Paintings sculptures. All beautifully presented. First class all the way.

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

598320796.name: Impressive building filled with modern art
598320796.author: a TripAdvisor user
598320796.reviewBody: I enjoyed the building most and the individual smaller exhibits like the one on Africa and the comparison of  art from different countries to the Mexican art.

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

581421451.name: MUST see
581421451.author: a TripAdvisor user
581421451.reviewBody: EXCELLENT EXCELLENT!  thoroughly enjoyed. (Don\'t miss  another treasure; brother Rafael Coronel mask museum as well)

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

579331632.name: An absolute must in Zacatecas
579331632.author: a TripAdvisor user
579331632.reviewBody: This museum,which carries the name of a celebrated Mexican painter, is situated in an old convent Colegio de la Pur\u00edsima Concepci\u00f3n in 17th century. It has a chequered history as it was given to Dominican friars after expulsion of jesuits in 18th century, then abandoned and served until 1962 as a prison! It was opened as the museum when Pedro Coronel decided in 1983 to donate his impressive collection.\nThe collection is nothing short of breathtaking. In addition to interesting paintings by the artist who gave his name to the museum, there are literally dozens of Juan Miros, Picassos, Marino Marinis, Max Ernest and even Salvador Dali.  There is also a most impressive collection of African and Asian art. An absolute feast for the eye!

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

571672299.name: Beautiful!
571672299.author: a TripAdvisor user
571672299.reviewBody: Zacatecas has many beautiful museums and this is a must see! It\u2019s right next to Santo Domingo so it\u2019s an easy stop as your checking out the museum!

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

484108173.name: Wonderful collection of paintings
484108173.author: a TripAdvisor user
484108173.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the paintings here. There are many rooms, with Picasso, Goya, Dali, and Miro represented through lithographs.

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

475314639.name: Very nice collection of art
475314639.author: a TripAdvisor user
475314639.reviewBody: Beautiful building in excellent conditions, easy to walk through all displays of different pieces of art from the private collection of Pedro Coronel, recognized artist from Zacatecas. Abstract work.

itemReviewed.name: Pedro Coronel Museum (Museo de Pedro Coronel)

598322520.name: Pretty rosa church and plaza
598322520.author: a TripAdvisor user
598322520.reviewBody: The church is built in a more sober Baroque style and has some fine details inside. In front is the lovely and lively Plaza Domingo.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

579330831.name: Fabulous church, competing in beauty with Cathedral
579330831.author: a TripAdvisor user
579330831.reviewBody: You have to plan your visit to the church very carefully because it is open only for the morning mass and at about 5.30pm. It was well worthwhile the wait as the church\u00b4s interior is equally impressive.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

571674067.name: Visit at night too!
571674067.author: a TripAdvisor user
571674067.reviewBody: This church is beautiful at night and during the day. At night you can take a picture of it with downtown and the Bufa in the background.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

503601837.name: Nice.
503601837.author: a TripAdvisor user
503601837.reviewBody: The church is beautiful from the outside. The pink stone really added to the charm. Sadly we did not see the inside as it was closed when we arrived.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

487142049.name: Beautiful
487142049.author: a TripAdvisor user
487142049.reviewBody: This is a beautiful churcch, decorated with stained glass windows and paintings.  Although the Cathedral of Zacatecas is extremly beautiful on the outside, the Santo Domingo is much, much more beautiful in the inside.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

444435905.name: Must See!!!!
444435905.author: a TripAdvisor user
444435905.reviewBody: Attended a beautiful Mass and soaked in centuries of spirituality.  Don\'t miss this holy place, regardless of your faith.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

283933141.name: Beautiful and characteristic example of Spanish Colonial architecture.
283933141.author: a TripAdvisor user
283933141.reviewBody: The church recently underwent a major restoration project.  It\'s a fine example of the architecture and adornments in Spanish Colonial churches of the period, especially is areas where Spanish colonists found gold and silver.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

262712998.name: Historical church and a nice plaza adjacent to it!
262712998.author: a TripAdvisor user
262712998.reviewBody: Historical church and a nice plaza adjacent to it! The Church is good for a nice stroll, particularly around its adjacent plaza which is very aesthetic!

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

243399213.name: You must visit it.
243399213.author: a TripAdvisor user
243399213.reviewBody: While the cathedral is impressive, this church is magnificent with its pink facade and wonderful interior.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

234218492.name: "melancholy?"
234218492.author: a TripAdvisor user
234218492.reviewBody: How can a building be melancholy??? This large and in my opinion slightly shabby looking church is on Plazuela Santo Domingo. Inside it has some not so shabby altars. Built by the Jesuits, it was taken over by the Dominicans when the Jesuits were expelled from Mexico.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

637079078.name: Really impressive!
637079078.author: a TripAdvisor user
637079078.reviewBody: This orange pink Gothic church was a great surprise during our "getting lost" walk tour. It was located pretty close to our hotel and the Residencia de los Gobernadores, which has been converted into a museum. This catholic church is dedicated to Our Lady of Fatima and we all were really delightful for visiting this magnificent building. My little son enjoyed climbing the front stairs and the adults took excellent photographs of the exterior and interior of this church. Keep in mind that, dress code is really enforced in Zacatecas religious buildings.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

579332213.name: Beautiful  20th century church
579332213.author: a TripAdvisor user
579332213.reviewBody: This beautiful church was started in in 1950s but only finished in 2000 due to lack of funding, when it was consecrated. It was built in Gothic style and made of fabulous local orange pink stone.\nAs the church is not so close to the centre, try to combine with a visit to the Francisco Goitia museum which originally was the residence of governors. It is only two minuets walk from Fatima church.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

571674832.name: Beautiful
571674832.author: a TripAdvisor user
571674832.reviewBody: The church is located a little outside of downtown. You can see it from many parts of the city. I\u2019ve never gone in, but it is gorgeous!

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

548042111.name: Our Lady of Fatima Church
548042111.author: a TripAdvisor user
548042111.reviewBody: A very beautiful church located in Zacatecas, it\u2019s arquitecture is really interesting. It was made of pink stone with a gothic style

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

455498503.name: Gorgeous!
455498503.author: a TripAdvisor user
455498503.reviewBody:
If you are doing a self-guided walking tour of Zacatecas, this cathedral is NOT to be missed! It's stunning day OR night and we visited it during both times. The church sits on a hill about a 5 minute walk from the Parque Sierra de Alicia,   two blocks uphill from the Goitia Museum. 
During the day, you can really appreciate the striking Gothic architecture, quite unexpected among the traditional Baroque Spanish cathedrals of Mexico. The dark stained glass windows are just beautiful, and you really should see them from inside the church. It should be noted that this is a very modern cathedral, begun in 1950 and completed in 2000.
At night, the cathedral is lit and affords many photo opportunities from the site as well as from afar.
One of my favorite churches in Mexico. And I've seen, well, A LOT of cathedrals. Don't miss it! 

Enjoy Zacatecas!

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

445942609.name: Neogothic church (weird in Mexico)
445942609.author: a TripAdvisor user
445942609.reviewBody: For people who appreciate churches\' architecture, this one is a must. Beautiful building! and pretty weird to find in Mexico. It worth the visit!

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

444436634.name: Faithful
444436634.author: a TripAdvisor user
444436634.reviewBody: The history of the origin of this church is AMAZING.  It is a reminder of the call to faith. Inspirational and beautiful!

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

374849503.name: Absolutely beautiful.
374849503.author: a TripAdvisor user
374849503.reviewBody: Unfortunately went there on a Sunday afternoon and wasn\'t appropriately dressed for mass but the church is absolutely beautiful.  Wish I\'d seen the inside in depth.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

364463326.name: Gothic Church
364463326.author: a TripAdvisor user
364463326.reviewBody: This local catholic church was built with Gothic Architecture, it is unique in its kind in Zacatecas.\nIf you are planning to get married here, be conscious that before or after your wedding a dead guy can enter or be out of the church on their coffin, with a lot of sad people crying for his/her death because there is a funerary in front of the church and they do lot of celebrations in that church.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

353378985.name: One of the prettiest sites in the city.
353378985.author: a TripAdvisor user
353378985.reviewBody: Complete with a Labyrinth, this stunning building holds many beautiful stain glass windows. Alittle off the beaten track but worth seeing for sure.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Fatima

618062235.name: Felguerez!!!
618062235.author: a TripAdvisor user
618062235.reviewBody: Felguerez was Mexico\'s first abstract artist. I was first introduced to his wonderful art at a special show at the Bellas Artes in CDMX. When I learned there was a museum of his art in Zacatecas, I decided that I would have to go see it. I was not disappointed! An unexpected bonus was all the other great museums in this seemingly tiny town.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

583434662.name: Dont forte to visit this museum!!
583434662.author: a TripAdvisor user
583434662.reviewBody: This museum is a must visit, its very interesting to see the life of this painter.and he is still alivie.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

571673690.name: Abstract art
571673690.author: a TripAdvisor user
571673690.reviewBody: This is another one o Zacatecas\u2019 amazing museums. I could have spent hours here. The abstract art is great!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

564729339.name: Must see!
564729339.author: a TripAdvisor user
564729339.reviewBody: This museum has a very extensive collection. You enter into a sculptural exhibit which feels like you are outdoors.  Then we went through many rooms with outstanding works of art.  The size and scope of the collections are mind blowing.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

524714778.name: Great museum
524714778.author: a TripAdvisor user
524714778.reviewBody: The museum has a lot of Felgueres Artwork as well as other Mexican artists.\nThe building has outstanding museoghaphy.\nI was pleased to visit this place

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

512331111.name: A small piece of greatness Mexico can offer to the world.
512331111.author: a TripAdvisor user
512331111.reviewBody: I had always being familiar with the work of this artist but never had the chance to visit the museum\'s collection. All that you find here is fulfill with a unique creativity and an immense source of pure inspiration. All from Manuel Felguerez\'s collection to the other artist\'s works to the building and its history is magical. This museum is a must if visiting Zacatecas!!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

509686756.name: A unique experience
509686756.author: a TripAdvisor user
509686756.reviewBody: Located center of this beautiful city. Easy walking from town center, this gallery offers a fine variety of excellent Mexican artists.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

470147968.name: Amazing artwork, amazing space
470147968.author: a TripAdvisor user
470147968.reviewBody: Myself and my three traveling companions all agreed this was the best of our visit to Zacatecas. The Mexican abstract art was exceptional and the gardens and interior spaces were mesmerizing. I highly recommend this museum if you like abstract art at all.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

447279939.name: Manuel Felguerez Museum
447279939.author: a TripAdvisor user
447279939.reviewBody: Great museum. It is a must. One of the best I have seen of abstract art. It is worth to go. Pieces very well selected

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

446568138.name: A bit out of the way, but...
446568138.author: a TripAdvisor user
446568138.reviewBody: A bit out of the way, but well worth the extra effort. Stunning building and impressive collection. Knowledgeable and helpful manager of the museum. He drove me back to my hotel when I couldn\'t find a taxi.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Arte Abstracto Manuel Felguerez

623351102.name: Very nice views!
623351102.author: a TripAdvisor user
623351102.reviewBody: This is a really beatiful spot in the city! I took a lot of pictures of every angle, and I just couldn\u00b4t get enough of it. I was in the hotel across the street, so I had the chance to see it at day and at night. It is so beatiful at night with all the lights on the church and the buildings around the plaza! The only thing is there was a lot of drunk people there, and it was kind of annoying.

598322125.name: Gorgeous plaza
598322125.author: a TripAdvisor user
598322125.reviewBody: A beautiful open space that is lovely to visit during the day and so beautiful at night when it is lit up. The buildings such as the Palacio de Gobierno depict the richness of the era. \nIt is a lively venue, with vendors nearby, children playing and people relaxing.

545153488.name: Great views in the middle of the city
545153488.author: a TripAdvisor user
545153488.reviewBody: The plaza is the open space north of the cathedral. The Palacio de Gobierno on the plaza\'s east side was built in the 18th century for a colonial family. In the turret of its main staircase is a mural of the history of Zacatecas state, painted in 1970 by Antonio Rodr\u00edguez.

528831590.name: Nice walk through time!
528831590.author: a TripAdvisor user
528831590.reviewBody:
Beautiful scenario, traveling in time to the past, accompanied of peregrinations, nice areas to walk take a coffee, a lot of art, public concerts.

If not located in downtown avoid taking your vehicle, very busy, take Uber or hotel transportation, not a lot of parking area, focus on your experience rather parking.

Enjoy!

524998595.name: Always something going on here.
524998595.author: a TripAdvisor user
524998595.reviewBody: This plaza always has something going on here.  From the September 15th Independence day celebration, to concerts, to art shows, to marathons, it is the center of what is happening in Zacatecas.  I stay in the Hotel Emporio which is right across the street and I always have a front row view of everythng from the roof top terrace.

384193676.name: Avoid in winter
384193676.author: a TripAdvisor user
384193676.reviewBody: We visited in wintertime, the plaza itself was hidden by tribunes, large skating rink and loads of wiring all around. Far too many people for our taste, so we avoided it.

361025217.name: Venue for outdoor concerts
361025217.author: a TripAdvisor user
361025217.reviewBody: The Plaza de Armas is used for big outdoor concerts at different times of the year. At these times security is tight and there are people everywhere. Concertgoers line up 4-5 hours in advance for popular artists.

323254710.name: Always something happening!
323254710.author: a TripAdvisor user
323254710.reviewBody: Adjacent to the cathedral, this space often house performances of many kinds. With imaginative lighting and dancing waters from its fountain, this busy plaza is worth a visit.

292919797.name: Nothing here
292919797.author: a TripAdvisor user
292919797.reviewBody: I loved the city, but this plaza doesn\'t offer anything and is mostly empty.\n\nThe cathedral is located here and is the only thing to do at this plaza.

291926350.name: nice plaza
291926350.author: a TripAdvisor user
291926350.reviewBody: it\'s about a nice colonial era plaza surrounded by many nice old buildings , it\'s a good place for a walk or to have a seat in it.

281904240.name: Good place to hear music.
281904240.author: a TripAdvisor user
281904240.reviewBody: Its a plaza, there is music and there is drunk people by night, the place is safe and its worth walking to it on a weekend and just enjoy the place with the locals. During the day is just another plaza.

262714859.name: Nice Colonial Plaza another example of why Zacatecas is a wonderful stop!
262714859.author: a TripAdvisor user
262714859.reviewBody: Nice Colonial Plaza another example of why Zacatecas is a wonderful stop! As many colonial plazas are ... this is a wonderful place to walk around and imagine how this place was thousands of years ago!

234219314.name: So-so
234219314.author: a TripAdvisor user
234219314.reviewBody: To my mind, this is one of the more mundane principal plazas I\'ve seen in Mexico. It\'s not even in front of the Cathedral, but instead is parked next to it, like an afterthought, below street level, with a shabby city hall running its length. It did offer some comfy seating, however, and was great for people-watching.

219869878.name: palacio
219869878.author: a TripAdvisor user
219869878.reviewBody: unexpected result. during our visit, the International Festival of Folklore of dancing was going on and the main stage was at this plaza. free admission. saw some great acts, locally as well as internationally.

211231838.name: great place... lots of music in summer
211231838.author: a TripAdvisor user
211231838.reviewBody: Great open place (in front of the cathedral)... In summer be prepared to hear a lot of music and chaos

146459283.name: Meet me here
146459283.author: a TripAdvisor user
146459283.reviewBody: This is where all the major gatherings occur, since its next to the Cathedral. While you walk around this historic city you will most likely pass through here. In the evening there was a motorcycle club gathering which you could here blocks away.

671915033.name: An impressive excursion into an infamous mine
671915033.author: a TripAdvisor user
671915033.reviewBody:
This was the main silver mine of Zacatecas and one of the richest of the world. It was exploited by the Spanish conquerors starting from the end of the 16th century, and its operations continued until 1965, when it was closed because the mine was too close to the city centre. Thereafter it was adapted as a museum, a tourist attraction, and an entertainment place (I was told that there is a discotheque in its bowels). This mine is a must for any visitor of Zacatecas. 

The mine is practically in town. The entrance is on the slopes of the "La Bufa" hill, but there is also a second entrance nearer to the Zócalo, which is however used only as an exit. The visit is very informative and educational; it is guided and is carried out in small groups; it lasts about one hour, plus the time needed for visiting the museum, which is also located within the mine. The visit starts at the upper entrance, where a lift brings you into the bowels of the mine; you are then guided through a certain number of tunnels and terminate your visit in the museum; then you are transported by train to the lower entrance of the mine, from where you exit.

The guides are very competent, but in most visits the explanations are given in Spanish language. The guides narrate the history of mining in this area, from the pre-Hispanic times until today; they describe the horrible conditions in which the miners had to work, often accompanied by their children who, in case that their father died, had to replace him in the work; they illustrate the dangers incurred by the miners, from the fıredamp gas (grisù) to the flooding, from the poisoning caused by arsenic and chromium to the painful death by silicosis. They also illustrate the techniques used for mining and show the silver veins still present in the walls and in the vaults of the tunnels, together with the veins of other minerals. The working conditions are clearly represented by reconstructions made with life-size manikins wearing the clothes of the time and holding the instruments of the time. The visit terminates at the museum, where a rich collectıon of samples of the various minerals is displayed. At the end of the visit it is customary to tip the guide.

The mine is open every day from 10:00 to 18:00. At the upper entrance there is a kiosk selling refreshments and there are restrooms.

667656987.name: "The Mine of El Eden: The Natural Richness of Zacatecas" - and you are going down by train! :)
667656987.author: a TripAdvisor user
667656987.reviewBody: The title are words from Madam Veronica Santamaria. It was the mining in the city of Zacatecas she meant - and this beautiful city was in the end declared a World Cultural Heritage Site by UNESCO - and all this because of the welth from the mine.This welth was given to Zacatecas for a period of about 250 years.  Now "El Eden" is the only open mine in Mexico - It is a \'must see\' for those who are interested in the history of the mining industry in Zacatecas - the presentation is about history of mining for silver and gold in Mexico, I guess.\n"Mine El Eden" still makes a lot of money - it\'s the tourist destination #1! in the area  and even by night the mina maybe empty your wallets - you can "go by train down" to a spectacular underground "Night club"!! :)

666492343.name: Take lots of time
666492343.author: a TripAdvisor user
666492343.reviewBody: There is lots to see and visit here. The tour was great. We saw lots of minerals in the walls and ceilings. There were great dioramas. Amazing information. Lots of interesting displays in the mineral collections. I would certainly go again.

662497123.name: Excellent experience
662497123.author: a TripAdvisor user
662497123.reviewBody:
Put on your yellow hardhat, board the train and disappear into the history that made Zacatetas what it is today.Mina El Eden produced more silver than almost any other mine in Mexico.

Inside the mine you'll wonder how people could work under such conditions from 1586 until the 1960s. Of course, many of them were enslaved by the Spanards for hundreds of years. Even with a concrete trail and lots of lighting, one feels the claustrophia of mining. You'll get a small understanding of what was it like for a slave miner to hang from a small seat on a crack in the earth hammering out a chunk of silver-bearing rock. You'll also understand why so many children died while collecting and carrying water throughout the mine.  

The start of the tour takes you through a wonderful mineral museum that will amaze you with the beauty and creativity of this old rock on which we live.

661448717.name: Highlight of my day
661448717.author: a TripAdvisor user
661448717.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the tour and even though we were the only ones who didnt speak spanish the guide gave us some good info (he was bilingual). The history of the mine and going deep underground was a fun and educational day!!

649367295.name: Informative
649367295.author: a TripAdvisor user
649367295.reviewBody: A must place to visit in Zacatecas. History of how zacatecas became an important city in the colonial time.

641363114.name: nice visit for families
641363114.author: a TripAdvisor user
641363114.reviewBody: This spot is very popular with tourists so come early if you want to avoid the crowd. The tour is nice and very informative and the museum of fossils and different kinds of quartzes and other stones at the end is quite impressive

637743137.name: Very good experience, highly recommended
637743137.author: a TripAdvisor user
637743137.reviewBody: We went before to another minas but this one is the best , the money invested is a price less if you are in Zacatecas this is a must do.

636364342.name: Extremely interesting
636364342.author: a TripAdvisor user
636364342.reviewBody: The experience is all about the company. Well it\'s true. The guide was an extremely fun one, we had a lot of fun with him.so it was a very interesting tour. We had a lot of fun with friends and learned a lot from the museum. At night we even went to the mine club, the only one in the world. And it was epic!!!

635874553.name: Exciting!
635874553.author: a TripAdvisor user
635874553.reviewBody: This visit has been recorded in my child\'s memory as very exciting. Be prepared to walk through slippery surfaces and I recommend you to wear appropriate garments (sweater or similar, and avoid sandals) to experience this from start to end. The tour took us in a small train traveling through the tunnels of this depleted silver mine and arriving to a night club literally underground. It is a family adventure we will never forget. This spot is a must in your next visit to Zacatecas, Mexico.

633931496.name: Interesting n professional
633931496.author: a TripAdvisor user
633931496.reviewBody: I visited this place last week and it was a good experience learning about mining in the region. Whole thing was done professionally and guide was very knowledgeable definitely recommend to everyone however it is not very tight squeeze walking around it might get a little calostro phobic to some over all it was good

618059968.name: Terrific
618059968.author: a TripAdvisor user
618059968.reviewBody: While this mine was not as scary as I thought it would be, given the horrific history of the place, I still thoroughly "enjoyed" my visit. I would definitely do this again.

615445598.name: Very cool!
615445598.author: a TripAdvisor user
615445598.reviewBody: The Mina is very cool. The gift shops in the area were nice. The tour itself was great, they gave you a cover for the helmet, which is very clean and much appreciated. Would highly recommend. There is also a bar in the cave which looked great, we didn\'t have a chance to come back to check it out.

608682507.name: Interesting and pleasant
608682507.author: a TripAdvisor user
608682507.reviewBody: This tour takes about an hour. Zacatecas is a mining town, the source of the riches which adorns the historic center, so it would be a huge miss if you did not experience being inside the historic (now out of commission) mine. Our guide Manuel was fantastic, he explained both in English and Spanish. Other guides seemed equally helpful. You do not hire the guide by the way, they are part of the tour. But, you tip at the end if you are pleased with the experience. A toy train (like the ones in some zoos and alike) takes you in and out of the gallery. You walk around with the group for a short distance once inside. The mine is air conditioned, so no worries. Helmets are mandatory, and they are provided.

599915139.name: Wonderful family experiance!
599915139.author: a TripAdvisor user
599915139.reviewBody:
Few minutes drive from the Cathedral, so we took a taxi.  We got our tickets, and wandered around their beautiful gift shops. The bathroom facilities were very clean! They gave us a mesh to put on our hair, then a yellow helmet.  They will even take a picture of you with shovels and stuff very cool.
We got into a secured covered little train to the mine,  the tour guide spoke english once he knew we didn't which was great!!! 
Tue history if how the mine came aboit, how many people lost their lives working there, how many people moved to town because of this mine is mind blowing! 
There is a very nice display if all the minerals found, there is a suvaneer shop inside even a bar/club!!! 
Totally recommended, its a bit chilly so I would bring a jacket for the little ones! Please be aware they d9 not have helmets for the little ones, only adults!

589845683.name: Fascinating part of Zacatecas history
589845683.author: a TripAdvisor user
589845683.reviewBody: The mine is very well done.  We were lucky to have a very knowledgeable English-speaking guide, who is there every day except Tuesday.  You ride through the tunnels on a train, then do about a 20 minute walking tour through all the different veins and learn about the heart-breaking history of the mine.  It is extremely well done, with statutes and figures to demonstrate how the work was done.  They have a very interesting rock and mineral museum, where you wander through for 15 minutes.  Afterwards, you can take the train up to the teleferico.  There is also a nightclub/bar that operates Thursday-Saturday (check the days) that is apparently the only one of a kind in the world - a bar in a mine.  The people are very warm and helpful, and we thoroughly enjoyed the tour.  It was well worth it.  Cost 100 pesos per person.

588286583.name: Exciting
588286583.author: a TripAdvisor user
588286583.reviewBody:
I had 0 interest in going thru a mine but it was really great.
I wish i had gone to the Saturday night fest when there is live music. It must be just amazing.
Check it out first thing when u get here so maybe at least the bar is open for u to see.
I believe Thursday and Friday for the bar but the dance floor is all quartz! I will come back some day and see it.
But just the normal tour is great.

584176817.name: Great Experience
584176817.author: a TripAdvisor user
584176817.reviewBody: I arrived just after the mine opened and found myself on a tour with just one other person.  Our guide was excellent and presented information in both Spanish and English.  While the mine is very interesting and well presented the museum of mineral samples from all over the world was amazing.  They have a small but fascinating fossil collection that should not be missed.  An added plus is that the mine is a nice cool place to spend a few hours.

583434023.name: Must visit!!
583434023.author: a TripAdvisor user
583434023.reviewBody: You must visit the ed\u00e9n\u2019s mine. Its very interesting, they have really good guides. Outside you can buy geodes.

577469837.name: Visit if you are in Zacatecas
577469837.author: a TripAdvisor user
577469837.reviewBody: The place itself and the experience is worth it. Kids were amazed about getting inside an old mine, this tour was rich in centuries of history, and it\u00b4s early history (slaves, dangerous conditions, sweltering temperatures) is unnerving. At the end of the tour you can visit a quartz rock museum and a store while waiting for the train ride to exit the mine. There\'s also a night club in the mine - the only one in the world-, it opens only Thursday & Friday like a bar and Sat as a night club (for over 18) . Well worth the visit if you are in Zacatecas.

567341493.name: Great
567341493.author: a TripAdvisor user
567341493.reviewBody: Great experience we loved it. Very nice guide. Very well kept attraction.\n Very well organized. Strongly recommended.

567302842.name: Not really worth it
567302842.author: a TripAdvisor user
567302842.reviewBody: You wait for the train and are carried into the mine. You get off and are alone in the dark with an overload of mineral stones on display and a store. Everything explained in Spanish only. The Spanish speaking guide lets you alone. Later he leads you into a \u201eDisney\u201c kind of cave showing how native workers did their job, scaring but nothing new.

567212738.name: Zacatecas\u2019 history
567212738.author: a TripAdvisor user
567212738.reviewBody: You take a train into the mine. My friends spoke mostly English so they had a hard time understanding the presentations, but we loved it. Interest information and picture opportunities.

566056397.name: Mine was great but hard to enjoy without speaking Spanish.
566056397.author: a TripAdvisor user
566056397.reviewBody: This was one of the few places we went where not knowing the language was a real barrier. We could tell our guide had wonderful stories and was very interesting and funny by watching the reaction of the rest of our group, but he knew very little English (almost none) and we no very little Spanish. I had read up on some of the history ahead of time but wished I had read more. It would of made the tour more enjoyable. On this one we were bored and would of rather explored the mine ourselves instead of standing for long periods of time while our guide told stories.  They have done a great job on this tour of showing what it is like underground. Even with our limited Spanish we could understand how difficult it was for the people who had to work the mines.

562350601.name: Don\u2019t miss it!!
562350601.author: a TripAdvisor user
562350601.reviewBody: Fun and fast train ride. Great for goofy pictures. Tour guides know English.  Our guide forgot we didn\u2019t speak Spanish but gave us a private repeat tour on the way back. Very courteous and friendly. Told us to come back for the disco at night but it is only on Saturday and we were leaving town.

555633350.name: Beautiful and unreal mine
555633350.author: a TripAdvisor user
555633350.reviewBody: Very nice experience, not a problem if you feel claustrophobic as you wont noticed. Lights inside are really good to have a good view of the mine. All very safe to get into. Nice souvenirs at the end of the tour :)

555322197.name: Loved the crystal stores
555322197.author: a TripAdvisor user
555322197.reviewBody: I went there for the crystals not the tour. And it did not disappoint. Beautiful stones at great prices. If you are a stone lover, It\u2019s a must. :)

550727057.name: Fun tour!
550727057.author: a TripAdvisor user
550727057.reviewBody: The mine is easy to walk to as it is in town. You are required to go on a guided tour, which begins with a fun little train ride. The tour lasts an hour and then you either leave via elevator to somewhere in the town or backtrack to the beginning where you can enjoy the rock museum before leaving. The backtracking is fun because you can stop and enjoy some of the views as the tour is fast paced. But the two-way traffic can get congested and annoying. They pack a lot of people into the mine at one time.

548898744.name: Unique Mine Tour But.......
548898744.author: a TripAdvisor user
548898744.reviewBody: The El Edin mine tour is both interesting and unique but, given our limited Spanish, we missed much of what seemed to be a thorough description of conditions in the mine over its life. The trip starts with a rail car ride into the mine and then a walk out through old mine shafts stopping at various exhibits on the way. In retrospect, we should have arranged to bring a translator along to get full value for our visit.

545152956.name: Mina El Eden is an interesting visit, although most of it it consists in old tales and long historical explanations.
545152956.author: a TripAdvisor user
545152956.reviewBody: Not really worthwhile, most of the visit is about walking and listening. Try visiting museums at down town.

544662731.name: A glimpse into history
544662731.author: a TripAdvisor user
544662731.reviewBody: If you plan on visiting the wonderful town of Zacatecas put this on your list of places to visit. We walked from the center of town up to the main entrance into the mine, we were given yellow hard hats and boarded a small train that led deep underground into the mine. The clanking sound of the train as you go deeper and deeper was fun! If you have anyone that doesn\'t like to walk this is a very gentle journey and worth the visit, no stairs involved. They have an underground museum with fantastic specimens of all kinds of rocks that have been mined from all over the world. It\'s great for kids and adults. Then you walk on the pathway into the mines and hear the stories of the Spanish who enslaved the locals because they knew the value of the silver found here. There is a small cafe, clean bathrooms, and several gift shops to explore. Well worth it. Our guide spoke good English and was able to translate the stories for us with a good sense of humor too.

539854622.name: Interesting place
539854622.author: a TripAdvisor user
539854622.reviewBody: Due to the big background of mining in Zacatecas it was on my to do list and was the right choice. The guided tour is real helpful if you want also to know the background and all the facts about the mine. It is really recommend to have this trip inside the mine and see all his beautiful areas. Don\'t miss it if you are in Zacatecas

537673443.name: It\'s a mine
537673443.author: a TripAdvisor user
537673443.reviewBody: There were some interesting stories here and some fun things to see. There is not English translation so I hope you speak Spanish well.

536177625.name: Mina El Eden
536177625.author: a TripAdvisor user
536177625.reviewBody: A must do in Zacatecas. Well worth the time. \nYou will begin your adventure by getting prepared for your train ride into the mountain. You will have a guide to show you where to go. Once you are in the mountain you will observe a type of historical museum. Quite interesting. Then you will go into the old section where the mining took place. Absolutely stunning to see the depth of the mountain. \nEnjoy and happy travels.

534926435.name: Mine Del Eden .  a must to visit for any tourist in Zacatecas
534926435.author: a TripAdvisor user
534926435.reviewBody: The  history of the mine and all the legends about the mine are just exceptional , and when you get in the the mine and  start walking inside the mine is just incredible  we love it, and  our tour  guide Jorge he really knows Zacatecas   all the legends and history about the town .

528596910.name: Well preserved and interesting History
528596910.author: a TripAdvisor user
528596910.reviewBody:
Took tour that included the visit to city in open bus and the mine, included guide.

It was totally worth the experience, important how the knowledge of the well prepared guides can dress the visiting zones very interesting history of Mexico some years ago.

Mine is well preserved for visitors and tours.

528588663.name: Great visit.
528588663.author: a TripAdvisor user
528588663.reviewBody: Incredible place, we had an excellent tour guide, has a good rock museum. A must see in Zacatecas. :)

527956636.name: awesome
527956636.author: a TripAdvisor user
527956636.reviewBody: it\'s a club down in a silver mine, the adventure begin with in a little train, that carry you deep in the mine, there is not recommended for claustrophobic people, the sound of the music is awesome, it\'s hard to get tickets, so you need to go to the mine early in the morning because tickets are sold only for friday and saturday and some holydays and the mine just have capacity about 300 people

525861480.name: Great activity
525861480.author: a TripAdvisor user
525861480.reviewBody: We went there and the tour was awesome. So much history. Our tour guide was also great, very hilarious. I do recommend it.

523860646.name: Family trip
523860646.author: a TripAdvisor user
523860646.reviewBody: This was very interesting to visit. A lot of stuff to take in. Not sure if there is a English tour guide but our spoke Spanish and he was super funny. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes as you will walk a lot. It\'s well worth it. We also did the nightclub which you\'ll need to buy tickets in advance. I must do.

515046884.name: Nice, big and interesting
515046884.author: a TripAdvisor user
515046884.reviewBody: Here you really feel what it takes to be in the center of the Earth (or seems a lot like) really interesting the tour.

512342930.name: Nice walk...
512342930.author: a TripAdvisor user
512342930.reviewBody: To get there is a bit of a hike, but the kids had fun, the tour lasts about an hour and there is a nice shop inside and is not expensive... You can go inside with food and beverages that you can buy there including beer!!!  The kids loved it!!!

509462254.name: One of a Kind Experience!!
509462254.author: a TripAdvisor user
509462254.reviewBody: Definitely a must do if you\'re in the city. We wanted to go to the night club but didn\'t have time. The mine during the day is a great couples, friends or group family trip if you have kids!!

506890543.name: Great views
506890543.author: a TripAdvisor user
506890543.reviewBody: We took a taxi up to the Bufa, then walked back down. The walk is about 30 mins, a little hard on the knees but worth the experience.

506838865.name: Good but could easily be better!
506838865.author: a TripAdvisor user
506838865.reviewBody:
The mine itself is quite a unique experience. Yes, there are two entrances and the "train entrance" is definitely more exciting than the "elevator ride" entrance. Just be sure to go back the same way you went in to get to your car. Take exact change to pay for parking (30 pesos) and tickets to the mine are 100 pesos each, unless you have a student ID, 80 pesos. With dollar at 17, it's not expensive at all. 

The part that could easily be addressed by management here are the guides themselves. I did request an English speaking guide and unfortunately there was no one available. Nor was I given the opportunity to wait for one to become available. I am bilingual but the guide rapidly recited her very scripted tour so quickly I found myself completely lost trying to understand her presentation. I thought perhaps I could translate for the rest of the group I was with and honestly, I could not.

Guides here need to SLOW down, and perhaps the management could invest in an informational guide/pamphlet/booklet in several languages to follow along with. I'm going to go way out there and even suggest a recorded guide on a device with headphones...maybe? or maybe an app we can download the tour on our own devices and listen on a self guided tour? Maybe? Please! I mean, hello 20th century!? I even attempted to look up information on line but as you can imagine the wifi signal several stories down into the middle of a mountain was, non-existent.   

Two people went back the next day and were with a group of local school children, they said they were able to understand a bit more as the guide spoke much more slowly for the kids.  Overall, it's a Zacatecas must! I just wish they did more for non-Spanish or limited Spanish speaking visitors. 

Word of caution, we waited about an hour to exit the mine as there were many groups while we were there, and only one train.

506600470.name: Amazing!!
506600470.author: a TripAdvisor user
506600470.reviewBody: Great place to visit in Zacatecas. Tour guides are very friendly and patient with all visitors. Need to visit the nightclub next time.

505791094.name: Interesting and cool to see
505791094.author: a TripAdvisor user
505791094.reviewBody: We bought a tour downtown that included sights downtown, Mina El Eden and Cerro de la Bufa. The guide was very friendly and made things really interesting.  The Mine is a must visit! Includes a museum, a mini train ride, gift shop and tour inside the mine.

504976477.name: Oldest & Largest Mine--Awesome Museum
504976477.author: a TripAdvisor user
504976477.reviewBody: Mina Eden...the old colonial city of Zacatecas dates back to 1548 when silver was discovered here. The oldest & largest mine was worked until the 1960\'s called Mina Eden. It\'s now a major tourist attraction in the city. The fossil, rock\'s & mineral\'s museum there is magnificent too.

500072983.name: Superb! But arrive before noon :-)
500072983.author: a TripAdvisor user
500072983.reviewBody:
I heard that the mine was a good place to visit so around 11am Sunday I walked up and virtually no queue! Perfect I paid my $100 and took a seat. The tour was in Spanish But the guide was kind enough to give me a review after each section in English!
So took the train into the mine!!
Around 320 meters deep! Took a 15 minute tour around the museum then bought a gem stone for $10 Not too bad!
Next across the rail track for the tour! Very interesting and a worthwhile tour! I followed along and the knowledge of my guide was impressive.
After the tour you can either take the elevator that brings you out nearer downtown Zacatecas - Or as I did walk back thru the mine and take the train back to the entrance way in. There I took a look around the gift shop and bought a mug and some jewelry.
Very interesting But take a jumper as can be cool...
Recommenced :-)

499664392.name: modernized mine
499664392.author: a TripAdvisor user
499664392.reviewBody: Once you get to the mine it\'s impressive the cart goes quite fast down in the middle of Mountain they si vive you a tour and time for you to take pictures and there is also some nights a week a club in it so if you want to party ir just want to take a drink this is the place to go and experience  something new

485198519.name: Fun day or night activity!
485198519.author: a TripAdvisor user
485198519.reviewBody: During the day they have tours of the mine which are so fun and at night they have a dance club!! We weren\'t able to go back for the club but it\'s on my bucket list for sure.

484101590.name: Great tour!
