484101590.author: a TripAdvisor user
484101590.reviewBody: We were two couples, and we all really enjoyed the tour. We very much appreciated the guide who spoke English for us!

482784194.name: Fun and Enjoyable
482784194.author: a TripAdvisor user
482784194.reviewBody: It is interesting the way mines worked in the 16th century. The rock museum is nice. The guided tour is very funny and entertained (not sure if there are in English).

480608407.name: A must-do in Zacatecas
480608407.author: a TripAdvisor user
480608407.reviewBody: This is a must-do if you are visiting Zacatecas. Very interesting to get to go into an underground mine. There are two entrances, both are within walking distance of the centro. I\'d recommend going to the one by the Alameda because you get to enter via train whereas the other entrance is by elevator. The price is $100 MXN for an adult. Be sure to ask for an English guide because the Spanish tour guide spoke really quickly - a bit above my ability to follow him as an intermediate-level Spanish speaker. On weekend nights the mine opens as a club/bar - looked pretty cool.

479262633.name: Exciting experience
479262633.author: a TripAdvisor user
479262633.reviewBody: Going in the mine was a great experience, to feel how the thousands of workers felt during the many years when they explored it. Could be a bit claustrophobic for some people !

478103626.name: Mandatory visit!
478103626.author: a TripAdvisor user
478103626.reviewBody: Excellent place to visit when in Zacatecas, mandatory! Really interesting the history of the place, not to mention the architecture

476930892.name: A really cool experience
476930892.author: a TripAdvisor user
476930892.reviewBody: Coming here was really cool because we went in by riding a train and then after looking at all the gem rocks that have been excavated from Mexico and also other rocks from around the world!

476162929.name: The Amazing Experience in the Mines of Zacatecas
476162929.author: a TripAdvisor user
476162929.reviewBody: When we arrived at the mine, a huge crowd had gathered. giving us some insight that the mines were going to be a good experience. Upon entrance, we were greeted with friendly hosts who made our small time in the place amazing. This happened because there were small trains that took us into the mines and they took time to come back. When we the train came, we climbed not knowing what awaited us. The mine took us to a safe level of the mines and there we toured the mine with a guide. The guide told us the stories of legends, histories and facts related to the mines. After the tour ended, we were given the freedom to explore the museum where we saw beautiful gemstones and fossil. The experience was amazing as we learned about the mines and the gemstones. It was a shame that we couldn\'t go down further in the mines as we had arrived late and the elevator was closed. All in all, a good experience for families alike, as the kids enjoyed the experience. Buena Suerte !

475314208.name: Very well organized tour into the mine and friendly guides
475314208.author: a TripAdvisor user
475314208.reviewBody: Beautiful and well presented display of minerals inside the mine, one hour tour that is a most for visitors to Zacatecas.

471770792.name: Pretty Amazing
471770792.author: a TripAdvisor user
471770792.reviewBody: Mina El Eden is a fascinating place to go and see. It was great to see everything that is down there. My Spanish is not very strong but I was still able to understand some of the information and thought that what I did understand was very interesting. I can not say much about the tour guides because we went on a tour with a different tour guide from the city. But I recommend going to see this especially if you understand Spanish.

471202566.name: Wonderful way to spend an hour or so...
471202566.author: a TripAdvisor user
471202566.reviewBody: I feel they did a fantastic job and it was easy to walk around.  The collection of minerals and fossils was a nice surprise too.  My only complaint is that my spanish isn\'t all that good so the tour being only in spanish, I missed a lot of it.  I would still recommend it, though.

469310363.name: Nice touristy place
469310363.author: a TripAdvisor user
469310363.reviewBody: We went into the mine as part of a city tour.  Our guide was not one of the regular guides from the mine but one of the guides from our city tour.  She was very good at explaining the history of the mine and especially the history of the indigenous people as miners.  The explanation she gave was the best part of the mine tour.  \n   There are 2 entrances into the mine.  We went in through the side by the hospital.  We went into the mine on a train wearing hard helmets, which we had to wear throughout the tour. There is apparently a stone museum somewhere at one of the entrances but we didn\'t get to see it.  I think it was because we were with the city tour.  The price was 100 pesos which is about $5.50 but our fee was included in our city tour fee.

469266557.name: Interesting trip into the depths
469266557.author: a TripAdvisor user
469266557.reviewBody: Quite a story to learn of the history of the mine and the people who worked in it over the years.  Wonderful collection of gems as well, but they didn\'t give us enough time to look at them. Cut our visit short to get us back on the train to the entrance.

468423984.name: Underground experience
468423984.author: a TripAdvisor user
468423984.reviewBody: A very interesting place ( although I\'m claustrophobic). The tour took around 1 hour and was very informative. The guide was super funny too. Very well explained and lots of things to see.

467908053.name: Most ridiculous tour i did
467908053.author: a TripAdvisor user
467908053.reviewBody:
Before to go i checked TripAdvisor review and seemed to be good. 
There are 2 entrances. The one ckose to the teleferic andthe other close to the hospital. It's at this entrance where you can take the train to get inside the mine. The other you will have the choice to come back by the same way or take the train to get out. Attention if you park your car at the teleferic you will need to come back by climbing very steep steps. 
Now the price. It's 100pesos and from what i experienced it's very very expensive i will recommend to save your money. For cheaper you cn get a better tour with a man who worked in the mine if you go to Guanajuato (bit more south) and pay only 35pesos. 
The guide i had his name is Jesus. He was just reciting his text and very fast. Never asked if we had questions. Attention no english so you need to be perfect in spanish. He didn't care of the group even so small it was. He didn't explained very interesting stuff. He was here because he needs to work. The nice part was the stone museum where you can see nice stones from different mines in the world. 
The train is not so exciting. 
Well i did it to have my own judgment. And i am very disappointed of this attraction

463826232.name: First time in a Mine
463826232.author: a TripAdvisor user
463826232.reviewBody: The Mine is right in the middle of town. It is out of service since the early  1900\u00b4s  and has been turned into a tourist atraction, You get your helmet , and then a little train takes you into the mine. Inside there is a mineral museum , and then you get to walk back to the entrance through different real mine tunnels where our Gide pointed out al the different mineral in the rocks . we saw gold, silver copper , cuarzo, and some others. the list is worth the time .

454419287.name: Interesting
454419287.author: a TripAdvisor user
454419287.reviewBody: Enter the mine through the north/upper entrance. It will give you a clear idea of how huge the mine is when you exit at the southern/lower exit.

452821154.name: Another must-see in Zacatecas
452821154.author: a TripAdvisor user
452821154.reviewBody:
This is one of the places you do not want to miss when you're visiting Zacatecas.

Some of the guides do not speak English, but our guide did not really have that much information to share anyway. A lot of what he had to say was cliches, odd jokes and hot air. Other than that, he was a perfectly nice guy. So don't worry if your Spanish is not that good, you're not really missing that much.

The mine itself is quite impressive and very much worth the visit.

452245184.name: Well designed for tourism
452245184.author: a TripAdvisor user
452245184.reviewBody:
If you've never been in a mine before, you should go. This is one of the most visited mines in Mexico. It's within walking distance from Zacatecas Centro (about 10 min.), just one block past Parque Alameda. The tour is interesting and you get to walk through a few (restored) tunnels of a real mine. Entry fee is 80 pesos ($4). 

 The mine has seven levels, but the tour only takes place on two of them. There are many platforms with railings that were built along the tour path that allow visitors to peer down at the lower levels. If you've been in a mine before, you may not be as impressed, as this mine is quite touristy; it's renovated with dramatic colored lighting, a smooth, wide walking path, and viewing platforms. However, the explanation of the history of the area, importance and development of the mine, and the hardships of the miners was very good. For those wanting a photo op at a unique place, come back in the evening to the underground club. The tour passes by it and points it out. 

I think the tour is ideal for families with kids because it begins with a little train shuttle ride into the mine and then there are many lighted props and figures throughout the tour. Be prepared for a lot of waiting around, though. The tour is roughly 1 hr, but you only spend about 30 minutes actually touring the mine.

They run a tour about every hour or two, so while you're waiting for the next tour group to assemble, there's a snack bar near the ticket booth. When the tour begins, you put on a plastic helmet and board a little shuttle that takes you inside the long first tunnel, descending about 1,500 feet into the mine. Then you disembark and are led to the rock and mineral display, and after a few words about minerals that were mined here, the guide leaves you to peruse the mini museum and use the restrooms before the walking tour begins. There aren't any restrooms inside the tunnels, so 20 minutes is spent here, basically waiting for everyone to have an opportunity to use the restrooms. It was a pretty long wait. 
Then the guide assembled the group and we walked a long, wide tunnel as he explained about the history of the mine and area. Mannequin figures are found at each stopping point to help visitors visualize the mining conditions. Then we walked up a flight of stairs to a higher path for more of the same.
 The tour was entirely in Spanish and although our guide, Cristian, was very friendly and conscious of speaking slower for me, I found it very difficult to understand him because I couldn't hear him over the crying babies, whining toddlers, and the three kids running around playing tag and calling out to each other. (That's what I get for visiting in the mid-afternoon during prime Cranky Kid Time.) So after a while, I just gave up and trailed behind. I think I would've enjoyed the tour more if I had been able to hear more than half of what was said.  You'd probably have better luck with a quieter, smaller group if you visited the mine when it first opens in the morning. 

There are many platforms with railings overlooking open spaces, where you can  look down at the river that flooded and washed out the lower levels of the mine in the 60s, effectively shutting it down.  It's visible despite the darkness because it glows a bright metallic blue, due to the minerals and sediment the water carries with it as it runs through the hill, La Bufa, before flowing into the mine. It almost looks radioactive.

At the end of the tour, the guide presented us with 3 different options:
1. Climb a set of stairs to more paths in the mine and continue the tour with another guide.
2. Turn back and walk to the train for the return ride to the entrance.
3. Walk to a different tunnel to the elevator which leads to the upper exit and the teleferico (which he warned us is no longer running) and street above. 

We chose option 3, and had the tunnel all to ourselves since the rest of the group headed back to the train. With everyone else gone, the mine became deathly quiet and in the darker stretches of the tunnel, we started to identify with Tom Sawyer and Becky Thatcher, wondering if we should've been marking our path...and if it's even possible to get lost in a tourist mine . .?  We giggled as we started second-guessing the directions we were given. Just as I started to wonder if anyone has ever had to spend the night in a chilly mine, we saw footpath lights up ahead, and soon after, the elevators. I think I was actually disappointed. 

There is nothing at this exit now that the tram is no longer running, but we planned to catch a taxi to the Cerro La Bufa. This proved more difficult than we had anticipated as the road outside is a very narrow side street with no passing cars.  We decided to walk up the road in search of a taxi, since Hotel Baruk was about 5 minutes up the road, rather than walk over a mile back down to the lower mine entrance. (Visitors may not re-enter the mine after exiting, so don't exit at the top unless you plan to do as we did). At the hotel, we caught a taxi to La Bufa, which was about a 15 minute ride, and after checking it out, walked back to town using the flights of stairs that eventually lead to the Catedral Zacatecas. 

Having been in several mines before, I still felt Eden was worth seeing, as the presentation of the mine was striking, and the tour informative. Personally, I enjoyed wandering around in the dark, empty tunnel after the tour, but if that's not your cup of tea, just stick with the herd headed back to the train. 

Hope that helps! Enjoy Zacatecas!

450992354.name: Intresting!
450992354.author: a TripAdvisor user
450992354.reviewBody: La mina El Eden is THE "must see" place in Zacatecas: a little scaring train trip take you to the heart of the "Mina". A long walk let you discover a lot of interesting things about miners\' life. You don\'t want to lose this...

450862397.name: Not the type of club people describe
450862397.author: a TripAdvisor user
450862397.reviewBody: It\'s inside a mine, underground one must give some credit for that, but the place it\'s old plus the day we went it was going to be shut down early as it had been booked for a XV party, the place was empty by the time we were there apart from some families with small children playing around, I had been told it was an awesome place, for me it was a disappointment :/

449178846.name: Where minerals come from
449178846.author: a TripAdvisor user
449178846.reviewBody: This was truly a trip through history.  I can only imagine how the mine was operated in the 1500\'s. The mine was also a great example of historic restoration.

447338477.name: Definitely a must visit site
447338477.author: a TripAdvisor user
447338477.reviewBody: Great city attraction, a real mine adapted for tourism. You\'ll get familiar with the way mines used to work during pre and pot revolution era. \nGreat for family tour, don\'t forget to hire a guide that will explains the stories inside the mine and the legends. \n

447172810.name: Interesting, but much to aspire
447172810.author: a TripAdvisor user
447172810.reviewBody: The place itself and the experience is worth it. However, the masses of tourists and the feeling that we missed some interesting aspects of this place did not leave us. Try to get there early and not during local holidays.

447005821.name: Interesting
447005821.author: a TripAdvisor user
447005821.reviewBody: It worth the visit.  Kids were amazed about getting inside an old mine... we were not told there is rock museum inside, it is besides the train left us. It is very nice.

445942096.name: Nice and interesting tour
445942096.author: a TripAdvisor user
445942096.reviewBody: the only not nice thing, was that the guide didn\'t speak English. All other aspects were awesome! Historical and very interesting!

444720284.name: If you\'re in Zacatecas and you don\'t go, you\'re missing out.
444720284.author: a TripAdvisor user
444720284.reviewBody:
Though we both understand Spanish, our guide spoke English, which made for much easier understanding during the hour-long tour. 

I've been to mines in Bolivia but it was nothing like this. This tour was rich in centuries of history, and its early history (slaves, dangerous conditions, sweltering temperatures) is unnerving. That said, we really enjoyed the tour and learned a lot. 

There's an artifact/quartz rock museum that you can peruse after the tour while waiting for a quick train ride in pitch black to exit the mine. There's also night club in the mine - the only one in the world. Well worth the visit if you are in Zacatecas. Just remember if you plan on walking around a lot, it's high altitude there.

444094715.name: A must stop!
444094715.author: a TripAdvisor user
444094715.reviewBody: If you are in Zacatecas, this is one of the attractions to stop and visit.  Lots of history. It\'s a dark train ride into the mine. Within,  there is a rock museum and other interesting artifacts.  Our tour guide was great. The club looks like it\'s a neat place to visit afterhours.

436239477.name: Fun and interesting
436239477.author: a TripAdvisor user
436239477.reviewBody: A nice tour.  Ask when buying your tickets they can provide an english guide.  We did not know till after the tour.  Luckily one member our group spoke spanish so she provided translation for us.  Very informative tour and well laid out.

436162972.name: Mina El Eden
436162972.author: a TripAdvisor user
436162972.reviewBody: We purchsed a tour in front of the cathedral. It was a red bus and affordable. The tour included a trip up to La Bufa which has the church, museum, zip lining, shopping, and great place to take photos of Zacatecas. Then we were taken  to la Mi a El Eden whch was the best part. The mine tour takes approx 1 hr. After the entire tour we were given a free admission to the Museo de Inquisicion which was also very interesting and good. If you are traveling with a senior this tour is not that much walking. Would definitely recommend it.

432143104.name: Nice!
432143104.author: a TripAdvisor user
432143104.reviewBody: It is a very nice attraction of Zacatecas. Make sure to take a sweater because inside is chilly/cold. I was expecting more of it, but the stories behind it and the water views are very nice.

429246156.name: good fun and great experience
429246156.author: a TripAdvisor user
429246156.reviewBody: I must say that this is a must to visit, the ride is fun and very informative. Our tour guide Emmanuel was super funny and made the visit very enjoyable.

428104211.name: A hidden gem (literally)
428104211.author: a TripAdvisor user
428104211.reviewBody: This underground tour of the mine in Zacatecas was incredible. In addition to learning the stark history of the mine, you are exposed to legends and tales of those who worked there. There are incredible minerals to be seen, structure to be in awe of, and if you fancy, a pretty amazing club underground as well!

426476964.name: Best Place I visited in Zacatecas!!
426476964.author: a TripAdvisor user
426476964.reviewBody: This place is a must, seriously. It\'s the best place I visited.  A little crowded the tours, but given the amount of visitors I understand that. Be sure to take a light jacket or sweater.  Don\'t enter if you are claustrophobic.  The tour guides are great!

422268069.name: You can\'t miss La Mina del Eden
422268069.author: a TripAdvisor user
422268069.reviewBody: If you go to Zacatecas you can\'t miss this amazing place, there is also a disco and some days it is a bar where kids can enter.\nIt has to entrances, I recommend that you enter from below it is the one that google maps shows you and then you can leave from the top and go to cerro la bufa from the Cableway

420703562.name: Fun!!
420703562.author: a TripAdvisor user
420703562.reviewBody:
Zacatecas is beautiful city and one of the spots you do not want to miss is La Mina Del Edén.

Going there is a really pleasant experience. 
You get there and buy your ticket (student discount but nevertheless is very cheap (4 bucks)) then you get your mine helmet and ready to go.

You get into a train that takes you to the deep part of the mine and your guide tells you the cool story and legends of the mine (There is a bar inside in case you want to party or relax a little after the tour). 

The mine is very interesting, you can see a blue/greed water in the bottom, you can go to the inside mineral museum and grab a souvenir. 

It's a MUST in your visit to Zacatecas. 

VIVA MEXICO

418822156.name: Wow!!!
418822156.author: a TripAdvisor user
418822156.reviewBody: This is a must see attraction.the mine is breathtaking. We even got to see one of the worlds most exotic nightclubs that is situated inside the mine.  Our guide was so informative and entertaining. Had amazing time.

413555005.name: Great host
413555005.author: a TripAdvisor user
413555005.reviewBody: Great host, nice to know the history behind the mines. It\'s a tour of the mine while wearing hard hats

404110965.name: Tourist Attraction
404110965.author: a TripAdvisor user
404110965.reviewBody: This seems to be a major tourist attraction in Zacatecas these days. We enjoyed it but tired of it since our Spanish is not good enough to get the jokes. Don\'t go if you are claustrophobic or think you might get anxious spending an extended period underground. We especially enjoyed the folk paintings depicting miracles related to the mine and the mineral collection. They will let you exit with another group if you want to. The disco club opens at 10 pm and your tickets entitle you to re-entry.

402766767.name: Historic silver mine
402766767.author: a TripAdvisor user
402766767.reviewBody: The town of Zacatecas was built around silver mining and a tour of this mine and museum in the center of town is a must for those interested in the history of this beautiful city.  The underground tour begins with a short train ride and continues through the old shafts and tunnels.  The mine is well-lighted and the walk through the mine is fairly flat and perfectly comfortable.  Do it!

402595394.name: Best Tour in Town
402595394.author: a TripAdvisor user
402595394.reviewBody:
I have been in different mine tours and I have to say this one is very good. You get to walk along a level of the mine and see different areas, minerals, and also the water at the bottom of the place.
The guide was helpful and the place big enough to enjoy a good tour. There is also a disco inside the mine and a train that takes you up and down.
This tour is a must in Zacatecas.

402281117.name: Don\'t miss this opportunity!
402281117.author: a TripAdvisor user
402281117.reviewBody: This is an exhausted mine that has been converted into a terrific tourism attraction, with lots of learning opportunities regarding minerals and mining methods. It\'s also kind of a museum with exhibits of various phases of pre-Hispanic mining, Spanish era mining, and modern mining methods. Excellent tour choice for kids and adults. Be aware that you will enter the mine in rail cars but then do a bit of walking and climbing stairs.

399147557.name: Fun exploration
399147557.author: a TripAdvisor user
399147557.reviewBody: It rains a lot in Zacatecas and this is the perfect way to end a couple for hours out of the rain. Interesting and our guide was entertaining so it was great fun.

397122066.name: Informative Tour
397122066.author: a TripAdvisor user
397122066.reviewBody: They take you inside the mine and they tell you history of how they initiated years ago, plus they have a little museum of rocks as a tour

390558022.name: Great place
390558022.author: a TripAdvisor user
390558022.reviewBody: Very interesting place to go. You can feel what is to be in a mine without any danger so it\u00b4s a place to all the family.

390140256.name: More Interesting and a bit more fun than I Had Imagined - Worth the Trip
390140256.author: a TripAdvisor user
390140256.reviewBody:
With so many museums and great restaurants in Zacatecas (plus a festival going on), I wasn't really planning on taking this mine tour. But as it wasn't too far a walk to the entrance of the mine from Gorditas Doña Julia, where I had had a quick lunch, and because it was an easy way to get the Teleferico entrance, I figured I'd give it a go. 

It was not crowded the day I went - just two guys from Sonora and me, which was fine. You enter the mine from this entrance in a small and very short train. Because you have to wear a hard heart (provided) and because I am tall (6'3) this short trip proved a tiny bit tough as my head kept hitting the top of the train. Hey, but I was wearing a hard hat, so no problem, right? Anyway, the train stops in the middle of the mine, where there is sort of a museum of minerals and fossils. The guide (and more on that in a second) walks along and tells stories and provides info while also giving you time to look around and see what is on display at your pace. They also give you a glimpse down another shaft at the disco that is there (open at night). Then you are walked to other parts of the mine where you see and hear more on the conditions of the workers in their day as well as some local mine legends. Eventually you get to the end and have the option of going back from when you came or heading to the other exit, where you can catch the Teleferico. All in all pretty handy. By the way, there are gift shops, snacks and clean restrooms available at both ends.

Now onto the guide. My guide was a youngish woman (18~22?) named Jackie (not sure of the spelling). When I first arrived at the mine, I bought my ticket and walked up to the entrance gate. Jackie zoomed and explained that the postcard that I had received as a receipt was also my ticket, and then explained when the tour would leave, etc. She then switched to perfect English (apparently having had lived in Texas) and asked me where I was from and told me she could explain as much to me on the tour as I liked (a nice touch since I was trying to learn Spanish and thus wanted to try to follow along when I could). She offered to take pics of me with my camera at popular along the way because I was there alone, provided me with good explanations when I wasn't able to follow along, and basically took very good care of me on the tour, as well as of the other customers. So basically here is a shout out to a really good and helpful guide who started off my trip in Zacatecas right. 

Anyway, to sum up, the tour is actually pretty nice (good escape from the heat as well), and a great way to get to the Teleferico station. If you are traveling with kids, they are definitely sure to like the trip!

386137154.name: Underground Party
386137154.author: a TripAdvisor user
386137154.reviewBody: This was my first party in an underground mine. The train ride was \'!\'. I was very impress by the 3D laser light show. Everyone was dancing and jumping to the world dance music while i was busy Shazaming all the latin songs i love. (Btw: the have wifi even though you are 120 meters underground :)

385403134.name: Not to be missed
385403134.author: a TripAdvisor user
385403134.reviewBody: I\'m not one for tours but I went there with Recepturz as part of the afternoon tour Zacatecas Traditional. First a visit to La Bufa a high hill overlooking the city. From there to the top entry of the Eden mine by cable car. All for less than $20 and then a tour around the old part of the city. The mine is a real opportunity to get some idea of how thing were in Colonial times. Boys started working at age 8 and most were dead by 30

385030602.name: Memorable History
385030602.author: a TripAdvisor user
385030602.reviewBody: Be prepared for an incredible part of Spanish - Mexican history. It is one thing to read about Mexican mines, but quite another to travel through a mine that operated for over 500 years. I would recommend this to anyone who is not afraid of being underground. I have taken other mine and cave tours where the guide turns off the lights, thankfully this did not happen although at times there was low visibility. The guides give excellent tours, mine was in Spanish and I forgot to ask if there is an English or French guide. Even if you do not understand Spanish there is certainly enough to make this tour well worth your time. The tour includes a great mineral and fossil museum.

380858083.name: Carrillo
380858083.author: a TripAdvisor user
380858083.reviewBody: We enjoyed this very much.  You can get a tour in English but you may have to wait. Go to the Bufa and take the tereferico yo the mine. Best way to get there.

374848978.name: Impressive
374848978.author: a TripAdvisor user
374848978.reviewBody: Specifically went to Zacatecas for the opportunity to tour this specific mine.  It didn\'t disappoint at all.  Didn\'t know what to expect and was impressed with the whole tour.  The tour guide was wonderful!

366849957.name: Pretty cool tour
366849957.author: a TripAdvisor user
366849957.reviewBody: Bring a coat, the tour takes a few hours and is cool inside. \nIt has been Disney\'fide so it will be entertaining to normal people.

366161903.name: A great tour in a real mine.
366161903.author: a TripAdvisor user
366161903.reviewBody: What a wonderful experience we had today touring the El Eden mine. After donning a miner\'s hat (necessary due to the low, rocky ceiling) we took a small train into the mine and then were lead by our guide to the various points of interest. We started out in a small museum of different types of minerals and were so impressed by the quality of the rocks and how beautifully they were displayed. We next walked through the tunnels and were given interesting information about what it was like to work in the mine. It was all in Spanish so I didn\'t get it all, but I understood most of what we were told and our guide answered all of our questions. I wore a light jacket and was very comfortable. The floor was a little wet in places so shoes with traction is a good choice.\n I highly recommend this tour in Zacatecas.

364464653.name: Great Attraction
364464653.author: a TripAdvisor user
364464653.reviewBody:
This is an old Mine in Zacatecas, now considered an attraction for visitors.
This is a must go place in Zacatecas.
You might be lucky an try to find the gold stone that has been lost for a lot of years.
Just Enjoy.

362427267.name: The essence of colonial Mexico
362427267.author: a TripAdvisor user
362427267.reviewBody: The guide that took us through was amazing!  The details of the mine history were well told.  The mine encompassed the horror behind the Spanish greed that fueled the colonial era.

361555469.name: Great job adapting an old mine into a tourist attraction
361555469.author: a TripAdvisor user
361555469.reviewBody: We visited Mina El Eden on April 2nd, 2016.  We went into the mine right after riding the teleferico down from Cerro La Bufa.  The mine is very well adapted as a tourist attraction. We saw people of all ages visiting and having a good time.  The museum at the bottom is very well done, with samples of minerals not just from Zacatecas, but also from other parts of the world.  I would recommend visiting Mina El Eden, even if you only have a couple of days in Zacatecas.  Berore or after visiting the mine, nearby Restaurant Santo Cabrito (at Hotel Baruk) is a good choice for meals, specially for breakfast.

360629536.name: Fascinating history
360629536.author: a TripAdvisor user
360629536.reviewBody: The Eden Mine is a must do in Zacatecas. We visited a mine in Guanajuato few years ago that felt dangerous. The Eden is much better, clean and safe feeling. The history of the mine is well explained by the guides, but the jokes get old rather quickly. The construction to turn this mine into a modern tourist attraction is mind boggling, especially the elevator and train.

357301886.name: I did not enjoy it :-(
357301886.author: a TripAdvisor user
357301886.reviewBody: Not as good as I thought it would be.  I paid for the entrance to Mina El Eden mine and within a few minutes my instincts told me I would not enjoy this tour and I was absolutely right.  I didnt like the tour guide at all.  So maybe thats why I did not enjoy myself on the El Eden Mine tour.

353211740.name: Fascinating glimpse of the past.
353211740.author: a TripAdvisor user
353211740.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this tour of the silver and gold mines. Our group of four really enjoyed it and came away with a good understanding of the harsh realities of silver mining.  Our excellent guide Manuel spoke English and Spanish fluently and brought the history alive.

350406133.name: The best place in Zacatecas
350406133.author: a TripAdvisor user
350406133.reviewBody: My favorite place where I would like to be is in Zacatecas. It is an amazing old hot place where I can be quite and happy. I really feel comfortable and peaceful there. Its food like gorditas are amazing because it has a particular taste that in other places they don\u2019t have. One wonderful place in Zacatecas is \u201cEl Eden\u201d mine, It\u2019s a big cold gloomy place with some poky caverns. The place is great and I don\u2019t know if there is a similar place in any other country all over the world, Inside this mine there is a Dance Club and it is amazing when the night arrives then the lights are on and finally the music starts to sound. The floor is colorful with many lights. When you arrive at El Eden you need to put a helmet on your head to enter in this place, then, there is a little poky train to takes you inside the mine. \nIn addition to this, the streets of the downtown are bustling with many people buying craftworks and typical clothes.\nSo, You need to visiting Zacatecas.

346426911.name: Mina el.eden
346426911.author: a TripAdvisor user
346426911.reviewBody: Nice place to visit with family.or.friends is a minning place with some nice stores inside nice rocks and history insude of the place

345957253.name: Interesting
345957253.author: a TripAdvisor user
345957253.reviewBody:
It was a very good experience visiting this mine.  Our guide was Eduardo and we had a fine time with him.  He made jokes and our visit was very pleasant.  
I was glad to see that we can have first rate attractions in Mexico.  We are always comparing with the US and in this case I can proudly say that the visit is excellent.  You get to learn how the mine was founded and how the people working there evolve up to the closure of the mine.
There is also a night club there that is a wonderful experience.
I consider that the price is not high for what is offered.  There is also a museum with different kind of stones and minerals and there are also some fossils.
There are two entrances to the mine depending on what you will be doing after. I recommend visiting the mine first and then going on to the cable car.
It is worth visiting!!!

345480272.name: Find out when the english tours are
345480272.author: a TripAdvisor user
345480272.reviewBody: This is a fascinating experience.We went on a very interesting tour conducted in Spanish and we don\'t speak Spanish. We did not know that they conducted English tours nor were we offered the option of going on an English tour. We found out they offer English tours half way through our tour when we heard another guide talking in English. If we had known we would have gone on the English tour instead. \nTry to find out when the tours start before you go there. We waited nearly an hour for our tour to start because we didn\'t check start times.

338443783.name: A must see!!!
338443783.author: a TripAdvisor user
338443783.reviewBody: Our boys really enjoyed this!! Group of 8 and all ages.. Our tour guide was very informative, and funny. He made this tour enjoyable for us. I don\'t remember his name, but middle aged with glasses. It was great to see the minerals, the ways things were done, and the fountain at the end!!! The price was reasonable,even for big groups. We will be back again!!

337644469.name: Fun and interesting
337644469.author: a TripAdvisor user
337644469.reviewBody: It\'s worth coming alone, as a family, as a couple. It\'s interesting, it has a guided tour with funny people. It has also a museum of minerals with rocks and gems from different parts of the world (quite big actually). And it also has a train that takes you out in the end.

336124595.name: A tour of an ex-mine
336124595.author: a TripAdvisor user
336124595.reviewBody: Definitely worth a visit if you visit Zacatecas which is well known for its silver mine. Mina El Eden was a real mine and now converted into a tourist attraction. You ride a motor train into the heart of the mine and the tour is less than 1 hour. There is a bar open for visitors in the evening and also worth a visit. A real underground bar!!!  Check their schedules as the bar sometime is closed.

335519121.name: Intro to History & Mine
335519121.author: a TripAdvisor user
335519121.reviewBody: Good walk through of mine shafts with excellent narrator. Much to see and learn including Spanish influence.

335299107.name: No Hablo Ingles
335299107.author: a TripAdvisor user
335299107.reviewBody: We went because it seemed like a cool thing to see. It was. I\'d never been down a mine. That said, it was very busy and the tour was only in Spanish. We speak some but could not keep up. So we hustled along looking at everything the guide pointed to and then rapidly made our way out when it was over.

334159946.name: Not as authentic as I thought
334159946.author: a TripAdvisor user
334159946.reviewBody: I was very grateful to have a guide who translated much of what he said to English, as the tour is all in Spanish - I initially thought it would be done via headsets and I could just opt for English! I\'m very grateful to him for that as otherwise it would have been pointless. I expected the tour to be fairly authentic, as we were going down a mine that was used for many years, however it is very much a tourist destination, with fake human figures and gimmicks you would expect to see in a Disney theme park. It wasn\'t bad, just not what o was expecting.

333943682.name: Very interesting and professionally done!
333943682.author: a TripAdvisor user
333943682.reviewBody: A very enjoyable tour is offered.  Quite extensive with much of interest. One takes a train into the mine and from there, walking quite a distance.  At the end, an elevator takes one to the surface.

333880348.name: Total FUN..
333880348.author: a TripAdvisor user
333880348.reviewBody: A hard hat and a fast three minute ride into the mountain side. From there one of the most beautiful stone collections I have seen. Then a great tour of the working mine. Very interesting and beautiful, as well as historic.

332558738.name: Interesting Visit To A Mine
332558738.author: a TripAdvisor user
332558738.reviewBody: You get an introduction on what the mines are like, and considering this is what makes Zacatecas rich, I guess it is worth understanding it. From the exhibits of types of minerals, to the way mining was done through the ages, it is quite educational.

328020289.name: Avoid if no English guide
328020289.author: a TripAdvisor user
328020289.reviewBody: A waste of money as our loquacious guide didn\'t speak any english even though the ticket seller said it would be in that language.He wasted a lot of time by continually pointing out silver veins. If you go here, visit after cable car ride to avoid a lot of uphill walking.

327002781.name: You will learn some fascinating history
327002781.author: a TripAdvisor user
327002781.reviewBody: Zacatecas\'s fortunes rose (and are still rising) in large part due to mining. This tour and museum will give an insight into the hardships the poor native peoples were subjected into in order to get precious metals to Spain 400 years ago. Horrible conditions, slavery etc. Hugely interesting is the beautiful rock, mineral & fossil museum with gorgeous, massive specimens. We had our tour guide, J\u00e9sus, all to ourselves (it was not a busy day) & he was brilliant, really brought the place to life, excellent, funny idiomatic English too !

324000012.name: Something Different
324000012.author: a TripAdvisor user
324000012.reviewBody: A new concept of the use of a closed real silver mine. If the tour of the mine and was was to be a miner in times past doesn\'t impress you, the working discotech with real bar, music, etc. will amaze you.

319605695.name: Very good experience
319605695.author: a TripAdvisor user
319605695.reviewBody: You experience entering a real mine.there is also a night bar with music inside the mine also a very good experience full of young people.

319414037.name: Excellent!
319414037.author: a TripAdvisor user
319414037.reviewBody: This tourist attraction is very well done. Very interesting and the guides explain everything. It really is fascinating. You know you are in the depths of a mine as it is really nice and cool.

318684331.name: Great experience
318684331.author: a TripAdvisor user
318684331.reviewBody: This is one of the best mine trips, a must in zacatecas, here you have the option at the end of the guided tour to take an elevator to the cable railway (you need to pay for it $50 pesos p/p) in order to get to "cerro de la bufa" or you can go back to the entrance of the mine, not many people know this so it might help to plan your trip.

318287279.name: Don\'t miss it!
318287279.author: a TripAdvisor user
318287279.reviewBody: Very beautiful and interesting place, please don\'t miss the opportunity to visit this magic place, you can take pictures and get to know its history and some legends

316921402.name: Might be a good experience.
316921402.author: a TripAdvisor user
316921402.reviewBody: Avoid if you\'re claustrophobic. Avoid if you hate tourist guides trying to be funny. Avoid if you dont want to walk one mile with no place to go back or breath fresh air.

314454867.name: Great and amazing information and history
314454867.author: a TripAdvisor user
314454867.reviewBody: This is a must, even if you dont like mines, its amazing old history, as well as really well organised and managed. I am in the Mining industry so I thought it would be a bit of a busman\'s holiday but instead I found it very informative and interesting.

312158372.name: Fun for the family
312158372.author: a TripAdvisor user
312158372.reviewBody: My oldest child is a little claustrophobic, but our guide was excellent.  The mine is a nice place to visit and learn about the history of Zacatecas.

310794670.name: a must if you come to zacatecas
310794670.author: a TripAdvisor user
310794670.reviewBody:
Definitely a place to visit. The tour is nice and whole environment just makes this a must. There is even a bar 300 meters under the mountain! At the end the train makes the tour just great. 

If you come to zacatecas this is a must visit!

308643282.name: INTERESTING AND HISTORIC
308643282.author: a TripAdvisor user
308643282.reviewBody: Not suitable for claustrophobic people.   Silver mine that operated for 400 years, 25 years ago.  First, they take you by train 700 meters inside of the mountain.   Then you walk a trail for 25 minutes to see all the tunnels of the mine and you get to understand how the mine worked in the 16 and 17 centuries and then how it evolved in the 19-20 centuries and turned into a more machine-operated mine.  I recommend this visit, is very interesting.  US$5 Entrance fee.

306132604.name: Amazing Unique Opportunity
306132604.author: a TripAdvisor user
306132604.reviewBody: What a rare opportunity!  Delve into an old mine that was used for over 400 years, now turned into a tourist attraction.  You learn the history of the mines (if you understand Spanish) and get to walk through one of the old mine paths.  Along the way you see deep abysses below and beside you, and gold and silver veins running through the rock above your head.  Also, walk through a gem and mineral museum in the mine as well.  And don\'t forget to go to the disco on the weekend!

305324313.name: A must visit experience
305324313.author: a TripAdvisor user
305324313.reviewBody: You would be doing Zacatecas an injustice if you didn\'t visit this mine as the towns whole existence came about due to the silver that was brought out from it. Overall its a pretty good experience and well operated. The tours are only really in Spanish with a couple of English words thrown in but that\'s fine. Its not cold in the mine so no need to pack a coat or jumper as people have suggested (however I did visit in July)

298126244.name: Something you can\'t miss seeing on your visit to Zacatecas...
298126244.author: a TripAdvisor user
298126244.reviewBody: Take the time to go to see this mine,,,you are going to know and understand part of Zacatecas history and the terrible exploitation that the Aborigines had..There is ahuge Mine wiht a lot of levels,,You can enter from the top close to the hotel Baruk Telesferico and Mina and going down on the elevator or from the bottom of the mine with a train..

295449652.name: Great tour!
295449652.author: a TripAdvisor user
295449652.reviewBody: We had tons of fun! The tour was very well prepared at a very cheap price.. and right next to the mine you can find the BEST rock/crystal store with reasonable prices as well.

292908860.name: Worth every cent
292908860.author: a TripAdvisor user
292908860.reviewBody:
I really enjoyed this tour and the guide really made his best effort to translate the information to English for me since I was the only one not speaking Spanish.

The tour starts with entering a train that takes you further inside the mine. From there you have a museum for different stones and mine equipment.

After that you visit the bar/nightclub that's located inside the mine. It was closed when we where there at the middle of the day.

The last part is more or less walking around in the cave and get information about how the mining used to be when the mine was working. There is a lot of statues illustrating how the process used to be while the guide also add some additional information.

Very interesting and extra credit for the guide who translated the information to English for me even if they said that the information will only be in Spanish when I bought the ticket.

291838507.name: Deep into Zacatecas\' Mining Past
291838507.author: a TripAdvisor user
291838507.reviewBody:
An old Spanish mine turned into a tourist attraction is an obligated visit to El Eden mine.

Take the guided tour and enjoy the history behind this place. Most of the stories are sad due to a period of exploitation of the indigenous people. This makes you appreciate the hard work of thousands that sacrifice their lives for their families.

There is a bar/night club inside for an admission. Did not go, but heard is worth checking out for the experience.

289005509.name: Interesting place
289005509.author: a TripAdvisor user
289005509.reviewBody: It is a nice and interesting place. Perfect for those who are focused in history, specially in how silver and gold played a pivotal role in Zacatecas development.

288970672.name: Very cool museum and bar
288970672.author: a TripAdvisor user
288970672.reviewBody: During the day you can get a guided tour of this old silver mine, see exhibits, visit the gift shop, etc. At night, you ride a little train about a kilometer into the mountain and go to the club. Great drinks, dancing, and the cell phone reception was better than I have at home!

286908529.name: Beautiful and fun
286908529.author: a TripAdvisor user
286908529.reviewBody: Beautiful and informative tour. We took the whole family here. There is so much history and beautiful minerals in glass displays to read up on. There is replicas of mine workers as well. You will have to wear a hard hat and bring a jacket! It gets pretty cold. This place is a night club a night but is not always open to the public. we were lucky enough to be there on a day where they were opening the night club that night so we went back and had a blast. It is so unique and the services was excellent. We got a Nice VIP table near the dance floor.

281697397.name: Wow!. to center of earth.
281697397.author: a TripAdvisor user
281697397.reviewBody: to see the inside of a mine made with only  indians slaves is something that makes you wonder. And see a  actually  vains of silver and gold.\n

275050786.name: Not for the claustrophobic!
275050786.author: a TripAdvisor user
275050786.reviewBody: I went as part of a group tour & would have preferred to chill in a cafe on a sunny plaza. The mine is interesting but we spent 2 hours inside going very far below ground. Though there was lots of air, my heart was pounding with fear of being underground & claustrophobic. Would not do again.

270485528.name: Nice experience
270485528.author: a TripAdvisor user
270485528.reviewBody: This attraction is a good experience to understand better the mines and exploration. Also is very detailed regarding how it was explored.\n\nThe site is prepared for the visits and well organized. You can tak small kids (there are elevators, etc...)

270009804.name: Great shopping and a closer view of the mine culture
270009804.author: a TripAdvisor user
270009804.reviewBody: Believe it or not prices are cheaper than at downtown stores.  We spent hours shopping in the downtown area and was able to compare pricing, we ran out of time to go back to this place to shop for items previously priced out

269590887.name: Great tour
269590887.author: a TripAdvisor user
269590887.reviewBody: Impressive tour given by a knowledgeable guide.  Amazing collection of rocks and gems at the museum inside the mine.

267650394.name: Mine El Ed\u00e9n, a unique learning experience!
267650394.author: a TripAdvisor user
267650394.reviewBody:
Just few minutes away from downtown Zacatecas this mine offers an underground guided tour to explore and learn about mining history.

The mine's facilities are adapted in such a way that is easy to walk and enjoy the tour, even for kids and those with physical challenges.

For those interested in dancing, there is a nigh club inside the mine, but opens mostly on weekends.

265893154.name: Definitely Worth the Visit
265893154.author: a TripAdvisor user
265893154.reviewBody:
If you are in Zacatecas, Mina el Eden shouldn't be missed.  You take a train down into the mine shafts where you embark upon an hour plus underground tour learning the history of the mines,the regions, and exploring the small underground museum which has a great selection of rocks and fossils both rom Zacatecas and around the world.  The tour covers a lot of ground, and you really get a feeling for what it must have been like to mine back in the day.

Emmanuel was an excellent, funny, energetic and knowledgeable guide with 5 years of experience.  He didn't speak English, but if you need an English speaking guide this is possible if you arrange it ahead of time.

Also, the exit (if you don't want to come back up the way you came) lets you out about a block away from the Teleferico, so it's easy to combine both of these sights.

Bring a second layer because it's cool down there, and if you are going to Guanajuato before Zacatecas don't waste your time or money on the tours/mines there, because Mina el Eden is a way better experience.

264261320.name: Highlight
264261320.author: a TripAdvisor user
264261320.reviewBody: It is nice to visit this mine, because it also explains how the mining started, and how the Indians were working there in the beginning of the colonization period. beautiful sights, well illuminated. and an interesting mineral museum

262708138.name: Interesting place to tour.
262708138.author: a TripAdvisor user
262708138.reviewBody: Interesting place to tour. The train inside the mine is nice and the tour is pretty informative. Overall an interesting look into Zacatecas\' economic history as a colonial city.

261566639.name: Worth a visit
261566639.author: a TripAdvisor user
261566639.reviewBody: Train ride deep into the mine followed by about fifteen minutes in the gem and mineral museum and gift shop the a stroll thru the depths viewing displays portraying life/work in the mines.  Spanish would be very helpful, though intermediate speakers we couldn\'t keep up with the guide\'s rapid fire descriptions and jokes.  Nevertheless less, it was an enjoyable experience.  The disco was closed the day we visited.  Use the entrance near the ISSM hospital.and conclude your visit with a tram ride over to \nLa Bufa.   The museum there closes at five so time your visit accordingly.

260972370.name: Very interesting
260972370.author: a TripAdvisor user
260972370.reviewBody: Use walking shoes and take a sweater.   Very impressive.  They also have a disco that open in the evenings.

259828283.name: Must see in Zacatecas
259828283.author: a TripAdvisor user
259828283.reviewBody: Gives a terrific sense of what mining is and was about during 400 years of mining this mountain. A world class mineral collection as well.

257048662.name: Very interesting tour - a little bit short
257048662.author: a TripAdvisor user
257048662.reviewBody:
In general, it's a nice anD interesting tour into the former mining system of Zacatecas.
We recommend to enter via the main entrance and not via the entrance of the cable car. 
The entrance via the cable car is not very organized and more crowded.  
The main entrance is more organized and the tour starts with a train ride.
After you entered the mines via the small train, you will have time to see the mineralogy museum which is the main attraction there. The time is too short to observe all the precious minerals from all over the world. 
Our son didn't even saw the half before the tour guide asked to follow him to the next attraction spots.
When you finish the tour, you have the choice to go back to the main entrance or to connect to the cable car which brings you to the "Bufa".

254871563.name: A must in Zacatecas...
254871563.author: a TripAdvisor user
254871563.reviewBody: This is one Iconic place in Zacatecas, is a must for a first time in the city but I wouldn\'t go back again. Maybe it\'s not that interesting for me...

253382339.name: A must if you come over
253382339.author: a TripAdvisor user
253382339.reviewBody: This is a magical experience inside a mine, if you are looking for an out of this world experience please visit this mine, it is cheap and worth for your money, if you are more adventurous you can even go on a saturday night bar inside the mine!! something unique. I recommend this experience 100%

253092636.name: Really Interesting
253092636.author: a TripAdvisor user
253092636.reviewBody: This is a very professional museum full of fun with great insight into the terrible conditions of colonial mining. Everything about this museum is very professional and well maintained. We entered by the teliferico entrance (recommended) where you begin with a walk through the mine with life-size models of how the silver was extracted from the mine through the centuries. At the end, you exit on an ore train. Great fun and extremely interesting. Everything is wheelchair accessible and suitable for children. Entrance is only 80 pesos.\n

249585221.name: a must do when in Zacatecas
249585221.author: a TripAdvisor user
249585221.reviewBody:
you really can't avoid coming here when in Zacatecas... it's a great attraction you get to walk inside a mine and it's within the city, so you really can't miss this one... 

I really enjoyed it and learned many things about how mining was done in the past when Zacatecas just was founded. 

really recommended.

248333203.name: Astonishing History
248333203.author: a TripAdvisor user
248333203.reviewBody: It was a great history lecture and visual experience, the guide was very knowledgeable and answered all of the questions the group had.

247858180.name: cool tour of a silver mine
247858180.author: a TripAdvisor user
247858180.reviewBody: well organized and narrated tour (seems like Spanish only though) Informative and entertaining. You will be walking a bit underground in a hardhat so mind your seniors and infants!

245688185.name: Highlight of my trip to Zacatecas!
245688185.author: a TripAdvisor user
245688185.reviewBody:
A trip to the Mina El Eden is a must if you are in Zacatecas!! There are two entrances. I started from the one with the train (entrance to the bar and nightclub) and exited by the other one near the cablecar so I could then visit La Bufa.

I was fortunate to have an outstanding guide whose English was excellent. As I was there at around 10 in the morning, we had a small group of only 4 people!

Highly interesting and informative -- a definite must see!

243398962.name: A must visit!
243398962.author: a TripAdvisor user
243398962.reviewBody: This museum is well worth a visit. It is organised in such a way that even without the informative guide you would get a feeling for the history of the place.

242090497.name: Blown away
242090497.author: a TripAdvisor user
242090497.reviewBody: This is the attraction not to miss in Zacatecas.  We had a very knowledgeable tour guide. Maybe he made the difference but the place itself is amazing. I would even repeat.

240880055.name: A look "down" into the past
240880055.author: a TripAdvisor user
240880055.reviewBody: Yes, it\'s a mine which means you travel below the surface to learn a little bit about the history of the area, the people and the mine.  Most tours are in Spanish with a guide and everyone gets a cool hard hat to wear.  The deepest levels of the mine are now flooded so you can look into them, but you only really can go into a couple of them.  There are lots of props for how things might have looked, but you don\'t exactly "feel" the old mine.  Make sure to take the little tram in or out (depending on the side of town you enter from).

237895112.name: mina el eden
237895112.author: a TripAdvisor user
237895112.reviewBody: my husband went to visit this mine with the guys.  he said it was very interesting.  he highly recommends this visit.

237674349.name: Good experience
237674349.author: a TripAdvisor user
237674349.reviewBody: The mine was a good experience, our guide was really fun and we got to see a lot of the mine. Affordable and interesting, but not mind-blowing

234944671.name: Great insight into a Mexican mine
234944671.author: a TripAdvisor user
234944671.reviewBody: Fabulous museum with minerals, fossils and gorgeous rocks from around the world. Lots of corridors, and illuminated alcoves where models of miners and native slaves bring the hardships of mining to the visitor. Extraordinary flooded levels with blue and green water. Huge glittering loads in which silver and gold were extracted. Very good commentary that had a bit too many jokes towards the end but nevertheless most interesting. Take a jacket or pullover.

232325271.name: Whitewash
232325271.author: a TripAdvisor user
232325271.reviewBody: I enjoyed visiting, but it Izmir a bit of a whitewash. Truth be said, the indigenous people were horribly treated by the Spaniards. This site failed to directly confront this truth.

232300612.name: AMAZING
232300612.author: a TripAdvisor user
232300612.reviewBody: not expensive at all. The tour is about 1.5 to two hours long. Lots of walking up and down the stairs. Very very very interesting... Everyone has to wear hard hats. you enter the mine in a little train. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable. The history, the artifacts are very impressive. I definitely want to return with more family members and share this great experience.

229524206.name: KIds loved it
229524206.author: a TripAdvisor user
229524206.reviewBody: Full of history. Mine is one of the oldest in Mexico and was operational until the the late 1960\'s. The highlight of our trip to Zacatecas for our kids.

222286030.name: Unusual and worth it!
222286030.author: a TripAdvisor user
222286030.reviewBody: Didn\'t expect much but this surprised on the upside. Try and get a tour guide to point out quartz and other features you will otherwise miss. Great displays, quite an extensive walk and a return motorised train included for 80 pesos adult admission ...shame no English!

217097165.name: Interesting
217097165.author: a TripAdvisor user
217097165.reviewBody: You take a tour underground  and the guide explains but I found it lacking in information. Too many forced jokes.

212689818.name: Not a geologist,no problem.
212689818.author: a TripAdvisor user
212689818.reviewBody: It was the second time I went to mine,this time I took my family and I told them "you guys have to go and see the mine,infact my treat."They were sorprice how nice and informative it was.The only down,maybe,was the guide,he was a wanabe comidian and he did it a bit too much.From 1 to 10 an 8.

211746696.name: Nothing special
211746696.author: a TripAdvisor user
211746696.reviewBody: If you have to do one activity I recommend to the club instead of the mine tour. I have to realize they are doing their best to make it interesting. However the site do not give the slightest idea of what it used to be. If you want a real mine experience go to Potosi, Bolivia.\nThe club however was a very unique experience, good sound, and lightning.

207522426.name: Zacatecas: World Cultural Heritage
207522426.author: a TripAdvisor user
207522426.reviewBody: The city of Zacatecas, in central Mexico, is a colonial city whose downtown still retains the architecture of the XVII and XVIII century.\n\nThere are at least a dozen museums from abstract art to native craftsmanship. Do not miss a visit to the Eden Mine arriving by train and tour the tunnels to see how to work the mines in the colonial era.

203482056.name: A wealth of information and history
203482056.author: a TripAdvisor user
203482056.reviewBody: You can\'t say you visited Zacatecas without visiting the Eden Mine. It is a beautifully lighted attraction, where you can see the innards of the mountain while listening to legends of the city. The train is a lot of fun, and the ride is very safe. The guide was very friendly, and strived to get his message through: Even if the mine is now a beautiful attraction, it was forged out of the suffering of indians and slaves, and embodies the sack of Zacateca\'s wealth by the spaniards.

203062951.name: Must go- especially to Bar !
203062951.author: a TripAdvisor user
203062951.reviewBody:
The day trip is great, but you can't miss the Bar !
Varied music, reasonable prices, and people of all ages ! (crowd 20's - 50's Saturday night when I was there )
And all underground !
Another plus , even though there is no phone service there was free wifi    so you can communicate if you feel you need to. 
So, do go have a drink and chill out !

201533014.name: a must see in Zacatecas
201533014.author: a TripAdvisor user
201533014.reviewBody: the scenery in splendid , the tour is very informative ...and the gift shop contains a lot of beautiful souvenirs to buy...

196674185.name: Very good tour
196674185.author: a TripAdvisor user
196674185.reviewBody: The staff arranged for an English speaking guide without me even asking. The tour was very interesting, I\'ve been on a few and this was the best. The life of the Indian slaves working the mine is unimaginable. The lower levels filled with water, Indian slave children had the task of bringing water up from the bottom to the surface on their backs. Fires were kindled under exposed veins to heat the rock, then cold water thrown on the heated rocks to make them break - what a hellish existence; if the heat from geothermal wasn\'t bad enough, the mine was filled with smoke from the fires.

194959513.name: A must for visitors
194959513.author: a TripAdvisor user
194959513.reviewBody: Very interesting. Our guide who was English speaking took us on a  tour of the mine.  He was very knowledgeable and explained the history of the mine very well.  Once inside the mine, you are over 200 meters (over 600 feet) underground, the displays inside are very interesting.  The tour actually takes you underneath the city of Zacatecas and you surface on the opposite side of the city.

194247810.name: Another must do in Zacatecas
194247810.author: a TripAdvisor user
194247810.reviewBody: Outstanding access and insight into the challenges of mining that launched Zacatecas to what it is today.  Cant i magine being one bit disappointed after going through this tour.  Wow.\n

193034528.name: 350 yards into the heart of La Bufa Hill
193034528.author: a TripAdvisor user
193034528.reviewBody: You go down 350 yards into the heart of La Bufa Hill on a train! The tour is about a mile long and features galleries, hanging bridges and tunnels, you can only imagine the conditions the miners had to suffer many years ago.  It features a total of 7 floors but the tour takes place on the 4th floor, from where you can see how flooded the lower levels of the mine still are. There is a Disco on one of the floors, if I were younger I would want to check out. At the end of the tour you will have the option of coming back to the mine entrance or getting dropped off 100 yards from the funicular railway.

191714043.name: Interesting Educational Experience
191714043.author: a TripAdvisor user
191714043.reviewBody: Learned a great deal about how the mining industry in Zacatecas began and evolved through the years.

190879747.name: A \'disneyland\' mina!
190879747.author: a TripAdvisor user
190879747.reviewBody: I really like the guide explain, very sympathy. The mina is huge, very interesting and value the expensive entrance. Its a \'disneyland\' mina (in bad and good view), cause they have a good system of illuminations, sounds, even a night club and museum inside the rocks!

182503115.name: Excellent MineTour
182503115.author: a TripAdvisor user
182503115.reviewBody: The Mina El Eden tour was worth it .  Easiest way to get to the top entrance is by taxi ($50 Pesos from Centro). The lower entrance can be reached on foot by following Hidalgo, to Juarez, turn right and walk past the long narrow park to the hospital and then turn right again for about 2 blocks.  Entry price is $80 Pesos.  Tour takes about 1 hour.  The tour is in Spanish.  For us we were fortunate the guide spoke English and provided translation.  If you start your tour at the lower entrance you will finish at the top and from there it is a short walk to the cable car across the city to the Cerra de la Bufa.

180994412.name: Deep and Dark
180994412.author: a TripAdvisor user
180994412.reviewBody: I liked the jewelry/ gift shop, though somehow we weren\'t able to visit it after our tour - only before.  (That might have been our own logistics problem.)  The tour was good - the guide made several jokes.  It was a little disconcerting when he said the upper floors had caved in and the floors below us in the mine were flooded.  But from the tour, we got a real sense of the history and the hardship placed on the native people to work in the mine for the Spanish.    It was a worthwhile tour.

174963748.name: Digging into history
174963748.author: a TripAdvisor user
174963748.reviewBody: The tour takes you down a few hundred meters underground with a bilingual guide. Mining activities are depicted with some human figures here and there. One of them was a small girl carrying water on a ladder from the bottom of the mine. The guide said the deaths averaged one or two a day. I must rethink the next time I use silverware.\nThe mine includes an excellent rock and mineral museum from different regions of the world.

166862880.name: Amuzing, but not a "must" in Zacatecas
166862880.author: a TripAdvisor user
166862880.reviewBody: Compared to the excellent museums, the magnificent cathedral and the beauty of the city, this "Mina" falls short. It can be a fun experience, and the little "train" that gets you into the mine is really cool. If you only have 2 days to spend in Zacatecas, I believe there are more interesting things to do than a visit to the mine. But if you have more days, it can be a fun and constructive experience. The guides like to emphasize the story of the exploitation of the mine workers through time, so you can learn a bit of history about the colonial times, the nineteenth century and the current situation in Mexico.

161734841.name: "Cool" trip 540M into the earth
161734841.author: a TripAdvisor user
161734841.reviewBody: The trip takes you on a train down into the mine - 540 M below the surface.  It was funky - the tour guide, Jesus, was great - lots of interesting tips and stories about the mine.  Amazing how they dug silver and gold out and how the workers were indentured for life.  Although I didn\'t go to the bar it looked really cool - for another trip.  Well worth the visit.  Fee was about $80 pesos and please tip the guide!  At the end of the tour you can go out the exit that is just around the corner from the Teleferico which takes you up the Bufa Mountain - another cool trip.

159083439.name: Hairnets
159083439.author: a TripAdvisor user
159083439.reviewBody: Our guide made this a really interesting tour.  The hairnets made us all look like our GrandMothers.  Crystals on display were a bit bogus, as they come from all over the world.

156745214.name: Interesting tour, but...
156745214.author: a TripAdvisor user
156745214.reviewBody: This was an interesting tour, but you better know Spanish! I think it would have been 5 stars if I knew Spanish better. The guide spoke so fast so it was hard for me to keep up. The day I went, there were no English guides. You take a short train ride into the cave (less than five minutes) and there is a rock museum at the first stop. After the museum the general tour starts. The guide will point out things in the mine. The mine is ventilated and has nice facilities. Overall, even if you don\'t know Spanish, I would still recommend that you go. It is quite the experience to go inside a mine. Entry was 80 pesos. Enter at the west entrance, the main entrance (I think west is the direction), which is not the Teleferico entrance. After you are done with the tour, you have the option to ride an elevator to the east entrance that is a short walk to the el Teleferico, which I also recommend, or to go back to main entrance.

153404463.name: From cloud 9 to the depths of despair
153404463.author: a TripAdvisor user
153404463.reviewBody: Once you get off the Teleferico it is only a hundred or so steps to get to the Mine.  We do not speak Spanish and there was no English speaking guide at the Mine ..... until they phoned Daisy who came to give us the tour in English!

151563691.name: Worth a try
151563691.author: a TripAdvisor user
151563691.reviewBody: Entry was 80 pesos, it doesnt feel like a common mine and IMO its worth the money. Lots of people inside. Guides try to be funny. Not sure if they have tours on english... come on! dont push me to write 50 words or I will have to say useless stuff like this last line.

148437046.name: Unique fun underground
148437046.author: a TripAdvisor user
148437046.reviewBody: Meeting with friends for some nightclub dancing at Mina El Eden is fun. The cover charge is a little steep ($150 pesos), but you are seeing an attraction as well as going to a club. A fast little train takes you way down underground into a huge, dug out cave with colorful lights, modern tables and chairs and a DJ spinning dance tunes with videos. Table service is good - the meseros are attentive, efficient and polite. Micheladas and standard cocktails are all tasty, and at decent prices for a specialty club. Giant, clean bathrooms. Start your night out on the Zacatecas town here - definitely a refreshing, unique experience!

144978070.name: very cool and informative...
144978070.author: a TripAdvisor user
144978070.reviewBody: been there a couple times... the tours are really informative but in spanish. there is one guide who is great....very colorful and entertaining. there is a club there that opens up at night...ive never been there...but from what ive seen at a distance it looks really nice.

143162400.name: Wow!
143162400.author: a TripAdvisor user
143162400.reviewBody: Been to some mines in Europe and South America and this one has nothing to envy from them. I mean, wow.\nAnyways, if you get the chance, also go to Grutas de Garc\u00eda, near Monterrey, that mine is just mind-blowing.

132151924.name: Interesting Tour
132151924.author: a TripAdvisor user
132151924.reviewBody: That gives you an impression of the mine where back in the days  workers (often children) died on a daily basis in order to make few people rich.

131351045.name: Down, down, down
131351045.author: a TripAdvisor user
131351045.reviewBody: Guides like to tell more superstition than fact, but still a fun/interesting thing to do.

128655524.name: Nice trolly ride, not worth your time
128655524.author: a TripAdvisor user
128655524.reviewBody: The small train ride threw the mine was fun. The rocks they show you are not a big deal. If you have time, you should check it out, if not don\'t worry about it you are not missing much.

123280694.name: History of Zacatecas
123280694.author: a TripAdvisor user
123280694.reviewBody: The tour was in Spanish.  Ask if there is an English-speaking guide available if your Spanish is not good.

122519309.name: Nice to see
122519309.author: a TripAdvisor user
122519309.reviewBody: Nice to see, but not really very spectacular. I had been here on an earlier visit, but it hadn\u00b4t left a great impression.

122155697.name: Loved it
122155697.author: a TripAdvisor user
122155697.reviewBody: They provide student discount if it applies. A guide is provided as well as hard hats. The tour takes about 45 minutes to 1.5 hours. Make sure you bring a jacket since it get really cold inside of the mine.The guide we had was fun and upbeat with very useful information. They have a shop all the way at the bottom and a small museum of minerals. Not what I expected at all never having been to a mine. Should be on everyone\'s list if visiting Zacatecas

120643362.name: Interesting!
120643362.author: a TripAdvisor user
120643362.reviewBody: My wife and I visited the Mina on November 7, 2011.  I knew mining was important to Zacatecas so seeing this mine, even if it\'s inactive, was informative. Our guide was good.  I\'m glad we visited.

118126724.name: Extremely interesting tour even if you don\'t know Spanish
118126724.author: a TripAdvisor user
118126724.reviewBody: This mine opened in 1586 and was used to mine gold and silver. Actual mining ceased in 1960 due to the location of the mouth of the mine within a heavily populated area. There is still gold and silver underground but the cost to build another entrance was prohibitive. As a tourist attraction, the mine is very interesting. You take a mine train into the mine and then get out and walk. All the tour guides speak only Spanish but with a slight knowledge of the language and paying close attention to the guide, you can understand the majority of the tour. There are quite a number of displays underground that also help describe how the mine worked. If you like the unusual, this is the place for you.

116960806.name: Need to know Spanish to get much information from this tour
116960806.author: a TripAdvisor user
116960806.reviewBody: This is an excellent trip, but we found that we were able to get very little information from the guide if you didn\'t have a good grasp of Spanish.  Although I am at the intermediate level in Spanish, she raced through her explanations and I found it hard to keep up.  That being said, it is very interesting to be in the mine.   Fee (around 70 pesos) includes train ride into the mine and tour.

115939389.name: Great place to explore the center of the earth
115939389.author: a TripAdvisor user
115939389.reviewBody: if you\'re planning to start the mina-teleferico-bufa route start here, the main entrance is at the bottom of the hill behind to IMSSTE (the city\'s general hospital) this place is crazy scary, as well as secure fun and full of history!, you go inside the mine in a little train ride that lasts about 5 minutes once inside the guided tour lastes about 1 or 2 hours depending o the season, if it\'s high season they explain less and they make it quick.....\n\nat the end of the tour you have two options go back in the little train or take the elevator to the top of the mountain, take the elevator and walk to the teleferico, and ginish your day at cerro de la bufa, you can take a taxy from there to the centro historico or to your hotel, in case there are no taxis on top of the hill just walk down the hill to the road at the foothill and take it from there

68469604.name: A Must See
68469604.author: a TripAdvisor user
68469604.reviewBody: To get into the mine "El Eden":\nFirst, you purchase your tour tickets, then get your helmets on.  Then, you\'ll have to take a short train ride into the mine, a couple of mine\'s where it get really dark.  In the cave you get to see a beautiful display of various rocks collected, that are formed in caves like that.  There is also a mini store in side to purchase any souvenirs and rocks of your choice. I was just WOWED with the crystals, that I couldn\'t stop taking pictures.  Our tour guide was excellent. She explain in details different parts of the mine, how the people used to work in there, survival methods and some history.  The mine is so big inside, that I recommend to take some comfortable walking shoes and don\'t forget to take your cameras.  There is also a club INSIDE the mine, where you can attend from Thursday thru Sunday from 10:30 pm to 3 am.  No joke. I wasn\'t able to atten since, I had my daughter on this trip. But, from what I\'ve heard from other friends that it get pretty good. \nThe mine is really big and lots to see.  Try not to miss this opportunity in your life time.

33622528.name: Don\'t miss the mine
33622528.author: a TripAdvisor user
33622528.reviewBody: We took the lift into the mine from the upper entrance (near the cable car). Even though we could hardly understand anything the guide said and certainly didn\'t follow all the spanish jokes, you only had to look at the size of the underground workings to make the trip worthwhile.  When we got to the end of the tour and reached the disco/museum area it turned out we were the only people who wanted to exit where we came in (by the lift). All the others boarded the train - leaving us to walk all the way back, the way we had come, back to the lifts. Walking on our own through the mine was a great addition to the experience.

16255372.name: Spanish speakers only
16255372.author: a TripAdvisor user
16255372.reviewBody: Unfortunately I can\u00b4t speak Spanish, and found after the first 5 minutes of looking at and appreciating the enormity of the mine, that the rest of the tour was wasted on me. If you can understand Spanish you will probably enjoy it, otherwise I found it a very long, cold hour not being able to understand any of the stories.

10068250.name: Mine of Eden
10068250.author: a TripAdvisor user
10068250.reviewBody: You can\'t go to Zacatecas, Mexico without visiting the Mine of Eden. You take a train down about 2,000 feet and tour an ancient mine that produces silver, gold, and many other minerals. The tour is about an hour and the guides are very informative.
