I highly recommend going down.\nAlso, if your there on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday, go back at 10:00pm to the club in the mine. It is an experience of a lifetime.

8501493.name: Entertaining experience
8501493.author: a TripAdvisor user
8501493.reviewBody: My family and I just visited "Mina El Eden" and we all found it to be enjoyable.  We were impressed of how much there was to see.  My only complaint was that our tour guide was kind of soft spoken so it was a little difficult to hear towards the back of the crowd.  This is definitely one of the attractions worth checking out.  Note: Remember that the mine runs one way and has an entrance at each end.\n

3930421.name: it was great
3930421.author: a TripAdvisor user
3930421.reviewBody: it was the greatist thing i ever saw but u know wut it was very cold my parents grew ther and know that i went i just loved it i wish i was back over in zacatecas it a great place for the tourist and im sure ull love and want to go back especially now that ther is a disco place and youll be able to party all night\n

3240028.name: Zacatecas is wonderful,beautiful and a great vacation place
3240028.author: a TripAdvisor user
3240028.reviewBody:
Do not die until you visit Zacatecas.
Is a wonderful place where you can meet great people and have fun days.

Zacatecas has a lote of atraction,museums,great hotels like: Mina El Eden,
La Bufa and more

1621935.name: Two trips to see the hard work of the native people of Mex.
1621935.author: a TripAdvisor user
1621935.reviewBody: My first visit was in 1995 (18 yrs old), to the mine, my fathers home state. As I\'ve been to Zac. many times before, I first took the chance when I traveled myself to Mexico. I was very interested to see the bigger things that Mexico has to offer and learn. It was quite impressing to see such beauty in the work of the native people of Mexico. Mina de El Eden was in works for many decades and has many triumphant tales and history to Mexicos growth. The second trip to La Mina de El Eden was with my wife and son in 2002. The same feelings came and even more as before. To learn and cherish the Mexican history. \nMy experience was great, and i will continue my learning of my roots.

1483587.name: Truly a Historical Garden of Eden!
1483587.author: a TripAdvisor user
1483587.reviewBody: Many things in Zacacatecas caught my attention (Aqueduct,bullfighting ring turned 5 star hotel,highrise cablebox transport,etc.).But of historical significance,the "Eden Mine" is top dog.The train ride to the center of the mountain(decent speed) is a great start.A feeling of leaving the world that we know behind and transporting yourself to a time when abusive backbreaking work is all men from mining times knew.When you get off the train (mini train),the first thing you notice on you left is a little cave/art & crafts shop.In front of the train is,believe it or not,a DISCO/Bar that opens up to the public at night.The tour begins to the right,a large walkway blasted and chipped away by miners collecting silver and gold from the most productive mountain of the time.There is a sense of awe to learn how this seven tier silver and gold mine(walkway is level 4,all 3 levels below are flooded,look up and you see 3 more levels) were all accessed with a system of ropes.Average life span:35 years!This silver Vien runs straight through Guanajuato & Queretaro.Exit is by elevator to another walkway towards the street but don\'t stop there,go down that street to the cablebox transport that takes you to the "Cero de la Bufa"(museum,shops,great view of the city,etc.)then take a taxi down.Anyway in my opinon Zacatecas is the Top Dog in Mexico and the "Eden Mine" historically the the top dog in Zacatecas.

514930.name: The Mine is One Way Ticket mien herr.
514930.author: a TripAdvisor user
514930.reviewBody:
The poor sunburned Germans obviously didn't read Spanish or a tour book or they would have know the tour of the mine is one way.  You enter from the side from the teleferico (cable car) and exit on the other side of the hill via a mine train.  Or, you enter via the mine train and exit at the teleferico.  Then, it's up to the Bufa to see the museum and the monuments to the battle of Zacatecas.

Don't get the wrong idea.  The folks at the mine probably didn't speak English, much less German.

I loved it and have taken my students there repeatedly.

496448.name: Zacatecas, Mine "Eden".
496448.author: a TripAdvisor user
496448.reviewBody:
I had a very bad experience in the &#8222;Eden&#8220; Mine in Zacatecas.
When we left the mine we found out that the guide had sent us to another entrance than the one we started our tour. So we stood there with three small children not knowing where we are and how to get back to our car. The personal refused to let us go back the way we came with the comment that since we left the mine our ticket  is not valid any more. So eventually we found the way to the main-entrance where the management of the mine still insisted that their personal was right not helping us to find our way back.
So we left Zacatecas with burned skin because of the long walk in the sun and a very bad remembrance.

405940.name: Deep in the Heart of Zacatecas
405940.author: a TripAdvisor user
405940.reviewBody:
Until I spent two hours exploring the depths of the Mina El Eden, I never would have believed the etent to which the Spanish overlords brutally exploited the indigenous peoples of Mexico.

The awesome beauty of the mine belies the capacity of Iberian colonialists to utilize children as pack animals for the "glorification" of the Spanish monarchy whose greed for gold and silver was ostensibly insatiable. The Eden was Spain's most productive mine of gold and silver for many centuries.

Young men, at some no more than twelve years old, would spend an average of fourteen hours a day for six days a week breaking and lifting huge pieces of ore-laden rock and loading them into mule-driven carts. Most of them would never live beyond their thirty-fifth birthday.

After about 400 years of such herculean toil, one generation after the next managed to chip away a huge cavern in the Earth.

Today, one can see their magnificent legacy, deep below the streets of charming Zacatecas.

Here, not only does the visitor see veins of gold and silver above his head but also thinks about the incongruity of the lives of the wealthy versus those of the humble poor.

571674365.name: Central spot
571674365.author: a TripAdvisor user
571674365.reviewBody: This is a great place to eat and hang out with friends. During many of Zacatecas\u2019 festivals, there is live music!

471545247.name: Enjoying the evening
471545247.author: a TripAdvisor user
471545247.reviewBody: If you like coffee, cultural events, talk with old friends, this is just the place you are looking for in Zacatecas. It is also good for discussing business and writing (anything you prefer).

470965118.name: What is not to like?
470965118.author: a TripAdvisor user
470965118.reviewBody: Not sure what the rest of the year is like regarding weather but it has been phenomenal.  This corner of the world is gorgeous, quiet, quaint, romantic.  I want to come back.

446154587.name: Cute plaza with patio dining
446154587.author: a TripAdvisor user
446154587.reviewBody:
This is a very small plaza, tucked away in a corner one street parallel to Hidalgo Ave, just past the Iglesia San Agustín. By day, it's quiet and mostly deserted, as there is nothing but a statue and a bench or two. But by dusk, it transforms into a charming little space with a few patio dining restaurants adorned with white lights and candles on the tables. The restaurants also have indoor dining in rooms with trendy modern decor. 

This is a nice area to stroll, along with Hidalgo Avenue and Plaza Juarez the next block over.  

Enjoy Zacatecas!

598321832.name: Wonderful museum
598321832.author: a TripAdvisor user
598321832.reviewBody: It is certainly worth while to visit this museum with a mix of all things zacatecno. A highlight is the Huichol collection and the fantastic tapestries.

509462933.name: Download the App!!
509462933.author: a TripAdvisor user
509462933.reviewBody: It was so cool until we realized that if you download the museum\'s app that you can see the paintings moving through your phone!! That made the experience even more cool than seeing everything as is. I would definitely go again - wonderful experience!!

484658353.name: Enjoy when visiting La Bufa
484658353.author: a TripAdvisor user
484658353.reviewBody: Try to go to there while you are in La Bufa, nice history museum, it is cheap and nice.  I love Zacatecas.

473649695.name: History of Zacatecas
473649695.author: a TripAdvisor user
473649695.reviewBody: For one who speaks only limited Spanish, I was still able to gain an appreciation of the history of this area. It would have been helpful if videos had subtitles, however the other displays were well done. The Huichol art was truly amazing.

429537605.name: A trip to the Zacatecas mint
429537605.author: a TripAdvisor user
429537605.reviewBody: The visit to the museum was interesting and I particularly enjoyed seeing all the early coins and notes. the only disappointing part for me was that they had fabulous video\'s of the history of Zacatecas but it was all in Spanish.

371865057.name: Loved seeing the Huichol the most
371865057.author: a TripAdvisor user
371865057.reviewBody: This was a good museum to visit to learn more about the history of Zacatecas. I especially enjoyed seeing the Huichol art as they use vibrant colors and beautiful patterns. Mostly we saw their "string art" and I was hoping to see more of their beaded art, but it was still worth going.

357345701.name: Very interesting !
357345701.author: a TripAdvisor user
357345701.reviewBody: The Zacatecano Museum gives you a quick history of  Zacatecas.  They have a lot of info on the Huichol people.  One of the museum employees suggested i watch one of the films they had to learn more about this group of people.

337645211.name: The huichol part is the best
337645211.author: a TripAdvisor user
337645211.reviewBody: It has a bit of history, art, religious items and indigenous art. So, it\'s highly recommendable if you want a bit of everything. I really liked the part of huichol art, it\'s big and colorful. For children, there\'s also an interactive part that seems quite interesting.

289613608.name: Good overview
289613608.author: a TripAdvisor user
289613608.reviewBody: It is a nice place to get an overview about the city and the state of Zacatecas. Good explanation about "Huicholes" (local indigenous group) and some important events in Zacatecas history. However, this place needs more objects and more information about the building itself.

285174527.name: Not to miss
285174527.author: a TripAdvisor user
285174527.reviewBody: Very educational and told with great detail by local tour guides. A must to see and then make sure to hit the tram that gives you an oversight of the city. That day the King of Spain came in,  there were plenty of activities going on in the city and the view ......perfect

268114890.name: I could not believe it
268114890.author: a TripAdvisor user
268114890.reviewBody: The collection of displays is a tribute to the region. I did not expect such comprehensive offerings that depict the heart and soul of the people of Zacatecas. The audio/visual information is very well done, but it is in Spanish only. The examples of Huichol culture and art is a remarkable tribute to the complexity and spirituality of the indigenous people. Do stop at the museum shop for some well priced art and crafts.

263457551.name: Local History Including Huichol Culture
263457551.author: a TripAdvisor user
263457551.reviewBody: Excellent presentation of art and history of the local area.  Housed in the former mint, with description of how coins were minted in the 18th century to present day.  Displays of Huichol art and culture,including the annual migration from Jalisco and Nayarit through Zacatecas to San Luis Potos\u00ed.

262719632.name: An interesting look into the history of Zacatecas ... a must if you want to grasp what life was like in the past!
262719632.author: a TripAdvisor user
262719632.reviewBody: An interesting look into the history of Zacatecas ... a must if you want to grasp what life was like in the past!

260973049.name: Excellent !
260973049.author: a TripAdvisor user
260973049.reviewBody: We are not much for musiums but this one is interactive and without even noticing it we spent 3 hours in it.  Very very interesting !

234214901.name: Another "must see" in a city full of "must see\'s"
234214901.author: a TripAdvisor user
234214901.reviewBody: For a relatively small city (130,000), Zacatecas has an awful lot of sites one "must" do and sights one "must" see, including this wonderful collection of huichol art. I was there for five full days only saw two other gringos. This city has so much to offer the visitor in terms of art, culture and history it\'s a shame more of us don\'t get there to enjoy it.

217097971.name: Very good section of arte huichol
217097971.author: a TripAdvisor user
217097971.reviewBody: Very interesting building and the section of huichol art was excellent. Do go and visit it. It is a nice place.

194218038.name: charming
194218038.author: a TripAdvisor user
194218038.reviewBody: not crowded, great selection of movies on history and art of the region, very helpful staff\nwonderful presentation of Antonio Pintor, the most amazing

192998861.name: Excellent museum
192998861.author: a TripAdvisor user
192998861.reviewBody: We went to this museum because they told us they had a great collection on Huichol art. \nWe were by far impressed. The museum has really good infrastructure with a lot of useful information. By luck we found Mr. Rodrigo Canales, the guardian. He\'s very knowleadgeable. If you have a chance, talk to him. I can assure you, you won\'t be dissapointed.\nThis museum is a must in Zacatecas.

150806731.name: An absolute must go to
150806731.author: a TripAdvisor user
150806731.reviewBody: This is a great museum to visit if you want to get an overview of Zacatecas. It has a little bit of everything: culture, economy, history, arts, and culture, but not too much of anything. Ideal for a family visit as the interactive audio-visuals are great and so well done that you don\'t have to speak Spanish to understand them.

143373168.name: Amazing Huichol collection
143373168.author: a TripAdvisor user
143373168.reviewBody: For one with a spattering of Spanish the attentiveness of the staff can\'t be faulted, we basically got a free lesson in Huicholi art and history (if you don\'t count the tip). Whilst there\'s a slightly discordant nature to the whole place each exhibit is fascinating to the right kind of person, and well laid out and labeled (at least compared to others in the city)

471546796.name: Camping under the stars
471546796.author: a TripAdvisor user
471546796.reviewBody: A beautiful place for camping, spectacular views and natural rock formations.\nBe careful with scorpions and criminal gangs.

5021048.name: My Visit to Sierra de Organos
5021048.author: a TripAdvisor user
5021048.reviewBody: For all nature lovers, this is the best place ever!! I have been there a few times. The area is a great place for hiking and climbing. I recommend August to October to visit. During this time the weather is great and all is so beautiful and green. The area has places to camp overnight.\n

3434852.name: the beautiful organos
3434852.author: a TripAdvisor user
3434852.reviewBody: I have been to the organos so many times and each time it gets better and better. It is so beautiful there and its great exercise. You get peace and quiet there and the fresh air is amazing usually the best time to go is in august or september when everything is in full bloom.\n

671651065.name: A stupendous view of the city!
671651065.author: a TripAdvisor user
671651065.reviewBody: This is a short but striking view of the city in the new cars just put in. It\'s a "must do" while in the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

666493200.name: Fun ride
666493200.author: a TripAdvisor user
666493200.reviewBody: Car stops completely for loading and off loading. It feels very stable and secure. The views are great and the speed is comfortable. Too short a trip!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

661447150.name: A fun trip thing to do
661447150.author: a TripAdvisor user
661447150.reviewBody: Great trip up with an excellent city view. Well worth doing. We did the return trip as this put us close to the mine tour

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

655252377.name: What a treat!
655252377.author: a TripAdvisor user
655252377.reviewBody: We visited Zacatecas in February 2019; the weather was perfect.  Cool in the evenings and sunny and warm in the daytime.  The air was clear and beautiful.  We heard there was a cable car to take in the view and I had my doubts about traveling up in the air over the city.  But it was such a lovely experience!  The cable cars are brand new (from Switzerland?) and very comfortable.  The ride was short, unfortunately.  You can see for miles!  Photo opportunities of the colorful buildings below abound.  Very reasonably priced.  The cafe at the top, where you can sit and admire the view, is another wonderful feature.  We ate pastries, coffee and mezcal.  It was such an enjoyable afternoon.  Don\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

637743614.name: Nice view of the city
637743614.author: a TripAdvisor user
637743614.reviewBody: Love it, you have an opportunity to see the city from the top , also can take you to la Bufa and have a nice city view

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

633932640.name: Great view of city
633932640.author: a TripAdvisor user
633932640.reviewBody: It is one of the must do\u2019s when you are in Zacatecas especially if it\u2019s a clear day you see a great deal of city I would recommend doing it early day instead of afternoon due to sun position for better picture takin. Do climb to top to see chapel and plaza de revolution

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

599080545.name: Worth every penny
599080545.author: a TripAdvisor user
599080545.reviewBody: A grand vista of the city from the inside of a small cable car. If you\'ve been to Medellin, these are similar. The ride is one way or roundtrip. Pay a little more and ride with a glass bottom! Don\'t miss the Camera Oscura exhibit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

595039667.name: A must-visit local attraction!
595039667.author: a TripAdvisor user
595039667.reviewBody: They just reopened this attraction, all new system, very nice, clean and most important...reliable! Tip: some gondolas have transparent floor, try to ride one of those.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

589845178.name: The teleferico is working!
589845178.author: a TripAdvisor user
589845178.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the short ride with amazing views of the City of Zacatecas and surrounding areas.  You can see views from the hills too, but we really enjoyed this.  It is absolutely brand new system (originally started in the 1880\'s), so spanking clean and very safe..  La Bufa, which is at the top of the teleferico, is has essentially a written history of Zacatecas.  With my basic Spanish, I only understood a little.  I thought the teleferico.  it was worth the approximately US $5 it cost ($8 round trip).  We walked down and had lunch in the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

588289609.name: Bufa
588289609.author: a TripAdvisor user
588289609.reviewBody: I rated and commented on bug a which is the hill you traverse over to.\nDon\'t miss this spectacular ride. The view and accommodations were first rate

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

577702638.name: Not working
577702638.author: a TripAdvisor user
577702638.reviewBody: Too bad it was not working, we could see they are working on getting it going again, fantastic view from up there!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

568753506.name: Very disappointed
568753506.author: a TripAdvisor user
568753506.reviewBody: It\u2019s very sad, that is still Under Construction for so long...\nI hope they get done soon.. but don\u2019t miss the beautiful panoramic view from el cerro de la buffa... :)

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

567213492.name: Disappointed again
567213492.author: a TripAdvisor user
567213492.reviewBody: I\u2019ve taken the telef\u00e9rico before and it\u2019s a chance to see beautiful views of the city. However, the last 2 times that I went (September 2016 and March 2018), I brought huge groups and it was under construction.  Supposedly it\u2019ll be open by the end of March. I appreciate that they are concerned about our safety, but I would think that they\u2019d make it a priority to fix it ASAP since they loose so much money when it\u2019s closed.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

564730371.name: Under construction
564730371.author: a TripAdvisor user
564730371.reviewBody: We were so disappointed that we couldn\'t go up in these trams.  They are obviously a pride of Zacatecas since they are in every gift shop on t-shirts and key chains etc.  It seems they are building a new system and I was told it would start running in March 2018.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

555629838.name: Excellent view, just loved using it
555629838.author: a TripAdvisor user
555629838.reviewBody: Really recommend taking it. You will find a nice surprise at the end of the journey. Make sure the weather is nice so you can enjoy the nice view.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

484101946.name: Hasn\'t worked since September 2016
484101946.author: a TripAdvisor user
484101946.reviewBody: We were two couples and were disappointed - this was one of the attractions we were looking forward to!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

450862778.name: Expected more
450862778.author: a TripAdvisor user
450862778.reviewBody: It\'s a simple ride back down from the cerro de la bufa, I don\'t know why the thing\'s even popular anyway, it seems to be a thing

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

444435048.name: Views!
444435048.author: a TripAdvisor user
444435048.reviewBody: A comfortable way to see the entire city of Zacatecas.  Enjoy the beautiful views over the historic sites and neighborhoods.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

440465873.name: OPERATION SUSPENDED INDEFINITELY
440465873.author: a TripAdvisor user
440465873.reviewBody:
We visited La Mina with the intention of riding the teleférico to La Bufa after the tour of the mine. This is no longer possible as the tram operation has been suspended indefinitely. 
Apparently, the Swiss-built, ski lodge style, two-person-per-car tram system built in the 1979, can no longer accommodate the daily tourist traffic. The government wants to update the system, which would greatly impact -and ultimately restructure - the neighborhoods below. Residents and environmental groups are currently duking it out with the government over the proposed expansion project. I wouldn't expect the teleférico - old or new - to be running any time soon. 
    You miss out on the bird's eye view of the city, but you can still go to La Bufa overlook by taxi (about 75 pesos) or climb the stairs and alleys through the town. I recommend taking a taxi to the hill, then walking DOWN the stairs. It takes about 20-30 minutes to walk back down and end up at the main Catedral de Zacatecas on Hidalgo. 
*I wouldn't walk through the neighborhoods at night; however, as the alleys are dark and could be dicey at night.  By day or sunset, it's very enjoyable. 

Hope that helps! Enjoy Zacatecas!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

410259210.name: Amazing views!
410259210.author: a TripAdvisor user
410259210.reviewBody: This is a must-do experience when traveling to Zacatecas.  The views from the Teleferico and the top of La Bufa are worth the 50 pesos each way.... we went before noon and there were no lines, and an uncrowded ride.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

409757750.name: Not a bad way to go up the hill
409757750.author: a TripAdvisor user
409757750.reviewBody: A panoramic view of the city awaits which you can enjoy from a bar, or you can take a walkto Cerro de la Bufa.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

402795221.name: Worth the Wait
402795221.author: a TripAdvisor user
402795221.reviewBody: The best way to get to the \u201cCerro de la Bufa\u201d is by the Teleferico. The only drawback is that it only has two cars, one going up and one going down. Each car is for 14 people approximately so it can be a long wait before you ride it.\nThe ride is fast but long enough to get a good view of the city from above. The ride can be a little expensive but worth the price and the wait. The best option will be to go to the Cerro de la Bufa by the Teleferico, walk around the place and then go back in a Taxi, maybe even better would be to go up to the Cerro de la Bufa by Taxi and then coming back in the Teleferico. You should schedule either option to complement a visit to \u201cMina el Eden\u201d because the Teleferico station on the \u201dCerro de la Grilla\u201d is a very short walk from the entrance to the mine.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

399369506.name: Fun way to see the city
399369506.author: a TripAdvisor user
399369506.reviewBody: Although quite expensive, it is worth it to travel across the city and then get a lovely view and a chance to walk around on the hill outside the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

399110075.name: Take it if you have never taken one before
399110075.author: a TripAdvisor user
399110075.reviewBody: For all who have never taken one before: go there. \nIf you have been to the Alps or in some US skiing area: skip it.\nWaiting times are long and the view is not very special

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

390724655.name: Nice views.
390724655.author: a TripAdvisor user
390724655.reviewBody: This is only 5-10 min ride but I think it is a must in visiting Zacatecas. It shows the views that could never be seen if you are on foot.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

385403459.name: Worth the effort. Good views
385403459.author: a TripAdvisor user
385403459.reviewBody: Only a 5 minute ride but good view of the city and easy way to get from La Bufa to the top entrance of Eden mine. No seating and very basic system Swiss made and looks to be well maintained

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

385033710.name: An Overall View
385033710.author: a TripAdvisor user
385033710.reviewBody: This Swiss built gondola gives you the best view of Zacatecas and the surrounding hillsides. Our conductor pointed out several interesting sights, such as the first Spanish house in Zacatecas. We took the Teleferico both ways, there is a discount for seniors with their Mexican DIF cards, but even if you do not have one . . . take the ride because the views are memorable and the church and museum at the top are a part of Zacateca\u00b4s history.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

384733734.name: I was going to give this a pass, but I\'m glad I didn\'t
384733734.author: a TripAdvisor user
384733734.reviewBody: I mean, you\'ve seen one ropeway and you\'ve seen them all, right? Well, yes, and no. I\'ve never been in one that crossed a city - especially from the entrance of a mine to top of a mountain with a statue of Poncho Villa.  There was something sort of wonderful and relaxing about passing over the city in the teleferico. Sort of leaving a rather interesting an unusual and slightly magical spot and passing over as if in a cloud into history of a 100 years ago. It it hard to describe, but well worth the ride. There was no line when I was there,and in fact I was the only one in the gondola, even though it was the first day of the festival (the one in March).

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

376304848.name: Fantastic view of City of Zacatecas
376304848.author: a TripAdvisor user
376304848.reviewBody:
Since I live in Zacatecas, I take visitor to the teleferico (cable car) and see the wonderful view of Zacatecas which
is a colonial city with many buildings built in the late 1800¨s and early 1900¨s. The cable car was inagurated in 1979 and the distance between Cerro de Bufa and Cerro de Grillo is approximately 654 meters traveling at a 
height of 85 meters overlooking the city. The trip takes about 4 minutes in high season and in low season approximately 7 minutes. Teleferico is open from 10AM to 6PM and on easter (semana santa), the teleferico
operates until 11PM at night.  I was not aware that they had special service in easter and plan to ride the
cable car next easter. The ticket costs 50 pesos for adults and 25 pesos for children.  You can take a taxi to
go to the top of Cerro de Bufa by taxi which costs around 150 pesos or less or you can take the teleferico from
Cerro de Grillo next to Hotel Baruk. You can walk there, but since the altitude is 2400 meters, it is better to
take a cab which costs around 50 pesos and 5 minutes away from the cathedral.  
Fantastic views of the city and there is a small church at Cerro de Bufa and some mexican restaurants and 
a lot of souvenir shops. You can also shop at the Cerro de Grillo gift shops as there are abundant silver
mines in the State of Zacatecas and silver works are famous here in Zacatecas.  Also, mezcal is also well known
in this region.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

360630464.name: Amazing views
360630464.author: a TripAdvisor user
360630464.reviewBody: The Zacatecas Cable Cars are a must do while here. The views are spectacular! The cars are a bit small so the wait in line can get long especially during vacation periods.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

358023174.name: Must do!
358023174.author: a TripAdvisor user
358023174.reviewBody: We went at 10 am when they opened and it was a great way to see the city.  I noticed when we returned about 2 hours later the line was super long.  It was well worth the ride.  The ride was smooth and the guide was very informative (only in Spanish).  The only bad part was that they have 12 people in each tram but you are still able to see and it was not muggy or hot since they had some of the windows open.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

357335228.name: the views !
357335228.author: a TripAdvisor user
357335228.reviewBody: Its fun riding the cable car.  It goes very slow so it feels very safe.  You get views of Zacatecas in all directions.  On the day i wanted to ride it  ,  it was windy so i could not because its not operated when the weather is windy.  Finally my last day in Zacatecas I was able to ride and enjoy !

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

344296147.name: Just ok
344296147.author: a TripAdvisor user
344296147.reviewBody: Ok service. Little pricy for what it is. Just does the trick. Long wait sometimes. Great view of downtown zacatecas. It s a try once thing.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

338452798.name: A must ride!!!
338452798.author: a TripAdvisor user
338452798.reviewBody: Put your fears aside, and jump on the "Teleferico". The most amazing views of the city are seen from here. The cost is reasonable, and worth it. Only a few minutes to get across, but worth it. The line was long, but only because it was closed the day before due to high winds. Get to the "Cerro de Bufa" much faster!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

337711620.name: Good way to get to the hikl
337711620.author: a TripAdvisor user
337711620.reviewBody: This is the main route to get up to the top of the hill to see panoramic views of the city. The attendants and friendly, bilingual and chat to you on the way up, interested in your views of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

334447673.name: Great view of the city
334447673.author: a TripAdvisor user
334447673.reviewBody: This is the way to get to La Bufa.  First tour the silver mine, then take the gondola to the top, visit the museums and zip line back down.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

333579645.name: Great view
333579645.author: a TripAdvisor user
333579645.reviewBody: It\'s a great view of the colony I believe the highest point is 85M but you get to see everything the beautiful colors and museums definitely worth checking out

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

332558401.name: Gets You Between El Ed\u00e9n and Cerro de La Bufa
332558401.author: a TripAdvisor user
332558401.reviewBody: MXP 50 each way, with view of Zacatecas as you travel between El Ed\u00e9n and Cerro de La Bufa. According to the cable car operator, they are due to upgrade the cable cars to all-glass units that give better views. Not sure when that will be done though.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

331450928.name: great experience
331450928.author: a TripAdvisor user
331450928.reviewBody: contrary of what I read regarding reviews, It does not look old and unsafe, it is save and very well maintained, actually new equipment is coming, not because It is needed because It is a different equipment that can come and go on the same zip line. Guide were excellent  and now very well buildings and story, the view is awesome!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

328021184.name: Enjoy the Views
328021184.author: a TripAdvisor user
328021184.reviewBody: It\'s a long walk down from the hill top where a taxi drops you off to the entry for the cable car ride  but the views are spectacular.  The cable car descent is rapid and you\'re standing, jammed in with other people so you don\'t really get to see much.  The museum on top hill disapponting as all in Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

327194632.name: This has to be on your list!
327194632.author: a TripAdvisor user
327194632.reviewBody:
Zacatecas is a beautiful place! so you can imagine the wonderful view during this ride. Depending on the season the line can be long or short, also you have to watch out for the weather, they are professional enough to handle this situations. 

One sure thing is you wont regret taking this ride and a long line is totally worth it! 

Best of luck and enjoy the view :)

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

323259300.name: A quick ride
323259300.author: a TripAdvisor user
323259300.reviewBody: To get to the top of la bufa, the teleferico is the fastest way. The problem is that it is often so crammed full that picture taking is not easy.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

317222144.name: Queue is way too long.
317222144.author: a TripAdvisor user
317222144.reviewBody: Reaching this place requires you to take a taxi to the top of the mountain. If you bring your car you will have a hard time getting back to the mountain (you will pay a taxi anyway). The teleferico cars are quite old and you might feel a little bit unsafe, specially if wind starts rocking your cabin in mid air. Queue took TWO HOURS and I heard it could take up to three.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

315048196.name: Worth the trip !!
315048196.author: a TripAdvisor user
315048196.reviewBody: Great view of the city. Worth the visit and the park at the top is quite beautiful.\nGood eats and stalls with the usual trinkets for sale\nExcellent museum

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

306134220.name: Amazing views
306134220.author: a TripAdvisor user
306134220.reviewBody: The teleferico provides a fun ride across a portion of the city, with amazing views and an informative guide who rides with you.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

305331925.name: Stunning views
305331925.author: a TripAdvisor user
305331925.reviewBody: Great views from high above town although they do cram a lot of people into the cars! Worth using the cable car in one direction up to the top but better to walk down

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

298127615.name: Take your camera nad ejoy the exceptional views of Zacatecas..
298127615.author: a TripAdvisor user
298127615.reviewBody: Great views   and the person that takes you on the Telesferico  explain  with great details to you places you are seeing and places to go as well of any question you may have about Zacatecas...

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

292917453.name: Great way to see the city
292917453.author: a TripAdvisor user
292917453.reviewBody: The ride itself is not that long, but it gives you plenty of opportunities to take very nice photos over the city.\n\nIt also spares you the time to walk up / down to "Cerro de la Bufa". This is not a public transportation and serves only as a tourist attraction.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

289609299.name: Perfect view
289609299.author: a TripAdvisor user
289609299.reviewBody: Just perfect if you want to travel from "el grillo" to " la Bufa". Nice place to take pics. In my opinion is kind of expensive(8 dollars round trip) considering the distance and how much it takes.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

286964815.name: Terrific view!
286964815.author: a TripAdvisor user
286964815.reviewBody: Great attraction. I am terrified of heights so it was definitely a challenge. But the ride is very smooth and the city looks gorgeous from up top. The guide was very knowledgeable and gave us great suggestions of what museums to visit and gave us a nice history of the city and of all the different architectural views we could see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

281904780.name: One of many musts in the city
281904780.author: a TripAdvisor user
281904780.reviewBody: Very good vistas of the city, worth the walk, but consider that it will take you to the other side of the city, I would suggest just take it in one direction and get transport from the other side back to downtown.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

275049959.name: Easy & fun!
275049959.author: a TripAdvisor user
275049959.reviewBody: Nice shortcut to the central city, fast, safe, professional, not expensive, great view & fun! Great city!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

270485722.name: Nice way to go to La Bufa
270485722.author: a TripAdvisor user
270485722.reviewBody:
The view is great !...

You can see the all city and it's also a nice way to go to the La Bufa mountain whithout walking to much.

If possible go in the morning because in the after lunch it's busy and you may have to wait a couple of hours.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

270400003.name: Short ride, but long on impressions
270400003.author: a TripAdvisor user
270400003.reviewBody: After visiting the Minas, wandering in the heart of what had been one of the great silver-bearing mountains in Zacatecas, my wife and I decided once we were nearby to take the teleferico across the city to the opposite hill. State-of-the-art cable construction gave us perfect confidence to think about what we were seeing, not whether we would tumble into the central plaza. The small cabin only hold a small number of travelers and the operator is very cordial and eager to talk. It was great seeing the sights we had visited the previous three days on terra firma. One can only envy the many birds circling above the city--I hope they appreciate the views, we surely did!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

268116229.name: So cool
268116229.author: a TripAdvisor user
268116229.reviewBody: What a rush....don\'t miss it for sensational views of the city. It\'s a bit difficult to find on foot, but well worth the experience. Take a cab from town to avoid a lengthy walk if you are impeded in any way.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

267626575.name: Overall view of Zacatecas
267626575.author: a TripAdvisor user
267626575.reviewBody:
This is a nice way to enjoy the beauty of Zacatecas and have an overall view of the city.

I believe that taking the teleférico during the evening (with the city lights) would be even better! 

You can buy the tickets directly in there but It is also a good option to check for tours that include the transportation to the Cerro de la Bufa, visit the Mine and the Teleférico plus you get to know some interesting facts about  Zacatecas from the guides.

Some hostels can sell discounted tickets as well, ask them.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

266817143.name: Average attraction
266817143.author: a TripAdvisor user
266817143.reviewBody: I have to say I was a bit disappointed when I finally hopped in the teleferico. The ride is very short, and it was too crowded, I couldn\'t really see that much of the city. Was able to take about 2 or 3 pictures, but I was expecting more.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

264342610.name: Very nice. Check the waiting time before you stand in line; avoid if more than 30 mins
264342610.author: a TripAdvisor user
264342610.reviewBody: A nice experience as it allows you to have a general sky view of Zacatecas. The telef\u00e9rico guide was quite amicable. We stood in line for about 35 mins; and it\'s a one way ticket. You need to buy another ticket at the other end if you wish to return via telef\u00e9rico. You can walk down the mountain too; waiting time was over one hour for the ride back. It costs 50 pesos for a one way ticket.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

264261838.name: nice view of the city
264261838.author: a TripAdvisor user
264261838.reviewBody: This is also a highlight of your vsit to Zacatecas, you can get a panoramic view. Maybe they need a new Cart but it is nice.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

262709872.name: Amazing ... a must if visiting Zacatecas!
262709872.author: a TripAdvisor user
262709872.reviewBody: Amazing ... a must if visiting Zacatecas! It takes you from the upper part of Downtown Zacatecas all the up to Cerro de la Bufa ... very good views and well worth the pesos and the wait!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

261567185.name: Lovely view
261567185.author: a TripAdvisor user
261567185.reviewBody: Safe, comfortable, even for those afraid of heights as I am.  There were fairly high winds that day and the tram didn\'t even rock.  Great views.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

260810267.name: Really good way to see the city
260810267.author: a TripAdvisor user
260810267.reviewBody: worth taking this ride from la Bufa to the la Mina de eden.  You can take amazing pictures from that vantage point.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

259028074.name: La Bufa
259028074.author: a TripAdvisor user
259028074.reviewBody: What a great ride to the top and also the views of Zacatecas were awesome!  The tram drivers were very engaging and could anwser any questions thrown at them.  Nice way to spend part of your day!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

257056050.name: For people who know mountains or skiing, not very spectacular
257056050.author: a TripAdvisor user
257056050.reviewBody:
The teleferico is treated as one of the main events in Zacatecas, but actually it's not very spectacular. The view is nice, the ride is short, the waiting time unacceptable, the organization simply bad.
Personally I would not recommend to ride the teleferico without checking what the current waiting time is. Even if the line seems short, the waiting time can be very long, in both ways.
If you want to ride anyway, just do it only one way!
At the top of the hill or at the ground station, you will find easily a taxi.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

254872226.name: Quite a ride!
254872226.author: a TripAdvisor user
254872226.reviewBody: It was a windy day so a bit of a hard ride for me that have problems with heights but a nice experience and a nice view.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

253093310.name: A Must Do!
253093310.author: a TripAdvisor user
253093310.reviewBody: At 50 pesos a trip, this must be done!  The cable car crosses the city while the operator points out all the landmarks. At the top of the mountain you are presented incredible vistas of the city, a pleasant walk, a great museum and a lounge (if you have a thirst after the walk). We really enjoyed this trip!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

252802417.name: Awesome view of Zacatecas
252802417.author: a TripAdvisor user
252802417.reviewBody: Its was a quick ride but the view was awesome. I recommend doing the Mina el eden trip first then take the teleferico in to the bufa.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

248333551.name: 1st time great.
248333551.author: a TripAdvisor user
248333551.reviewBody: It was pretty nice to view the city and houses from that height it was our first time and it was fun.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

247872090.name: You will wait and wait!
247872090.author: a TripAdvisor user
247872090.reviewBody: Long lines to get off the mountain start at about 3:00. Waited almost an hour so time your departure well!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

245687524.name: Fun trip up to the top!
245687524.author: a TripAdvisor user
245687524.reviewBody: I took the cable car to the top to view the city and explore the museum, church and revolutionary square of \'La Bufa\'. The ride itself was fun, but at 50 Mex dollars a throw, I decided to walk down which is really easy due to the numerous easy to walk routes down.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

240880553.name: View from Above
240880553.author: a TripAdvisor user
240880553.reviewBody: I mean, you have to do it.  You walk anywhere around town and you can see the teleferico above you, so you might as well hope on.  We opted for the steep hike up the side (which took much longer than the 7 min teleferico ride) and then hoped on.  You have a nice view of the city on the way and it drops you off right next to the Mina el Eden if you are so inclined.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

238286355.name: Great View
238286355.author: a TripAdvisor user
238286355.reviewBody: Loved it; it was slow enough to get an excellent view of the great city and to hear about information being told.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

237894335.name: teleferico
237894335.author: a TripAdvisor user
237894335.reviewBody: wonderful 8 minute ride the bathrooms located near the ticket office are stunning, beautiful and modern lavatories, something that you will not see often, if i remember well, they were made in green marble.  there is also a bar behind.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

237674586.name: Great view
237674586.author: a TripAdvisor user
237674586.reviewBody: The view from the cable car is really nice, and the operator told us a lot of things about the city and the buildings even though the ride is quite short. It costs 150 pesos, but you can easily walk back down to the city from the top of the hill or take a taxi with less than 80 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

235379964.name: Nice view of the city
235379964.author: a TripAdvisor user
235379964.reviewBody: The journey only last a couple of minutes but it\'s worth it and very cheap, you can see almost any point of downtown Zacatecas, your hotel, the Cathedral, The Bull ring Quinta Real...etc...

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

234945731.name: Swing over the city
234945731.author: a TripAdvisor user
234945731.reviewBody: A great view of Zacatecas that puts this town into its geographical context.we took it to the top of the Cerro de la Bufa and then strolled slowly down. A lovely walk.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

234213337.name: Great fun!
234213337.author: a TripAdvisor user
234213337.reviewBody: LOVED THIS RIDE. This ride not only gives one a great perspective on Zacatecas (which is chopped up into little sections) and the surrounding countryside, it\'s just plain old fun. Did not have to wait for more than a few minutes. Was the only gringo present, which was pretty much my experience the five days of my stay.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

232300263.name: Interesting
232300263.author: a TripAdvisor user
232300263.reviewBody: it\'s inexpensive. Great view from above. Luckily there was no line when I went. make sure you take good walkiing shoes. I would go again, it\'s nice to go up to the Cerro de la Bufa.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

219869469.name: cable car
219869469.author: a TripAdvisor user
219869469.reviewBody: good way to see the city and surrounding area from the air. inexpensive and safe. take it round trip from the cerro Grillo or one way from cerro Bufa. that way you can walk down the hill from Grillo to the center of town.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

219812858.name: Great view, Small cabin, 1 hr wait.
219812858.author: a TripAdvisor user
219812858.reviewBody: The view from the cabin is very good, but I would not ride it agai. First af all for the waiting time. It would have been good if they had a waiting time before purchasing tickets. Especially in the Bufa end. Very long line which you can not see until you buy a ticket. Then wait for a long time to ride. The mine end is not so bad. So if you purchase here, just purchase one way and get back in a taxi from the Bufa side. Not worth the return trip.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

217097531.name: Good view
217097531.author: a TripAdvisor user
217097531.reviewBody: That is all good view of Zacatecas, nothing more. I Returned to town walking, not worth it, take it back

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

214663304.name: Views for Days
214663304.author: a TripAdvisor user
214663304.reviewBody: A great way to travel from La Mina del Eden to El Cerro de La Bufa. Get to see the entire city, relax, and enjoy the diverse history of Zacatecas, Zac

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

212958335.name: only for the ride
212958335.author: a TripAdvisor user
212958335.reviewBody: at 50 pesos each way it is a bit expensive. however I recommend you to take one way and then go back by taxi. the ride is ok but one way is enough.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

208078600.name: Amazing
208078600.author: a TripAdvisor user
208078600.reviewBody: I went here for a school trip in 2004 (March) and was so afraid to do this but it was not as scary as I thought.  I would do it again in a heart beat.  Great opportunity for pictures and to really see the city. There were plenty of opportunities to pick up souvenirs on the paths leading to the tram.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

203483666.name: Good sight, bad pictures.
203483666.author: a TripAdvisor user
203483666.reviewBody: The view is magnificent, but the driver (?) wasn\'t engaged into providing information at all. The cabin has tinted windows which spoil the photographs.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

201535538.name: avarage quality
201535538.author: a TripAdvisor user
201535538.reviewBody: there is not much things to see from the telefrico cabin except for the city view...but the sites near the arrival station are worth the trip...

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

196674351.name: Great views
196674351.author: a TripAdvisor user
196674351.reviewBody: The ride took about ten minutes. Our guide spoke English and pointed out some historical information.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

182679392.name: Interesting Ride
182679392.author: a TripAdvisor user
182679392.reviewBody: Took a taxi from Centro (50 Pesos, a bit high) to the City end at 09:15.  Did not realize it doesn\'t open until 10.  Ride across the city is about 5 minutes,  provides good views and gives a nice perspective and orientation of the city centre.  The cost was 40 Pesos each way.  It was worth the ride to enable a tour of the Cerro de la Bufa.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

182294550.name: Nice view for a few pesos
182294550.author: a TripAdvisor user
182294550.reviewBody: We had a very knowledgable cabin attendant and enjoyed the view for about 5 minutes,\nthe souvenirs and "native" extra are superfluous, but good bird\'e eye view on a sunny day!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

174964955.name: "Over"view
174964955.author: a TripAdvisor user
174964955.reviewBody: The ride gives you a quick overview of the picturesque city. I wish we had more time in the air, but it still afforded a nice view angle. The city is colourful with some beautiful buildings such as churches. The ride is not really a must in the city. We took a taxi to get to la Buffa (higher end) but you could do return trip with Teleferico with only slightly more Pesos.The lower end is near an entrance to la Mina el Eden.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

166863060.name: Too brief, nothing special
166863060.author: a TripAdvisor user
166863060.reviewBody: Although it is cheap (50 pesos, about 4 USD) I don\'t think it is worth the price. The ride is too short and the guide talks all the time, so it is difficult to appreciate the view and to enjoy it in silence. I enjoyed more being in the mountain where the ride ends, than in the cable car.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

159083824.name: Wow!
159083824.author: a TripAdvisor user
159083824.reviewBody: What a great view of the city.  It was a very windy day when we took the Teleferico (we were staying at Hotel del Bosque - now Hotel Baruk) and were puzzled by the pricing for the tram ride.  We hadn\'t "copped" to the "senior" deals, and our collective Spanish was not good enough to appreciate the "round-trip" pricing advantage, so we felt a bit ripped off when paying for two on-way passes for the round-trip.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

153404047.name: Museum closures
153404047.author: a TripAdvisor user
153404047.reviewBody: Recent reviews have hit the nail on the head.  The Teleferico is a one of a kind experience. A word of advice ...... the museums in Zacatacas close on rotating days of the week.  If you are hoping to see the museum about the Revolution and Pancho Villa best to check before you go across.  The ride is still worth the trip and the Cable operators can fill you in on a lot of the sights as you go across.  There is also a zip line at the top, but again, check to see if it is open before you cross.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

150807189.name: A fun experience
150807189.author: a TripAdvisor user
150807189.reviewBody: Spectacular views giving you a completely different perspective of the city. Go on th Teleferico and then spend time on Cerro de la Buffa which it connects to and you will have an enjoyable and different experience.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

150193662.name: Great fun!
150193662.author: a TripAdvisor user
150193662.reviewBody: Spectacular views are only half the story. Once you take the cable car ride over to the mountain you also get to enjoy a beautiful church and museum in addition to outdoor restaurants for lunch, some touristy shops (nothing very interesting) and a zip ride for the more adventurous!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

149163494.name: short and nice view
149163494.author: a TripAdvisor user
149163494.reviewBody: nice challenge if anyone is height wary, short enough not to worry.  Gives perfect "big picture" of city, setting the scene to further understand historical significance of sites and city

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

148248721.name: Fun Afternoon View
148248721.author: a TripAdvisor user
148248721.reviewBody: At the suggestion of a local Zacatecan friend, I enjoyed a relaxing, scenic afternoon on the Teleferico. Beautiful blue skies, the colorful city below, the massive climbs up stone-lined hills and incredible views of the area made it all well worth the price to ride across to the bufa and back. Our guide was humorous, resembling a Mexican Andy Warhol, pointing out attractions in the city below as we glided overhead. The bufa offers lovely walking terrain (wear comfortable shoes) - views for miles, statues of Pancho Villa and other figures of Mexican history, and a lovely old edificio made of famous pink stone found in Zacatecas. Recommended for a romantic stroll, climbing with kids or just venturing out on your own.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

146835398.name: Must-do in Zacatecas
146835398.author: a TripAdvisor user
146835398.reviewBody: Great views of the city from the teleferico and the hill, and the ride itself is interesting. Clean, easy to access; do it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

146456455.name: Lets go !!!
146456455.author: a TripAdvisor user
146456455.reviewBody: While you are walking around this historic city you will notice the cable car pass back and forth all day. So the thing to do is go take a ride yourself. Be ready to walk up a long flight of stairs to get to the main station, or take a taxi if you are a smoker.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

143162259.name: Incredible view
143162259.author: a TripAdvisor user
143162259.reviewBody: If you go to Zacatecas, you most definitely wanna try the Telef\u00e9rico. With it, you are gonna get an incredible aerial view of the city.. plus, you end at another mountain in which there\'s a little pretty church and a little mountain you can climb if you are into climbing!\nBest pictures from Zacatecas are from there. You can see all the peaks of the various churches around the city and the amazing cathedral!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

131501099.name: Ride above the city of Zacatecas.
131501099.author: a TripAdvisor user
131501099.reviewBody: First of all the \'chairlift\' from one side of the city valley to the other is just a nice and cheap way to see the city if you are there.  One side is among the city and an easy stroll through quaint streets and sidewalks. The other side which it takes you to is the high point of the city and offers great views of the city. There is an old fortress now a museum, a LONG zipline (and i mean long), places to eat and some rocks to climb if you chose to climb a little higher.  If you are near Zacatecas i would suggest you go. It is different from most mexican cities. Lots of beautiful architecture, comfortable weather, tour buses and bull fighting (if thats your thing), many charming cafes and well lit buildings at night. The nightlife was not my favorite but they had a few discos and pubs.  I think couples might enjoy this place more.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

131356720.name: Great way to see the city- esp. at night!
131356720.author: a TripAdvisor user
131356720.reviewBody: This is a great way to see the city of Zacatecas- if you\'re not afraid of heights.  Also it is very cool at night!

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

122155505.name: Must do
122155505.author: a TripAdvisor user
122155505.reviewBody: Though it can be a hassle walking up the stair filled streets, since we didn\'t drive to it, it was one of the highlights of the trip. You can take a round trip on it for $100 pesos. if you drive and get there at a reasonable hour you can do the mine right next door to it (everything in the area closes at 6). We decided to just take it up and got a taxi back down to the city. In the Teleferico a guide is provided, providing a tip is recommended. He gives you basic information on Zacatecas and little quips. Also mentions the must do museums. Definitely recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

120643329.name: Not much to it but a staple
120643329.author: a TripAdvisor user
120643329.reviewBody: My wife and I took the Tel\u00e9ferico from the Mina El Ed\u00e9n to the Cerro de la Bufa on November 7, 2011.  The guide was bored, the view of Zacatecas was nice, but once is enough.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

116728709.name: One of the 1001 Places to See before you die
116728709.author: a TripAdvisor user
116728709.reviewBody: We happened to be in Zacatecas for a folk festival and had some free time. Our hotel was literally next to the Teleferico. We happened to get there on a quiet day so there was no waiting in line. The cable car ride gave us an amazing view of the city. The person at the controls also spoke English so he gave us the highlights of the city as we went on our 6 minute ride. \n\nThe Teleferico took us to La Bufa, which wasn\'t the highest point of the city but provided a great view. There were a few statues of Pancho Villa as well as some other revolutionaries since this happened to be a key site of the Mexican Revolution. When we walked further out toward the main road leading up to La Bufa, we found a zip line outpost. For 150 pesos, you\'re able to zip line through a canyon and back, making this  one of the 1001 places TO die. It seemed scary at first but it was actually a relaxing ride. Going down a steep waterslide is more frightening. I would definitely recommend taking the teleferico at least once.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

115938743.name: Best Views of the best part of the city"
115938743.author: a TripAdvisor user
115938743.reviewBody: you can\'t say you visited  Zacatecas if you havent been to the Mina el eden, teleferico, and to the Cerro de La Bufa, just a great way to start your stay in this city

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

38979021.name: Do Not Miss
38979021.author: a TripAdvisor user
38979021.reviewBody: This is a short ride across the city to El Cerro De La Bufa.  It cost about $2.00 each way and is well worth the money.  You take the cable car ride with overlooks the city.  It is especially beautiful at night, it cost a little more at night, but well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Del Grillo S/n, Col. Bancomer

633778727.name: Great visit to the Theater Caldron
633778727.author: a TripAdvisor user
633778727.reviewBody: In the old center of Alcoi is the Theatre Caldron. I went there recently to watch the Russian State ballet assembly performing ballet pieces from fairytale & classic stories. Wonderfull. Lots of atmosphere, good seating and being relatively small,  close to the stage. Accoustics were also good. Price very accepatable if 24 euros. Comfortable & warm theatre. Also lots of restaraunts, tapas bars & cafes, with the theater being located in the old town center.

579342426.name: Great Theatre with frequent performances
579342426.author: a TripAdvisor user
579342426.reviewBody: This imposing building is beautiful in itself, but the most important thing that unlike most other Mexican old theatres, performances are frequent. I had an opportunity of seeing a local flamenco group. What it lacked in authenticity and sheer visceral power, it certainly compensated with enthusiasm. Sadly, the auditorium was half empty.

241865884.name: Dark
241865884.author: a TripAdvisor user
241865884.reviewBody: Unfortunately, there were no performances scheduled here during my (too) brief visit to Zacatecas. It\'s a beautiful rather restrained building with an impressive lobby.

232776955.name: Amaizing outside and entrance
232776955.author: a TripAdvisor user
232776955.reviewBody: The inside is beautiful, however it looks rather modern, but the outside is an eye candy without mentioning the colonual entrance to the theater.

214663975.name: Gentrified Beauty
214663975.author: a TripAdvisor user
214663975.reviewBody: Zacatecas is a historical city that has gentrified many of its buildings to serve the needs of a 21st Century population. Teatro Calderon is just one of these amazing places. The city is safe, the culture is popping, the walking is great, and the food, I can\'t even explain.

166864138.name: Well preserved, worth a visit
166864138.author: a TripAdvisor user
166864138.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful old theater, very well preserved and elegant. If there\'s a spectacle in there while you\'re in Zacatecas, it must be great.

147999982.name: Cool Beatles cover show ... almost surreal ... in this kind of retro theater ...
147999982.author: a TripAdvisor user
147999982.reviewBody: We stayed in Zacatecas in September and didn\'t really want to go out to a bar and there was a cool Beatle covers concert in the main hall of the Theater ... really cool and almost surreal given how intricate the ols theater is inside ... super-cool and worth a tour or an event.

137841668.name: In the centre of town opposite the Market Building...
137841668.author: a TripAdvisor user
137841668.reviewBody: The early silver miners took a lot of money out of this town.. but some did put a little back in the form of some lovely old buildings... this is one of them..  It is always open and you can wander in and around with your camera and admire the place.    previous reviewers have mentioned that a lot of children use the building and this is correct, as there always seems to be something going on here.

54232549.name: Beautiful
54232549.author: a TripAdvisor user
54232549.reviewBody: when we were there in the summer of \'08 you could walk in in the evenings and heck it out. Groups of children were rehearsing and there was always actvity there.  Down the steps from the Theatre dont forget to go into the "El-vis" bar and have a victoria beer. Nice little place for a beer and a snack

454140623.name: Brief but informative
454140623.author: a TripAdvisor user
454140623.reviewBody:
This is a small museum right in the middle of central Zacatecas. If you have an hour to kill and want to learn about how criminals, "heretics",  bold women/ "witches", and anyone who behaved "outside the norm" were tortured and controlled, take the tour through this museum. It costs 40 pesos ($2), and takes about an hour. 
You must tour with the provided guide, who is very informative. The tour and all signs are in Spanish. Tips are encouraged, but not required. I'm not sure if they offer tours every hour or just when they collect enough people. I waited about 20 minutes and the group was about 8 or 9 people, which was a bit too large for the small rooms.
You first walk up a flight of stairs, and then weave in and out of about 6 or 7 small rooms, often exiting through the same doorway you entered. It's very dark (to set the mood), and the wood floor planks are uneven in some places, and sometimes the doorways have a small lip, so watch your step. There's no wheelchair access. 
For each room, the guide explains the  historical time frame, purpose of the instruments of torture (type of pain infliction), and reasons for punishment (victims).
In sum, this is a cheap, quick tour that can be fit in between or after other activities. This museum is open until 8pm, so it's a good activity to do after all the other museums and sites have closed.

Hope that helps! Enjoy Zacatecas!

436166275.name: Museo de Inquisicion
436166275.author: a TripAdvisor user
436166275.reviewBody: The tour was free because we did a bus tour and it offered free admisssion to the Museo, but was not part of the bus tour. Good place to visit if you have a time to spare. Our tour guide was very good and informative. If you are very religious then this may not be the place for you. I would recommend it.

426102321.name: Very informative
426102321.author: a TripAdvisor user
426102321.reviewBody: This Museum is small, $40 pesos to get in, but that includes a tour guide.   The guide was good, funny, despite the serious topic mentioned in the Museum: Inquisition.  He applied it to the city, which torturing devices were used in Zacatecas.

357383968.name: Recommended if you have a little while to spare
357383968.author: a TripAdvisor user
357383968.reviewBody: This museum is small so it does not take that long to be done here.  One important thing, you cant wander on your own , there is a guide that shows you around.  My guide was Magdalena and she was great , she really knew her history of the inquisition.

268006072.name: Inquisition tools explained
268006072.author: a TripAdvisor user
268006072.reviewBody: Took the tour at  La Casa del Inquisidor where the guides walk you through the exhibition while explaining about the use of those evil, torture tools. \nThe tour was fun and doesn\'t last long, not recommended to people with disabilities. \n

266538943.name: Inquisition in Mexico - Not to bad as in Spain
266538943.author: a TripAdvisor user
266538943.reviewBody: Even thou Inquisition is something "big" in Catholic Church, it doesn\'t seem too creepy when you walk into this museum. Very average, i would prefer Guanajuato\'s Mummy museum for that taste.

260973208.name: Interesting
260973208.author: a TripAdvisor user
260973208.reviewBody: need to take your time looking and analizing the way the things work - - - work of the inventive Church.

241865140.name: Okay
241865140.author: a TripAdvisor user
241865140.reviewBody: I would rate this museum as only average. Somehow I would have expected to be more horrified or grossed out.  Maybe it\'s just because the museum shows the banality of evil...

232725279.name: Nice museum
232725279.author: a TripAdvisor user
232725279.reviewBody: The tour through the museum was pretty scary and fun. The information provided was very educative. The place was clean and everywhere you turned the walls were nicely decorated

262720171.name: Grear to walk by and admire!
262720171.author: a TripAdvisor user
262720171.reviewBody: Grear to walk by and admire! This is a great architectural and historical site to just stride by and admire, even better if on a tour to grasp its historical significance!

itemReviewed.name: Bad Night Palace (Palacio de la Mala Noche)

599080780.name: Really fantastic. A feast for the eye!
599080780.author: a TripAdvisor user
599080780.reviewBody: Well explained and beautifully presented, the camera oscura is an invention of the Middle Ages that led to photography. Not to be missed, especially for kids.

address.streetAddress: Estacion del Teleferico Cerro de la Bufa

502899129.name: Surprisingly interesting
502899129.author: a TripAdvisor user
502899129.reviewBody: It is worth spending 30 pesos. You will be able to see in real-time projection of important places of city Zacatecas from a bird\'s perspective. The image is projected on a large white dish using the principle invented by Leonardo da Vinci.

address.streetAddress: Estacion del Teleferico Cerro de la Bufa

484658840.name: an old Tradition
484658840.author: a TripAdvisor user
484658840.reviewBody: This is a very local tradition, being held every year, people from all ages participate in a simulation of war.

641362700.name: read up some of the history beforehand
641362700.author: a TripAdvisor user
641362700.reviewBody: It\'s a good museum, very new and modern. But I recommend going to the museum of Zacatecan history before coming here or reading some of the history of the Mexican revolution so you can better understand the info presented there as not the whole history of how came the revolution about, etc. is presented,  but only the parts vital to the battle that tool place around this mountain.

address.streetAddress: Explanada Cerro de la Bufa s/n

611612822.name: Not much of a museum
611612822.author: a TripAdvisor user
611612822.reviewBody: As history museums go, this one is very small and only covers the battle of Zacatecas, which was very important, but not enough to make for a good museum experience.  If you don\'t speak Spanish well, you won\'t understand anything.  By all means go to La Bufa for the view, but serious history hobbyists can skip this one.  I bought the last beautiful book ($600 pesos) that the museum offers, and will learn much more from that book.  (It\'s in Spanish.)

address.streetAddress: Explanada Cerro de la Bufa s/n

444720882.name: If you want to see Huichol Art, this is the place
444720882.author: a TripAdvisor user
444720882.reviewBody: We explored this museum just to see the indigenous Huichol art/culture exhibit. Their yarn art is beautiful as is its symbology.

address.streetAddress: Explanada Cerro de la Bufa s/n

385036396.name: Mexican History
385036396.author: a TripAdvisor user
385036396.reviewBody: I love history and this Museum gives a great explanation of a famous Mexican Revolution Battle. There are photographs of the aftermath, we forget that horses were an integral part of every battle and unfortunately also a part of the casualties. Zacatecas had the mint for Spain, Mexico and Germany at this time and whomever captured the Mint also had sufficient funds for much needed battle equipment and supplies. The museum also tells the story of the different factions and how some who chose to retreat were treated, this museum is great for history buffs and for education.

address.streetAddress: Explanada Cerro de la Bufa s/n

357353258.name: Great location !
357353258.author: a TripAdvisor user
357353258.reviewBody: The Toma Museum in Zacatecas commemorates the famous battle that took place during the Mexican Revolution in which Pancho Villa\'s forces defeated  government troops.  Also when your done hear you can check out the great views from the Cerro de la Bufa.

address.streetAddress: Explanada Cerro de la Bufa s/n

298130600.name: Excellent museum ,,to learn about Mexico history
298130600.author: a TripAdvisor user
298130600.reviewBody: Take time to read and to listen to the explanations and learn about the history of Mexico.\nTake a picture with Pancho Villa on the video...

address.streetAddress: Explanada Cerro de la Bufa s/n

269474595.name: A great and fun museum
269474595.author: a TripAdvisor user
269474595.reviewBody:
this is one of the best interactive museums i have ever been. it is great for families and fun for children.
the history is extremely well depicted and.
it is not a big museum, but is very direct on what it has, and, i insist, very entertainig for children.
we are a family with small children and we all had fun learning about the history of this great place.

address.streetAddress: Explanada Cerro de la Bufa s/n

612357501.name: great location for photography
612357501.author: a TripAdvisor user
612357501.reviewBody: this, along with the adjacent hotel, make it a gem in Zacatecas, make sure you visit or just drive by at a  minimum.

599372935.name: Come in the evening
599372935.author: a TripAdvisor user
599372935.reviewBody: Because it turns pink at dusk. Most of the cantera stone in Zacatecas is pink, and the aqueduct is no exception. Best if seen from the restaurant in the Quinta Real.

571675193.name: History
571675193.author: a TripAdvisor user
571675193.reviewBody: It\u2019s unbelievable that this structure stills stands in Zacatecas! Thinking about how Zac got it\u2019s water through this aqueduct is amazing.

571135327.name: Easy to find, very good photo opportunities
571135327.author: a TripAdvisor user
571135327.reviewBody: Our Garmin led us right to this site. Parking was tight, but side roads may present some opportunities for parking. In the area there\'s a really nice park too.

548042950.name: Zacatecas Aqueduct
548042950.author: a TripAdvisor user
548042950.reviewBody: one of the main attractions of the city is its aqueduct, which is located at the entrance to the city, it is worth visiting and admiring it.

471211045.name: Stunning
471211045.author: a TripAdvisor user
471211045.reviewBody: Where else can you see something like this in the Americas?  Not speaking of modern ones I mean.  It is free, it is beautiful, and goes right through some of the streets.  Not sure what is not to like, if only for a short walk by.

454202719.name: Beautiful architecture
454202719.author: a TripAdvisor user
454202719.reviewBody:
You can't miss this acqueduct and its beautiful arches as you drive into town. As far as I could tell, the acqueduct center is underground and can't be visited. But this structure is great for pictures in the early evening against the pink clouds with the Cerro La Bufa in the background. The grass area across the street from Parque Sierra de Alicia and above the Hotel Quinta Real is the best place to stand to photograph it. 
It also presents photo opportunities at night when it is lit. Stroll through Parque Sierra de Alicia across the street until the sun begins to set, then return to the acqueduct and snap a few more pictures. In an hour, I took about 10 stunning photos of the acqueduct in various stages of sunset. Then walk back to the park to watch the night fountain show. 

Enjoy Zacatecas!

447175495.name: An exquisite architectural site
447175495.author: a TripAdvisor user
447175495.reviewBody: Beautifully restored, magnificent and photogenic site. Have a look at it in the morning and in late afternoon. Those pink stones, the way it was constructed and the sheer greatness of the structure mad a great impression. Make sure you look at it from inside the hotel Quinta Real - a true architectural gem in itself.

385340544.name: Interesting Feature
385340544.author: a TripAdvisor user
385340544.reviewBody: You can not escape passing the Aqueduct as the main street passes underneath. This aqueduct is interesting because it reminds one of the fact that before the common practice of bringing water to the home by means of underground pipes, water was delivered to citizens by means of an aqueduct. Europe used this system for generations and the same design has been transferred to several large cities in Mexico. One thing that makes this aqueduct interesting is that one drives under this aquaduct and there do not seem to be protective barriers to protect the aging brick work. It is a fine architectural feature and requires no special time, but go and then cross the street to visit the park.

357356291.name: Very impressive !
357356291.author: a TripAdvisor user
357356291.reviewBody: I dont know what year it was constructed.  I am assuming it was built during the times Mexico was under the rule of the Spanish Empire.  When i first saw the Zacatecas Aqueduct it sort of reminded me of the one I saw in Segovia Spain.

323255758.name: A beautiful setting
323255758.author: a TripAdvisor user
